category.pattern: THIS DOMAIN NAME STATUS INDICATES THAT IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO UPDATE THE DOMAIN WHICH CAN HELP PREVENT UNAUTHORIZED UPDATES RESULTING FROM FRAUD . IF YOU DO WANT TO UPDATE YOUR DOMAIN YOU MUST FIRST CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR AND REQUEST THAT THEY REMOVE THIS STATUS CODE
category.template: This domain name status indicates that it is not possible to update the domain, which can help prevent unauthorized updates resulting from fraud. If you do want to update your domain, you must first contact your registrar and request that they remove this status code.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE TELLS YOUR DOMAIN S REGISTRY TO REJECT REQUESTS TO UPDATE THE DOMAIN
category.template: This status code tells your domain's registry to reject requests to update the domain.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS INDICATES THAT IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO TRANSFER THE DOMAIN NAME REGISTRATION WHICH WILL HELP PREVENT UNAUTHORIZED TRANSFERS RESULTING FROM HIJACKING AND / OR FRAUD . IF YOU DO WANT TO TRANSFER YOUR DOMAIN YOU MUST FIRST CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR AND REQUEST THAT THEY REMOVE THIS STATUS CODE
category.template: This status indicates that it is not possible to transfer the domain name registration, which will help prevent unauthorized transfers resulting from hijacking and/or fraud. If you do want to transfer your domain, you must first contact your registrar and request that they remove this status code.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE TELLS YOUR DOMAIN S REGISTRY TO REJECT REQUESTS TO TRANSFER THE DOMAIN FROM YOUR CURRENT REGISTRAR TO ANOTHER
category.template: This status code tells your domain's registry to reject requests to transfer the domain from your current registrar to another.

category.pattern: OFTEN THIS STATUS INDICATES AN ISSUE WITH YOUR DOMAIN THAT NEEDS RESOLUTION . IF SO YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR TO RESOLVE THE ISSUE . IF YOUR DOMAIN DOES NOT HAVE ANY ISSUES AND YOU SIMPLY WANT TO RENEW IT YOU MUST FIRST CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR AND REQUEST THAT THEY REMOVE THIS STATUS CODE
category.template: Often, this status indicates an issue with your domain that needs resolution. If so, you should contact your registrar to resolve the issue. If your domain does not have any issues, and you simply want to renew it, you must first contact your registrar and request that they remove this status code.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE TELLS YOUR DOMAIN S REGISTRY TO REJECT REQUESTS TO RENEW YOUR DOMAIN . IT IS AN UNCOMMON STATUS THAT IS USUALLY ENACTED DURING LEGAL DISPUTES OR WHEN YOUR DOMAIN IS SUBJECT TO DELETION
category.template: This status code tells your domain's registry to reject requests to renew your domain. It is an uncommon status that is usually enacted during legal disputes or when your domain is subject to deletion.

category.pattern: OFTEN THIS STATUS INDICATES AN ISSUE WITH YOUR DOMAIN THAT NEEDS RESOLUTION . IF SO YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR TO RESOLVE THE ISSUE . IF YOUR DOMAIN DOES NOT HAVE ANY ISSUES BUT YOU NEED IT TO RESOLVE YOU MUST FIRST CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR AND REQUEST THAT THEY REMOVE THIS STATUS CODE
category.template: Often, this status indicates an issue with your domain that needs resolution. If so, you should contact your registrar to resolve the issue. If your domain does not have any issues, but you need it to resolve, you must first contact your registrar and request that they remove this status code.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE TELLS YOUR DOMAIN S REGISTRY TO NOT ACTIVATE YOUR DOMAIN IN THE DNS AND AS A CONSEQUENCE IT WILL NOT RESOLVE . IT IS AN UNCOMMON STATUS THAT IS USUALLY ENACTED DURING LEGAL DISPUTES NON-PAYMENT OR WHEN YOUR DOMAIN IS SUBJECT TO DELETION
category.template: This status code tells your domain's registry to not activate your domain in the DNS and as a consequence, it will not resolve. It is an uncommon status that is usually enacted during legal disputes, non-payment, or when your domain is subject to deletion.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS INDICATES THAT IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO DELETE THE DOMAIN NAME REGISTRATION WHICH CAN PREVENT UNAUTHORIZED DELETIONS RESULTING FROM HIJACKING AND / OR FRAUD . IF YOU DO WANT TO DELETE YOUR DOMAIN YOU MUST FIRST CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR AND REQUEST THAT THEY REMOVE THIS STATUS CODE
category.template: This status indicates that it is not possible to delete the domain name registration, which can prevent unauthorized deletions resulting from hijacking and/or fraud. If you do want to delete your domain, you must first contact your registrar and request that they remove this status code.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE TELLS YOUR DOMAIN S REGISTRY TO REJECT REQUESTS TO DELETE THE DOMAIN
category.template: This status code tells your domain's registry to reject requests to delete the domain.

category.pattern: THIS IS AN INFORMATIVE STATUS SET FOR A LIMITED PERIOD OR YOUR DOMAIN S TRANSFER TO A NEW REGISTRAR . IF YOU DID NOT REQUEST TO TRANSFER YOUR DOMAIN YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR ORIGINAL REGISTRAR
category.template: This is an informative status set for a limited period or your domain's transfer to a new registrar. If you did not request to transfer your domain, you should contact your original registrar.

category.pattern: THIS GRACE PERIOD IS PROVIDED AFTER THE SUCCESSFUL TRANSFER OF A DOMAIN NAME FROM ONE REGISTRAR TO ANOTHER . IF THE NEW REGISTRAR DELETES THE DOMAIN NAME DURING THIS PERIOD THE REGISTRY PROVIDES A CREDIT TO THE REGISTRAR FOR THE COST OF THE TRANSFER
category.template: This grace period is provided after the successful transfer of a domain name from one registrar to another. If the new registrar deletes the domain name during this period, the registry provides a credit to the registrar for the cost of the transfer.

category.pattern: ALTERNATIVELY SOME REGISTRY OPERATORS OFFER A REGISTRY LOCK SERVICE THAT ALLOWS REGISTRANTS THROUGH THEIR REGISTRARS TO SET THIS STATUS AS AN EXTRA PROTECTION AGAINST UNAUTHORIZED UPDATES . REMOVING THIS STATUS CAN TAKE LONGER THAN IT DOES FOR CLIENTUPDATEPROHIBITED BECAUSE YOUR REGISTRAR HAS TO FORWARD YOUR REQUEST TO YOUR DOMAIN S REGISTRY AND WAIT FOR THEM TO LIFT THE RESTRICTION
category.template: Alternatively, some Registry Operators offer a Registry Lock Service that allows registrants, through their registrars to set this status as an extra protection against unauthorized updates. Removing this status can take longer than it does for clientUpdateProhibited because your registrar has to forward your request to your domain's registry and wait for them to lift the restriction.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS MAY INDICATE AN ISSUE WITH YOUR DOMAIN THAT NEEDS RESOLUTION . IF SO YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO RESOLVE THE ISSUE . IF YOUR DOMAIN DOES NOT HAVE ANY ISSUES AND YOU SIMPLY WANT TO UPDATE IT YOU MUST FIRST CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR AND REQUEST THAT THEY WORK WITH THE REGISTRY OPERATOR TO REMOVE THIS STATUS CODE
category.template: This status may indicate an issue with your domain that needs resolution. If so, you should contact your registrar for more information or to resolve the issue. If your domain does not have any issues, and you simply want to update it, you must first contact your registrar and request that they work with the Registry Operator to remove this status code.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE LOCKS YOUR DOMAIN PREVENTING IT FROM BEING UPDATED . IT IS AN UNCOMMON STATUS THAT IS USUALLY ENACTED DURING LEGAL DISPUTES AT YOUR REQUEST OR WHEN A REDEMPTIONPERIOD STATUS IS IN PLACE
category.template: This status code locks your domain preventing it from being updated. It is an uncommon status that is usually enacted during legal disputes, at your request, or when a redemptionPeriod status is in place.

category.pattern: ALTERNATIVELY SOME REGISTRY OPERATORS OFFER A REGISTRY LOCK SERVICE THAT ALLOWS REGISTRANTS THROUGH THEIR REGISTRARS TO SET THIS STATUS AS AN EXTRA PROTECTION AGAINST UNAUTHORIZED TRANSFERS . REMOVING THIS STATUS CAN TAKE LONGER THAN IT DOES FOR CLIENTTRANSFERPROHIBITED BECAUSE YOUR REGISTRAR HAS TO FORWARD YOUR REQUEST TO YOUR DOMAIN S REGISTRY AND WAIT FOR THEM TO LIFT THE RESTRICTION
category.template: Alternatively, some Registry Operators offer a Registry Lock Service that allows registrants, through their registrars to set this status as an extra protection against unauthorized transfers. Removing this status can take longer than it does for clientTransferProhibited because your registrar has to forward your request to your domain's registry and wait for them to lift the restriction.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS MAY INDICATE AN ISSUE WITH YOUR DOMAIN THAT NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED PROMPTLY . YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR TO REQUEST MORE INFORMATION AND RESOLVE THE ISSUE . IF YOUR DOMAIN DOES NOT HAVE ANY ISSUES AND YOU SIMPLY WANT TO TRANSFER IT TO ANOTHER REGISTRAR YOU MUST FIRST CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR AND REQUEST THAT THEY WORK WITH THE REGISTRY OPERATOR TO REMOVE THIS STATUS CODE
category.template: This status may indicate an issue with your domain that needs to be addressed promptly. You should contact your registrar to request more information and resolve the issue. If your domain does not have any issues, and you simply want to transfer it to another registrar, you must first contact your registrar and request that they work with the Registry Operator to remove this status code.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE PREVENTS YOUR DOMAIN FROM BEING TRANSFERRED FROM YOUR CURRENT REGISTRAR TO ANOTHER . IT IS AN UNCOMMON STATUS THAT IS USUALLY ENACTED DURING LEGAL OR OTHER DISPUTES AT YOUR REQUEST OR WHEN A REDEMPTIONPERIOD STATUS IS IN PLACE
category.template: This status code prevents your domain from being transferred from your current registrar to another. It is an uncommon status that is usually enacted during legal or other disputes, at your request, or when a redemptionPeriod status is in place.

category.pattern: OFTEN THIS STATUS INDICATES AN ISSUE WITH YOUR DOMAIN THAT NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED PROMPTLY . YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR TO REQUEST MORE INFORMATION AND RESOLVE THE ISSUE . IF YOUR DOMAIN DOES NOT HAVE ANY ISSUES AND YOU SIMPLY WANT TO RENEW IT YOU MUST FIRST CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR AND REQUEST THAT THEY WORK WITH THE REGISTRY OPERATOR TO REMOVE THIS STATUS CODE . THIS PROCESS CAN TAKE LONGER THAN IT DOES FOR CLIENTRENEWPROHIBITED BECAUSE YOUR REGISTRAR HAS TO FORWARD YOUR REQUEST TO YOUR DOMAIN S REGISTRY AND WAIT FOR THEM TO LIFT THE RESTRICTION
category.template: Often, this status indicates an issue with your domain that needs to be addressed promptly. You should contact your registrar to request more information and resolve the issue. If your domain does not have any issues, and you simply want to renew it, you must first contact your registrar and request that they work with the Registry Operator to remove this status code. This process can take longer than it does for clientRenewProhibited because your registrar has to forward your request to your domain's registry and wait for them to lift the restriction.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE INDICATES YOUR DOMAIN S REGISTRY OPERATOR WILL NOT ALLOW YOUR REGISTRAR TO RENEW YOUR DOMAIN . IT IS AN UNCOMMON STATUS THAT IS USUALLY ENACTED DURING LEGAL DISPUTES OR WHEN YOUR DOMAIN IS SUBJECT TO DELETION
category.template: This status code indicates your domain's Registry Operator will not allow your registrar to renew your domain. It is an uncommon status that is usually enacted during legal disputes or when your domain is subject to deletion.

category.pattern: IF YOU PROVIDED DELEGATION INFORMATION ( NAME SERVERS ) THIS STATUS MAY INDICATE AN ISSUE WITH YOUR DOMAIN THAT NEEDS RESOLUTION . IF SO YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR TO REQUEST MORE INFORMATION . IF YOUR DOMAIN DOES NOT HAVE ANY ISSUES BUT YOU NEED IT TO RESOLVE IN THE DNS YOU MUST FIRST CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR IN ORDER TO PROVIDE THE NECESSARY DELEGATION INFORMATION
category.template: If you provided delegation information (name servers), this status may indicate an issue with your domain that needs resolution. If so, you should contact your registrar to request more information. If your domain does not have any issues, but you need it to resolve in the DNS, you must first contact your registrar in order to provide the necessary delegation information.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE IS SET BY YOUR DOMAIN S REGISTRY OPERATOR . YOUR DOMAIN IS NOT ACTIVATED IN THE DNS
category.template: This status code is set by your domain's Registry Operator. Your domain is not activated in the DNS.

category.pattern: ALTERNATIVELY SOME REGISTRY OPERATORS OFFER A REGISTRY LOCK SERVICE THAT ALLOWS REGISTRANTS THROUGH THEIR REGISTRARS TO SET THIS STATUS AS AN EXTRA PROTECTION AGAINST UNAUTHORIZED DELETIONS . REMOVING THIS STATUS CAN TAKE LONGER THAN IT DOES FOR CLIENTDELETEPROHIBITED BECAUSE YOUR REGISTRAR HAS TO FORWARD YOUR REQUEST TO YOUR DOMAIN S REGISTRY AND WAIT FOR THEM TO LIFT THE RESTRICTION
category.template: Alternatively, some Registry Operators offer a Registry Lock Service that allows registrants, through their registrars to set this status as an extra protection against unauthorized deletions. Removing this status can take longer than it does for clientDeleteProhibited because your registrar has to forward your request to your domain's registry and wait for them to lift the restriction.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS MAY INDICATE AN ISSUE WITH YOUR DOMAIN THAT NEEDS RESOLUTION . IF SO YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR TO REQUEST MORE INFORMATION AND TO RESOLVE THE ISSUE . IF YOUR DOMAIN DOES NOT HAVE ANY ISSUES AND YOU SIMPLY WANT TO DELETE IT YOU MUST FIRST CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR AND REQUEST THAT THEY WORK WITH THE REGISTRY OPERATOR TO REMOVE THIS STATUS CODE
category.template: This status may indicate an issue with your domain that needs resolution. If so, you should contact your registrar to request more information and to resolve the issue. If your domain does not have any issues, and you simply want to delete it, you must first contact your registrar and request that they work with the Registry Operator to remove this status code.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE PREVENTS YOUR DOMAIN FROM BEING DELETED . IT IS AN UNCOMMON STATUS THAT IS USUALLY ENACTED DURING LEGAL DISPUTES AT YOUR REQUEST OR WHEN A REDEMPTIONPERIOD STATUS IS IN PLACE
category.template: This status code prevents your domain from being deleted. It is an uncommon status that is usually enacted during legal disputes, at your request, or when a redemptionPeriod status is in place.

category.pattern: THIS IS AN INFORMATIVE STATUS SET FOR A LIMITED PERIOD OR YOUR DOMAIN S RENEWAL BY YOUR REGISTRAR . IF YOU DID NOT REQUEST TO RENEW YOUR DOMAIN AND DO NOT WANT TO KEEP IT ( I.E . PAY THE RENEWAL FEE ) ANYMORE YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR IMMEDIATELY TO DISCUSS WHAT OPTIONS ARE AVAILABLE
category.template: This is an informative status set for a limited period or your domain's renewal by your registrar. If you did not request to renew your domain and do not want to keep it (i.e., pay the renewal fee) anymore, you should contact your registrar immediately to discuss what options are available.

category.pattern: THIS GRACE PERIOD IS PROVIDED AFTER A DOMAIN NAME REGISTRATION PERIOD IS EXPLICITLY EXTENDED ( RENEWED ) BY THE REGISTRAR . IF THE REGISTRAR DELETES THE DOMAIN NAME DURING THIS PERIOD THE REGISTRY PROVIDES A CREDIT TO THE REGISTRAR FOR THE COST OF THE RENEWAL
category.template: This grace period is provided after a domain name registration period is explicitly extended (renewed) by the registrar. If the registrar deletes the domain name during this period, the registry provides a credit to the registrar for the cost of the renewal.

category.pattern: IF YOU WANT TO KEEP YOUR DOMAIN YOU MUST IMMEDIATELY CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR TO RESOLVE WHATEVER ISSUES RESULTED IN YOUR REGISTRAR REQUESTING THAT YOUR DOMAIN BE DELETED WHICH RESULTED IN THE REDEMPTIONPERIOD STATUS FOR YOUR DOMAIN . ONCE ANY OUTSTANDING ISSUES ARE RESOLVED AND THE APPROPRIATE FEE HAS BEEN PAID YOUR REGISTRAR SHOULD RESTORE THE DOMAIN ON YOUR BEHALF
category.template: If you want to keep your domain, you must immediately contact your registrar to resolve whatever issues resulted in your registrar requesting that your domain be deleted, which resulted in the redemptionPeriod status for your domain. Once any outstanding issues are resolved and the appropriate fee has been paid, your registrar should restore the domain on your behalf.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE INDICATES THAT YOUR REGISTRAR HAS ASKED THE REGISTRY TO DELETE YOUR DOMAIN . YOUR DOMAIN WILL BE HELD IN THIS STATUS FOR 30 DAYS . AFTER FIVE CALENDAR DAYS FOLLOWING THE END OF THE REDEMPTIONPERIOD YOUR DOMAIN IS PURGED FROM THE REGISTRY DATABASE AND BECOMES AVAILABLE FOR REGISTRATION
category.template: This status code indicates that your registrar has asked the registry to delete your domain. Your domain will be held in this status for 30 days. After five calendar days following the end of the redemptionPeriod, your domain is purged from the registry database and becomes available for registration.

category.pattern: IF YOU DID NOT REQUEST TO UPDATE YOUR DOMAIN YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR IMMEDIATELY TO RESOLVE THE ISSUE
category.template: If you did not request to update your domain, you should contact your registrar immediately to resolve the issue.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE INDICATES THAT A REQUEST TO UPDATE YOUR DOMAIN HAS BEEN RECEIVED AND IS BEING PROCESSED
category.template: This status code indicates that a request to update your domain has been received and is being processed.

category.pattern: IF YOU DID NOT REQUEST TO TRANSFER YOUR DOMAIN YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR IMMEDIATELY TO REQUEST THAT THEY DENY THE TRANSFER REQUEST ON YOUR BEHALF
category.template: If you did not request to transfer your domain, you should contact your registrar immediately to request that they deny the transfer request on your behalf.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE INDICATES THAT A REQUEST TO TRANSFER YOUR DOMAIN TO A NEW REGISTRAR HAS BEEN RECEIVED AND IS BEING PROCESSED
category.template: This status code indicates that a request to transfer your domain to a new registrar has been received and is being processed.

category.pattern: WATCH YOUR DOMAIN S STATUS CODES WITHIN THIS FREQUENTLY DEFINED SEVEN DAY PERIOD TO ENSURE THAT YOUR REGISTRAR HAS SUBMITTED THE CORRECT RESTORATION DOCUMENTATION WITHIN THE TIME WINDOW . IF THIS PERIOD ENDED AND YOUR DOMAIN HAS REVERTED BACK TO A REDEMPTIONPERIOD STATUS CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR TO RESOLVE WHATEVER ISSUES THAT MAY HAVE HALTED THE DELIVERY OF YOUR DOMAIN S REQUIRED RESTORATION DOCUMENTATION
category.template: Watch your domain's status codes within this frequently defined seven day period to ensure that your registrar has submitted the correct restoration documentation within the time window. If this period ended and your domain has reverted back to a redemptionPeriod status, contact your registrar to resolve whatever issues that may have halted the delivery of your domain's required restoration documentation.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE INDICATES THAT YOUR REGISTRAR HAS ASKED THE REGISTRY TO RESTORE YOUR DOMAIN THAT WAS IN REDEMPTIONPERIOD STATUS . YOUR REGISTRY WILL HOLD THE DOMAIN IN THIS STATUS WHILE WAITING FOR YOUR REGISTRAR TO PROVIDE REQUIRED RESTORATION DOCUMENTATION . IF YOUR REGISTRAR FAILS TO PROVIDE DOCUMENTATION TO THE REGISTRY OPERATOR WITHIN A SET TIME PERIOD TO CONFIRM THE RESTORATION REQUEST THE DOMAIN WILL REVERT TO REDEMPTIONPERIOD STATUS
category.template: This status code indicates that your registrar has asked the registry to restore your domain that was in redemptionPeriod status. Your registry will hold the domain in this status while waiting for your registrar to provide required restoration documentation. If your registrar fails to provide documentation to the registry operator within a set time period to confirm the restoration request, the domain will revert to redemptionPeriod status.

category.pattern: IF YOU DID NOT REQUEST TO RENEW YOUR DOMAIN AND DO NOT WANT TO KEEP IT ( I.E . PAY THE RENEWAL FEE ) ANYMORE YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR IMMEDIATELY TO DISCUSS WHAT OPTIONS ARE AVAILABLE
category.template: If you did not request to renew your domain and do not want to keep it (i.e., pay the renewal fee) anymore, you should contact your registrar immediately to discuss what options are available.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE INDICATES THAT A REQUEST TO RENEW YOUR DOMAIN HAS BEEN RECEIVED AND IS BEING PROCESSED
category.template: This status code indicates that a request to renew your domain has been received and is being processed.

category.pattern: IF YOU WANT TO KEEP YOUR DOMAIN NAME YOU MUST IMMEDIATELY CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR TO DISCUSS WHAT OPTIONS ARE AVAILABLE
category.template: If you want to keep your domain name, you must immediately contact your registrar to discuss what options are available.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE MAY BE MIXED WITH REDEMPTIONPERIOD OR PENDINGRESTORE . IN SUCH CASE DEPENDING ON THE STATUS ( I.E . REDEMPTIONPERIOD OR PENDINGRESTORE ) SET IN THE DOMAIN NAME THE CORRESPONDING DESCRIPTION PRESENTED ABOVE APPLIES . IF THIS STATUS IS NOT COMBINED WITH THE REDEMPTIONPERIOD OR PENDINGRESTORE STATUS THE PENDINGDELETE STATUS CODE INDICATES THAT YOUR DOMAIN HAS BEEN IN REDEMPTIONPERIOD STATUS FOR 30 DAYS AND YOU HAVE NOT RESTORED IT WITHIN THAT 30 - DAY PERIOD . YOUR DOMAIN WILL REMAIN IN THIS STATUS FOR SEVERAL DAYS AFTER WHICH TIME YOUR DOMAIN WILL BE PURGED AND DROPPED FROM THE REGISTRY DATABASE
category.template: This status code may be mixed with redemptionPeriod or pendingRestore. In such case, depending on the status (i.e. redemptionPeriod or pendingRestore) set in the domain name, the corresponding description presented above applies. If this status is not combined with the redemptionPeriod or pendingRestore status, the pendingDelete status code indicates that your domain has been in redemptionPeriod status for 30 days and you have not restored it within that 30-day period. Your domain will remain in this status for several days, after which time your domain will be purged and dropped from the registry database.

category.pattern: IF THE TLD IS NOT ON A SPECIAL REGISTRATION PERIOD AND YOU ARE NOT THE LISTED REGISTRANT YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR IMMEDIATELY TO RESOLVE THE ISSUE
category.template: If the TLD is not on a special registration period and you are NOT the listed Registrant, you should contact your registrar immediately to resolve the issue.

category.pattern: IF THE TLD IS ON A SPECIAL REGISTRATION PERIOD ( E.G . SUNRISE ) THIS MAY INDICATE THAT THE DOMAIN NAME WILL BE ALLOCATED AT THE END OF SUCH PERIOD
category.template: If the TLD is on a special registration period (e.g. sunrise), this may indicate that the domain name will be allocated at the end of such period.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE INDICATES THAT A REQUEST TO CREATE YOUR DOMAIN HAS BEEN RECEIVED AND IS BEING PROCESSED
category.template: This status code indicates that a request to create your domain has been received and is being processed.

category.pattern: ASKING YOUR REGISTRAR TO ENACT STATUS RESTRICTIONS LIKE CLIENTTRANSFERPROHIBITED CLIENTDELETEPROHIBITED AND CLIENTUPDATEPROHIBITED CAN HELP TO PREVENT UNAUTHORIZED TRANSFERS DELETIONS OR UPDATES TO YOUR DOMAIN
category.template: Asking your registrar to enact status restrictions, like clientTransferProhibited, clientDeleteProhibited, and clientUpdateProhibited, can help to prevent unauthorized transfers, deletions, or updates to your domain.

category.pattern: THIS IS THE STANDARD STATUS FOR A DOMAIN MEANING IT HAS NO PENDING OPERATIONS OR PROHIBITIONS
category.template: This is the standard status for a domain, meaning it has no pending operations or prohibitions.

category.pattern: IF THE TLD REQUIRES DOCUMENTATION TO BE PROVIDED FOR REGISTRATION YOU MAY NEED TO PROVIDE THE REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION
category.template: If the TLD requires documentation to be provided for registration, you may need to provide the required documentation.

category.pattern: IF YOUR DOMAIN HAS REMAINED IN THIS STATUS FOR SEVERAL DAYS YOU MAY WANT TO CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR TO REQUEST INFORMATION ABOUT THE DELAY IN PROCESSING
category.template: If your domain has remained in this status for several days, you may want to contact your registrar to request information about the delay in processing.

category.pattern: THIS STATUS CODE INDICATES THAT DELEGATION INFORMATION ( NAME SERVERS ) HAS NOT BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH YOUR DOMAIN . YOUR DOMAIN IS NOT ACTIVATED IN THE DNS AND WILL NOT RESOLVE
category.template: This status code indicates that delegation information (name servers) has not been associated with your domain. Your domain is not activated in the DNS and will not resolve.

category.pattern: THIS IS AN INFORMATIVE STATUS SET FOR A LIMITED TIME AFTER YOUR DOMAIN S AUTO- RENEWAL BY THE REGISTRY . IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO KEEP IT ( I.E . PAY THE RENEWAL FEE ) ANYMORE YOU SHOULD CONTACT YOUR REGISTRAR IMMEDIATELY TO DISCUSS WHAT OPTIONS ARE AVAILABLE
category.template: This is an informative status set for a limited time after your domain's auto- renewal by the registry. If you do not want to keep it (i.e., pay the renewal fee) anymore, you should contact your registrar immediately to discuss what options are available.

category.pattern: THIS GRACE PERIOD IS PROVIDED AFTER A DOMAIN NAME REGISTRATION PERIOD EXPIRES AND IS EXTENDED ( RENEWED ) AUTOMATICALLY BY THE REGISTRY . IF THE REGISTRAR DELETES THE DOMAIN NAME DURING THIS PERIOD THE REGISTRY PROVIDES A CREDIT TO THE REGISTRAR FOR THE COST OF THE RENEWAL
category.template: This grace period is provided after a domain name registration period expires and is extended (renewed) automatically by the registry. If the registrar deletes the domain name during this period, the registry provides a credit to the registrar for the cost of the renewal.

category.pattern: THIS IS AN INFORMATIVE STATUS SET FOR THE FIRST SEVERAL DAYS OF YOUR DOMAIN S REGISTRATION . THERE IS NO ISSUE WITH YOUR DOMAIN NAME
category.template: This is an informative status set for the first several days of your domain's registration. There is no issue with your domain name.

category.pattern: THIS GRACE PERIOD IS PROVIDED AFTER THE INITIAL REGISTRATION OF A DOMAIN NAME . IF THE REGISTRAR DELETES THE DOMAIN NAME DURING THIS PERIOD THE REGISTRY MAY PROVIDE CREDIT TO THE REGISTRAR FOR THE COST OF THE REGISTRATION
category.template: This grace period is provided after the initial registration of a domain name. If the registrar deletes the domain name during this period, the registry may provide credit to the registrar for the cost of the registration.

category.pattern: THE FOLLOWING ARE TWO TABLES CONTAINING THE 17 STANDARDIZED EPP ( SEE STD69 ) DOMAIN STATUS CODES PLUS THE REGISTRY GRACE PERIOD ( RGP ) STATUS CODES ( SEE RFC3915 ) . THE FIRST TABLE LISTS THE SERVER AND RGP STATUS CODES ; THE SECOND TABLE LISTS THE CLIENT STATUS CODES . THESE TABLES WILL EXPLAIN WHAT EACH STATUS MEANS WHY YOU SHOULD CARE WHAT IT MEANS AND WHAT KIND OF ACTION YOU MIGHT WANT TO TAKE TO RESPOND TO A STATUS
category.template: The following are two tables containing the 17 standardized EPP (see std69) domain status codes plus the Registry Grace Period (RGP) status codes (see RFC3915). The first table lists the server and RGP status codes; the second table lists the client status codes. These tables will explain what each status means, why you should care what it means, and what kind of action you might want to take to respond to a status.

category.pattern: THERE ARE TWO DIFFERENT TYPES OF EPP STATUS CODES : CLIENT AND SERVER CODES . CLIENT STATUS CODES ARE SET BY REGISTRARS . SOME REGISTRARS AUTOMATICALLY ENACT CERTAIN STATUS CODES WHEN YOU REGISTER A DOMAIN NAME WHILE OTHERS DO SO WHEN YOU REQUEST IT . SERVER STATUS CODES ARE SET BY REGISTRIES AND THEY TAKE PRECEDENCE OVER CLIENT CODES . BOTH KINDS OF STATUS CODES APPEAR WHEN YOU RUN A WHOIS LOOKUP FOR YOUR DOMAIN
category.template: There are two different types of EPP status codes: client and server codes. Client status codes are set by registrars. Some registrars automatically enact certain status codes when you register a domain name, while others do so when you request it. Server status codes are set by registries, and they take precedence over client codes. Both kinds of status codes appear when you run a Whois lookup for your domain.

category.pattern: YOU CAN FIND OUT YOUR DOMAIN S STATUS CODES BY RUNNING A WHOIS LOOKUP WHICH YOU CAN DO BY VISITING HTTP://WWW.INTERNIC.NET/WHOIS.HTML OR YOUR REGISTRAR S WEBSITE . YOUR DOMAIN S EPP STATUS CODES WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE SEARCH RESULTS
category.template: You can find out your domain's status codes by running a Whois lookup, which you can do by visiting http://www.internic.net/whois.html or your registrar's website. Your domain's EPP status codes will be included in the search results.

category.pattern: IT IS IMPORTANT FOR REGISTRANTS ( THAT MEANS YOU ! ) TO UNDERSTAND EPP STATUS CODES BECAUSE THEY CAN EXPLAIN WHY YOUR DOMAIN MAY HAVE STOPPED WORKING IF IT IS PROTECTED FROM DOMAIN NAME HIJACKING AND WHEN AND IF YOUR DOMAIN NAME REGISTRATION WILL EXPIRE AND BECOME AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC FOR REGISTRATION
category.template: It is important for registrants (that means you!) to understand EPP status codes because they can explain why your domain may have stopped working, if it is protected from domain name hijacking, and when and if your domain name registration will expire and become available to the public for registration.

category.pattern: IS YOUR DOMAIN NAME REGISTRATION ABOUT TO BE DROPPED ? IS IT SAFELY LOCKED TO PREVENT UNAUTHORIZED TRANSFERS UPDATES OR DELETIONS ? DOES IT HAVE ANY RESTRICTIONS OR PENDING ACTIONS THAT YOU NEED TO ADDRESS ? FINDING AND UNDERSTANDING YOUR DOMAIN S EPP STATUS CODES WILL ANSWER ALL OF THESE QUESTIONS AND MORE
category.template: Is your domain name registration about to be dropped? Is it safely locked to prevent unauthorized transfers, updates or deletions? Does it have any restrictions or pending actions that you need to address? Finding and understanding your domain's EPP status codes will answer all of these questions and more.

category.pattern: EXTENSIBLE PROVISIONING PROTOCOL ( EPP ) DOMAIN STATUS CODES ALSO CALLED DOMAIN NAME STATUS CODES INDICATE THE STATUS OF A DOMAIN NAME REGISTRATION . EVERY DOMAIN HAS AT LEAST ONE STATUS CODE BUT THEY CAN ALSO HAVE MORE THAN ONE
category.template: Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP) domain status codes, also called domain name status codes, indicate the status of a domain name registration. Every domain has at least one status code, but they can also have more than one.

category.pattern: COPIES FILES AND DIRECTORIES IN A MORE ADVANCED WAY THAN COPY DEPRECATED IN WINDOWS VISTA AND LATER IN FAVOR OF ROBOCOPY . TYPE XCOPY / ? TO LEARN MORE INCLUDING COUNTLESS OPTIONS
category.template: Copies files and directories in a more advanced way than COPY, deprecated in Windows Vista and later in favor of ROBOCOPY. Type xcopy /? to learn more, including countless options.

category.pattern: STARTS WINDOWS MANAGEMENT INSTRUMENTATION COMMAND-LINE ( WMIC ) OR WITH ARGUMENTS GIVEN PASSES THE ARGUMENTS AS COMMANDS TO WMIC . NOT IN WINDOWS XP HOME . FOR MORE TYPE WMIC / ?
category.template: Starts Windows Management Instrumentation Command-line (WMIC), or with arguments given, passes the arguments as commands to WMIC. Not in Windows XP Home. For more, type "wmic /?".

category.pattern: STARTS WINDOWS MANAGEMENT INSTRUMENTATION COMMAND-LINE ( WMIC ) OR WITH ARGUMENTS GIVEN PASSES THE ARGUMENTS AS COMMANDS TO WMIC . NOT IN WINDOWS XP HOME . FOR MORE TYPE WMIC / ?
category.template: Starts Windows Management Instrumentation Command-line (WMIC), or with arguments given, passes the arguments as commands to WMIC. Not in Windows XP Home. For more, type "wmic /?".

category.pattern: DOES NOT FIND INTERNAL COMMANDS AS THERE ARE NO DOT EXE FILES FOR THEM TO MATCH
category.template: Does not find internal commands, as there are no dot exe files for them to match.

category.pattern: AVAILABLE ON WINDOWS 2003 WINDOWS VISTA WINDOWS 7 AND LATER ; NOT AVAILABLE ON WINDOWS XP . AN ALTERNATIVE TO BE USED WITH WINDOWS XP IS IN THE EXAMPLES BELOW
category.template: Available on Windows 2003, Windows Vista, Windows 7, and later; not available on Windows XP. An alternative to be used with Windows XP is in the examples below.

category.pattern: OUTPUTS ONE OR MORE LOCATIONS OF A FILE OR A FILE NAME PATTERN WHERE THE FILE OR PATTERN DOES NOT NEED TO STATE THE EXTENSION IF IT LISTED IN PATHEXT SUCH AS . EXE . SEARCHES IN THE CURRENT DIRECTORY AND IN THE PATH BY DEFAULT . DOES SOME OF THE JOB OF WHICH COMMAND OF SOME OTHER OPERATING SYSTEMS BUT IS MORE FLEXIBLE
category.template: Outputs one or more locations of a file or a file name pattern, where the file or pattern does not need to state the extension if it listed in PATHEXT, such as .exe. Searches in the current directory and in the PATH by default. Does some of the job of "which" command of some other operating systems, but is more flexible.

category.pattern: OUTPUTS A TREE OF ALL SUBDIRECTORIES OF THE CURRENT DIRECTORY TO ANY LEVEL OF RECURSION OR DEPTH . IF USED WITH / F SWITCH OUTPUTS NOT ONLY SUBDIRECTORIES BUT ALSO FILES
category.template: Outputs a tree of all subdirectories of the current directory to any level of recursion or depth. If used with /F switch, outputs not only subdirectories but also files.

category.pattern: WAITS A SPECIFIED NUMBER OF SECONDS DISPLAYING THE NUMBER OF REMAINING SECONDS AS TIME PASSES ALLOWING THE USER TO INTERRUPT THE WAITING BY PRESSING A KEY . ALSO KNOWN AS DELAY OR SLEEP . AVAILABLE IN WINDOWS VISTA AND LATER
category.template: Waits a specified number of seconds, displaying the number of remaining seconds as time passes, allowing the user to interrupt the waiting by pressing a key. Also known as delay or sleep. Available in Windows Vista and later.

category.pattern: LISTS TASKS INCLUDING TASK NAME AND PROCESS ID ( PID )
category.template: Lists tasks, including task name and process id (PID).

category.pattern: ENDS ONE OR MORE TASKS
category.template: Ends one or more tasks.

category.pattern: SHOWS CONFIGURATION OF A COMPUTER AND ITS OPERATING SYSTEM
category.template: Shows configuration of a computer and its operating system.

category.pattern: ASSIGNS A DRIVE LETTER TO A LOCAL FOLDER OUTPUTS CURRENT ASSIGNMENTS OR REMOVES AN ASSIGNMENT
category.template: Assigns a drive letter to a local folder, outputs current assignments, or removes an assignment.

category.pattern: SORTS ALPHABETICALLY FROM A TO Z OR Z TO A CASE INSENSITIVE . CANNOT SORT NUMERICALLY : IF THE INPUT CONTAINS ONE INTEGER PER LINE 12 COMES BEFORE 9
category.template: Sorts alphabetically, from A to Z or Z to A, case insensitive. Cannot sort numerically: if the input contains one integer per line, "12" comes before "9".

category.pattern: SORTS ALPHABETICALLY FROM A TO Z OR Z TO A CASE INSENSITIVE . CANNOT SORT NUMERICALLY : IF THE INPUT CONTAINS ONE INTEGER PER LINE 12 COMES BEFORE 9
category.template: Sorts alphabetically, from A to Z or Z to A, case insensitive. Cannot sort numerically: if the input contains one integer per line, "12" comes before "9".

category.pattern: SHUTS DOWN A COMPUTER OR LOGS OFF THE CURRENT USER
category.template: Shuts down a computer, or logs off the current user.

category.pattern: LIKE SET BUT AFFECTING THE WHOLE MACHINE RATHER THAN THE CURRENT CONSOLE OR PROCESS . NOT AVAILABLE IN WINDOWS XP ; AVAILABLE IN WINDOWS VISTA AND LATER
category.template: Like SET, but affecting the whole machine rather than the current console or process. Not available in Windows XP; available in Windows Vista and later.

category.pattern: SCHEDULES A PROGRAM TO BE RUN AT A CERTAIN TIME MORE POWERFUL THAN AT
category.template: Schedules a program to be run at a certain time, more powerful than AT.

category.pattern: CONTROLS WINDOWS SERVICES SUPPORTING STARTING STOPPING QUERYING AND MORE . WINDOWS SERVICES ARE PROCESS-LIKE THINGS . A WINDOWS SERVICE IS EITHER HOSTED IN ITS OWN PROCESS OR IT IS HOSTED IN AN INSTANCE OF SVCHOST.EXE PROCESS OFTEN WITH MULTIPLE SERVICES IN THE SAME INSTANCE . PROCESSOR TIME USE OF A PARTICULAR SERVICE CAN BE FOUND USING FREELY DOWNLOADABLE PROCESS EXPLORER FROM SYSINTERNALS BY GOING TO PROPERTIES OF A SERVICE AND THEN THREADS TAB . ANOTHER COMMAND CAPABLE OF CONTROLLING SERVICES IS NET . TASKLIST CAN LIST HOSTED SERVICES USING / SVC SWITCH
category.template: Controls Windows services, supporting starting, stopping, querying and more. Windows services are process-like things. A Windows service is either hosted in its own process or it is hosted in an instance of svchost.exe process, often with multiple services in the same instance. Processor time use of a particular service can be found using freely downloadable Process Explorer from Sysinternals, by going to properties of a service and then Threads tab. Another command capable of controlling services is NET. TASKLIST can list hosted services using /svc switch.

category.pattern: RUNS A FUNCTION AVAILABLE FROM A DLL . THE AVAILABLE DLLS AND THEIR FUNCTIONS DIFFER AMONG WINDOWS VERSIONS
category.template: Runs a function available from a DLL. The available DLLs and their functions differ among Windows versions.

category.pattern: ( NOT IN XP ) COPIES FILES AND FOLDERS . SEE ALSO XCOPY AND COPY
category.template: (Not in XP) Copies files and folders. See also XCOPY and COPY.

category.pattern: REPLACES FILES IN THE DESTINATION FOLDER WITH SAME-NAMED FILES IN THE SOURCE FOLDER
category.template: Replaces files in the destination folder with same-named files in the source folder.

category.pattern: THE FIRST ARGUMENT IS ONE OF THE FOLLOWING COMMANDS : QUERY ADD DELETE COPY SAVE LOAD UNLOAD RESTORE COMPARE EXPORT IMPORT AND FLAGS . TO LEARN MORE ABOUT A COMMAND FOLLOW IT BY / ? LIKE REG QUERY /
category.template: The first argument is one of the following commands: query, add, delete, copy, save, load, unload, restore, compare, export, import, and flags. To learn more about a command, follow it by /?, like reg query /?.

category.pattern: QUERIES OR MODIFIES WINDOWS REGISTRY
category.template: Queries or modifies Windows registry.

category.pattern: RECOVERS AS MUCH INFORMATION AS IT CAN FROM DAMAGED FILES ON A DEFECTIVE DISK
category.template: Recovers as much information as it can from damaged files on a defective disk.

category.pattern: SEND ICMP / IP ECHO PACKETS OVER THE NETWORK TO THE DESIGNATED ADDRESS ( OR THE FIRST IP ADDRESS THAT THE DESIGNATED HOSTNAME MAPS TO VIA NAME LOOKUP ) AND PRINT ALL RESPONSES RECEIVED
category.template: Send ICMP/IP "echo" packets over the network to the designated address (or the first IP address that the designated hostname maps to via name lookup) and print all responses received.

category.pattern: PERFORMS ACTIONS PERTAINING TO OPEN FILES ESPECIALLY THOSE OPENED BY OTHER USERS OVER THE NETWORK . THE ACTIONS INVOLVE QUERYING DISPLAYING AND DISCONNECTING . FOR MORE TYPE OPENFILES / ?
category.template: Performs actions pertaining to open files, especially those opened by other users over the network. The actions involve querying, displaying, and disconnecting. For more, type "openfiles /?".

category.pattern: PERFORMS ACTIONS PERTAINING TO OPEN FILES ESPECIALLY THOSE OPENED BY OTHER USERS OVER THE NETWORK . THE ACTIONS INVOLVE QUERYING DISPLAYING AND DISCONNECTING . FOR MORE TYPE OPENFILES / ?
category.template: Performs actions pertaining to open files, especially those opened by other users over the network. The actions involve querying, displaying, and disconnecting. For more, type "openfiles /?".

category.pattern: OUTPUTS THE CONTENTS OF A FILE OR FILES ONE SCREEN AT A TIME . WHEN REDIRECTED TO A FILE PERFORMS SOME CONVERSIONS ALSO DEPENDING ON THE USED SWITCHES
category.template: Outputs the contents of a file or files, one screen at a time. When redirected to a file, performs some conversions, also depending on the used switches.

category.pattern: A MULTI-PURPOSE COMMAND TO DISPLAY DEVICE STATUS CONFIGURE PORTS AND DEVICES AND MORE
category.template: A multi-purpose command to display device status, configure ports and devices, and more.

category.pattern: PLACES FILES INTO COMPRESSED . CAB CABINET FILE . SEE ALSO #EXPAND
category.template: Places files into compressed .cab cabinet file. See also #EXPAND.

category.pattern: ADDS SETS OR REMOVES A DISK LABEL
category.template: Adds, sets or removes a disk label.

category.pattern: OUTPUTS WINDOWS IP CONFIGURATION . SHOWS CONFIGURATION BY CONNECTION AND THE NAME OF THAT CONNECTION ( I.E . ETHERNET ADAPTER LOCAL AREA CONNECTION ) BELOW THAT THE SPECIFIC INFO PERTAINING TO THAT CONNECTION IS DISPLAYED SUCH AS DNS SUFFIX AND IP ADDRESS AND SUBNET MASK
category.template: Outputs Windows IP Configuration. Shows configuration by connection and the name of that connection (i.e. Ethernet adapter Local Area Connection) Below that the specific info pertaining to that connection is displayed such as DNS suffix and ip address and subnet mask.

category.pattern: ( NOT IN XP ) SHOWS OR CHANGES DISCRETIONARY ACCESS CONTROL LISTS ( DACLS ) OF FILES OR FOLDERS . SEE ALSO CACLS . FORE MORE TYPE ICACLS / ?
category.template: (Not in XP) Shows or changes discretionary access control lists (DACLs) of files or folders. See also CACLS. Fore more, type "icacls /?".

category.pattern: ( NOT IN XP ) SHOWS OR CHANGES DISCRETIONARY ACCESS CONTROL LISTS ( DACLS ) OF FILES OR FOLDERS . SEE ALSO CACLS . FORE MORE TYPE ICACLS / ?
category.template: (Not in XP) Shows or changes discretionary access control lists (DACLs) of files or folders. See also CACLS. Fore more, type "icacls /?".

category.pattern: SHOWS COMMAND HELP
category.template: Shows command help.

category.pattern: ENABLES THE DISPLAY OF AN EXTENDED CHARACTER SET IN GRAPHICS MODE . FOR MORE TYPE GRAFTABL / ?
category.template: Enables the display of an extended character set in graphics mode. For more, type "graftabl /?".

category.pattern: ENABLES THE DISPLAY OF AN EXTENDED CHARACTER SET IN GRAPHICS MODE . FOR MORE TYPE GRAFTABL / ?
category.template: Enables the display of an extended character set in graphics mode. For more, type "graftabl /?".

category.pattern: OUTPUTS GROUP POLICY SETTINGS AND MORE FOR A USER OR A COMPUTER
category.template: Outputs group policy settings and more for a user or a computer.

category.pattern: A POWERFUL TOOL PERFORMING ACTIONS RELATED TO FAT AND NTFS FILE SYSTEMS TO BE IDEALLY ONLY USED BY POWERUSERS WITH AN EXTENSIVE KNOWLEDGE OF THE OPERATING SYSTEMS
category.template: A powerful tool performing actions related to FAT and NTFS file systems, to be ideally only used by powerusers with an extensive knowledge of the operating systems.

category.pattern: FORMATS A DISK TO USE WINDOWS-SUPPORTED FILE SYSTEM SUCH AS FAT FAT32 OR NTFS THEREBY OVERWRITING THE PREVIOUS CONTENT OF THE DISK . TO BE USED WITH GREAT CAUTION
category.template: Formats a disk to use Windows-supported file system such as FAT, FAT32 or NTFS, thereby overwriting the previous content of the disk. To be used with great caution.

category.pattern: FINDS FILES BY THEIR MODIFICATION DATE AND FILE NAME PATTERN AND EXECUTES A COMMAND FOR EACH FOUND FILE . IS VERY LIMITED ESPECIALLY COMPARED TO THE FIND COMMAND OF OTHER OPERATING SYSTEMS . AVAILABLE SINCE WINDOWS VISTA . FOR MORE TYPE FORFILES / ?
category.template: Finds files by their modification date and file name pattern, and executes a command for each found file. Is very limited, especially compared to the find command of other operating systems. Available since Windows Vista. For more, type "forfiles /?".

category.pattern: FINDS FILES BY THEIR MODIFICATION DATE AND FILE NAME PATTERN AND EXECUTES A COMMAND FOR EACH FOUND FILE . IS VERY LIMITED ESPECIALLY COMPARED TO THE FIND COMMAND OF OTHER OPERATING SYSTEMS . AVAILABLE SINCE WINDOWS VISTA . FOR MORE TYPE FORFILES / ?
category.template: Finds files by their modification date and file name pattern, and executes a command for each found file. Is very limited, especially compared to the find command of other operating systems. Available since Windows Vista. For more, type "forfiles /?".

category.pattern: ALSO CONSIDER TYPING FINDSTR / ?
category.template: Also consider typing "findstr /?".

category.pattern: ALSO CONSIDER TYPING FINDSTR / ?
category.template: Also consider typing "findstr /?".

category.pattern: OTHER LIMITATIONS : THERE IS A VARIETY OF LIMITATIONS AND STRANGE BEHAVIORS AS DOCUMENTED AT WHAT ARE THE UNDOCUMENTED FEATURES AND LIMITATIONS OF THE WINDOWS FINDSTR COMMAND
category.template: Other limitations: There is a variety of limitations and strange behaviors as documented at What are the undocumented features and limitations of the Windows FINDSTR command?.

category.pattern: TREATS SPACE IN A REGULAR EXPRESSION AS A DISJUNCTION AKA LOGICAL OR UNLESS PREVENTED WITH / C OPTION
category.template: Treats space in a regular expression as a disjunction AKA logical or unless prevented with /c option.

category.pattern: SEARCHES FOR REGULAR EXPRESSIONS OR TEXT STRINGS IN FILES . DOES SOME OF THE JOB OF GREP COMMAND KNOWN FROM OTHER OPERATING SYSTEMS BUT IS MUCH MORE LIMITED IN THE REGULAR EXPRESSIONS IT SUPPORTS
category.template: Searches for regular expressions or text strings in files. Does some of the job of "grep" command known from other operating systems, but is much more limited in the regular expressions it supports.

category.pattern: SEARCHES FOR A STRING IN FILES OR INPUT OUTPUTTING MATCHING LINES . UNLIKE FINDSTR IT CANNOT SEARCH FOLDERS RECURSIVELY CANNOT SEARCH FOR A REGULAR EXPRESSION REQUIRES QUOTATION MARKS AROUND THE SOUGHT STRING AND TREATS SPACE LITERALLY RATHER THAN AS A LOGICAL OR
category.template: Searches for a string in files or input, outputting matching lines. Unlike FINDSTR, it cannot search folders recursively, cannot search for a regular expression, requires quotation marks around the sought string, and treats space literally rather than as a logical or.

category.pattern: COMPARES FILES DISPLAYING THE DIFFERENCES IN THEIR CONTENT IN A PECULIAR WAY
category.template: Compares files, displaying the differences in their content in a peculiar way.

category.pattern: EXTRACTS FILES FROM COMPRESSED . CAB CABINET FILES . SEE ALSO #MAKECAB
category.template: Extracts files from compressed .cab cabinet files. See also #MAKECAB.

category.pattern: SHOWS ALL INSTALLED DEVICE DRIVERS AND THEIR PROPERTIES
category.template: Shows all installed device drivers and their properties.

category.pattern: TO GET HELP ON DOSKEY FROM COMMAND LINE TYPE DOSKEY / ?
category.template: To get help on doskey from command line, type "doskey /?".

category.pattern: TO GET HELP ON DOSKEY FROM COMMAND LINE TYPE DOSKEY / ?
category.template: To get help on doskey from command line, type "doskey /?".

category.pattern: ABOVE ALL CREATES MACROS KNOWN FROM OTHER OPERATING SYSTEMS AS ALIASES . MOREOVER PROVIDES FUNCTIONS RELATED TO COMMAND HISTORY AND ENHANCED COMMAND-LINE EDITING . MACROS ARE AN ALTERNATIVE TO VERY SHORT BATCH SCRIPTS
category.template: Above all, creates macros known from other operating systems as aliases. Moreover, provides functions related to command history, and enhanced command-line editing. Macros are an alternative to very short batch scripts.

category.pattern: SHOWS AND CONFIGURES THE PROPERTIES OF DISK PARTITIONS
category.template: Shows and configures the properties of disk partitions.

category.pattern: COPIES THE CONTENT OF ONE FLOPPY TO ANOTHER
category.template: Copies the content of one floppy to another.

category.pattern: COMPARES THE CONTENT OF TWO FLOPPIES
category.template: Compares the content of two floppies.

category.pattern: TO VIEW HEX OF A FILE INVOKE DEBUG.EXE WITH THE FILE NAME AS A PARAMETER AND THEN REPEATEDLY TYPE D FOLLOWED BY ENTER ON THE DEBUG COMMAND LINE
category.template: To view hex of a file, invoke debug.exe with the file name as a parameter, and then repeatedly type "d" followed by enter on the debug command line.

category.pattern: DEBUG OFFERS ITS OWN COMMAND LINE . ONCE ON ITS COMMAND LIKE TYPE ? TO FIND ABOUT DEBUG COMMANDS
category.template: Debug offers its own command line. Once on its command like, type "?" to find about debug commands.

category.pattern: ALLOWS TO INTERACTIVELY EXAMINE FILE AND MEMORY CONTENTS IN ASSEMBLY LANGUAGE HEXADECIMAL OR ASCII . AVAILABLE IN 32 - BIT WINDOWS INCLUDING WINDOWS 7 ; THE AVAILABILITY IN 64 - BIT WINDOWS IS UNCLEAR . IN MODERN WINDOWS USEFUL AS A QUICK HACK TO VIEW HEX CONTENT OF A FILE . KEYWORDS : HEX DUMP HEXDUMP HEXADECIMAL DUMP VIEW HEX VIEW HEXADECIMAL DISASSEMBLER
category.template: Allows to interactively examine file and memory contents in assembly language, hexadecimal or ASCII. Available in 32-bit Windows including Windows 7; the availability in 64-bit Windows is unclear. In modern Windows, useful as a quick hack to view hex content of a file. Keywords: hex dump, hexdump, hexadecimal dump, view hex, view hexadecimal, disassembler.

category.pattern: CONVERTS A VOLUME FROM FAT16 OR FAT32 FILE SYSTEM TO NTFS FILE SYSTEM
category.template: Converts a volume from FAT16 or FAT32 file system to NTFS file system.

category.pattern: SHOWS OR CHANGES THE COMPRESSION OF FILES OR FOLDERS ON NTFS PARTITIONS
category.template: Shows or changes the compression of files or folders on NTFS partitions.

category.pattern: COMPARES FILES . SEE ALSO FC
category.template: Compares files. See also FC.

category.pattern: INVOKES ANOTHER INSTANCE OF MICROSOFT S CMD
category.template: Invokes another instance of Microsoft's CMD.

category.pattern: ( NOT IN XP OR MAKE A COPY FROM SERVER 2003 ) PLACES THE PIPED INPUT TO THE CLIPBOARD
category.template: (Not in XP, or make a copy from Server 2003) Places the piped input to the clipboard.

category.pattern: SHOWS THE ENCRYPTION STATE ENCRYPTS OR DECRYPTS FOLDERS ON A NTFS VOLUME
category.template: Shows the encryption state, encrypts or decrypts folders on a NTFS volume.

category.pattern: AN ALTERNATIVE IS SET / P ; SEE SET
category.template: An alternative is "set /p"; see SET.

category.pattern: LETS THE USER CHOOSE ONE OF MULTIPLE OPTIONS BY PRESSING A SINGLE KEY AND SETS THE ERROR LEVEL AS PER THE CHOSEN OPTION . ABSENT IN WINDOWS 2000 AND WINDOWS XP IT WAS REINTRODUCED IN WINDOWS VISTA AND HAS REMAINED IN WINDOWS 7 AND 8
category.template: Lets the user choose one of multiple options by pressing a single key, and sets the error level as per the chosen option. Absent in Windows 2000 and Windows XP, it was reintroduced in Windows Vista, and has remained in Windows 7 and 8.

category.pattern: SHOWS OR SETS WHETHER SYSTEM CHECKING SHOULD BE RUN WHEN THE COMPUTER IS STARTED . THE SYSTEM CHECKING IS DONE USING AUTOCHK.EXE . THE NTFS PART OF THE COMMAND NAME IS MISLEADING SINCE THE COMMAND WORKS NOT ONLY WITH NTFS FILE SYSTEM BUT ALSO WITH FAT AND FAT32 FILE SYSTEMS . FOR MORE TYPE CHKNTFS / ?
category.template: Shows or sets whether system checking should be run when the computer is started. The system checking is done using Autochk.exe. The "NTFS" part of the command name is misleading, since the command works not only with NTFS file system but also with FAT and FAT32 file systems. For more, type "chkntfs /?".

category.pattern: SHOWS OR SETS WHETHER SYSTEM CHECKING SHOULD BE RUN WHEN THE COMPUTER IS STARTED . THE SYSTEM CHECKING IS DONE USING AUTOCHK.EXE . THE NTFS PART OF THE COMMAND NAME IS MISLEADING SINCE THE COMMAND WORKS NOT ONLY WITH NTFS FILE SYSTEM BUT ALSO WITH FAT AND FAT32 FILE SYSTEMS . FOR MORE TYPE CHKNTFS / ?
category.template: Shows or sets whether system checking should be run when the computer is started. The system checking is done using Autochk.exe. The "NTFS" part of the command name is misleading, since the command works not only with NTFS file system but also with FAT and FAT32 file systems. For more, type "chkntfs /?".

category.pattern: CHECKS DISKS FOR DISK PROBLEMS LISTING THEM AND REPAIRING THEM IF WISHED . FOR MORE TYPE CHKDSK / ?
category.template: Checks disks for disk problems, listing them and repairing them if wished. For more, type "chkdsk /?".

category.pattern: CHECKS DISKS FOR DISK PROBLEMS LISTING THEM AND REPAIRING THEM IF WISHED . FOR MORE TYPE CHKDSK / ?
category.template: Checks disks for disk problems, listing them and repairing them if wished. For more, type "chkdsk /?".

category.pattern: OUTPUTS OR SETS THE ACTIVE CODE PAGE NUMBER . FOR MORE TYPE CHCP / ?
category.template: Outputs or sets the active code page number. For more, type "chcp /?".

category.pattern: OUTPUTS OR SETS THE ACTIVE CODE PAGE NUMBER . FOR MORE TYPE CHCP / ?
category.template: Outputs or sets the active code page number. For more, type "chcp /?".

category.pattern: OUTPUTS OR CHANGES DISCRETIONARY ACCESS CONTROL LISTS ( DACLS ) . SEE ALSO ICACLS . FOR MORE TYPE CACLS / ?
category.template: Outputs or changes discretionary access control lists (DACLs). See also ICACLS. For more, type "cacls /?".

category.pattern: OUTPUTS OR CHANGES DISCRETIONARY ACCESS CONTROL LISTS ( DACLS ) . SEE ALSO ICACLS . FOR MORE TYPE CACLS / ?
category.template: Outputs or changes discretionary access control lists (DACLs). See also ICACLS. For more, type "cacls /?".

category.pattern: ( NOT IN XP ) . EDITS BOOT CONFIGURATION DATA ( BCD ) FILES . FOR MORE TYPE BCDEDIT / ?
category.template: (Not in XP). Edits Boot Configuration Data (BCD) files. For more, type "bcdedit /?".

category.pattern: ( NOT IN XP ) . EDITS BOOT CONFIGURATION DATA ( BCD ) FILES . FOR MORE TYPE BCDEDIT / ?
category.template: (Not in XP). Edits Boot Configuration Data (BCD) files. For more, type "bcdedit /?".

category.pattern: FOR MORE TYPE ATTRIB / ?
category.template: For more, type "attrib /?".

category.pattern: FOR MORE TYPE ATTRIB / ?
category.template: For more, type "attrib /?".

category.pattern: OUTPUTS OR SETS FILE ATTRIBUTES . WITH NO ARGUMENTS IT OUTPUTS THE ATTRIBUTES OF ALL FILES IN THE CURRENT DIRECTORY . WITH NO ATTRIBUTE MODIFICATION INSTRUCTIONS IT OUTPUTS THE ATTRIBUTES OF THE FILES AND DIRECTORIES THAT MATCH THE GIVEN SEARCH WILDCARD SPECIFICATIONS . SIMILAR TO CHMOD OF OTHER OPERATING SYSTEMS
category.template: Outputs or sets file attributes. With no arguments, it outputs the attributes of all files in the current directory. With no attribute modification instructions, it outputs the attributes of the files and directories that match the given search wildcard specifications. Similar to chmod of other operating systems.

category.pattern: SCHEDULES A PROGRAM TO BE RUN AT A CERTAIN TIME . SEE ALSO SCHTASKS
category.template: Schedules a program to be run at a certain time. See also SCHTASKS.

category.pattern: OUTPUTS OR CHANGES ITEMS IN THE ADDRESS RESOLUTION PROTOCOL CACHE WHICH MAPS IP ADDRESSES TO PHYSICAL ADDRESSES
category.template: Outputs or changes items in the address resolution protocol cache, which maps IP addresses to physical addresses.

category.pattern: MANY BUT NOT ALL EXTERNAL COMMANDS SUPPORT THE / ? CONVENTION CAUSING THEM TO WRITE ON-LINE USAGE INFORMATION TO THEIR STANDARD OUTPUT AND THEN TO EXIT WITH A STATUS CODE OF 0
category.template: Many, but not all, external commands support the "/?" convention, causing them to write on-line usage information to their standard output and then to exit with a status code of 0.

category.pattern: EXTERNAL COMMANDS AVAILABLE TO WINDOWS COMMAND INTERPRETER ARE SEPARATE EXECUTABLE PROGRAM FILES SUPPLIED WITH THE OPERATING SYSTEM BY MICROSOFT OR BUNDLED AS STANDARD WITH THE THIRD-PARTY COMMAND INTERPRETERS . BY REPLACING THE PROGRAM FILES THE MEANINGS AND FUNCTIONS OF THESE COMMANDS CAN BE CHANGED
category.template: External commands available to Windows command interpreter are separate executable program files, supplied with the operating system by Microsoft, or bundled as standard with the third-party command interpreters. By replacing the program files, the meanings and functions of these commands can be changed.

category.pattern: OUTPUTS VOLUME LABELS
category.template: Outputs volume labels.

category.pattern: SETS OR CLEARS THE SETTING TO VERIFY WHETHER COPY FILES ETC . ARE WRITTEN CORRECTLY
category.template: Sets or clears the setting to verify whether COPY files etc. are written correctly.

category.pattern: THE WORD VERSION APPEARS LOCALIZED
category.template: The word "version" appears localized.

category.pattern: SHOWS THE COMMAND PROCESSOR OR OPERATING SYSTEM VERSION
category.template: Shows the command processor or operating system version.

category.pattern: PRINTS THE CONTENT OF A FILE OR FILES TO THE OUTPUT
category.template: Prints the content of a file or files to the output.

category.pattern: SETS THE TITLE DISPLAYED IN THE CONSOLE WINDOW
category.template: Sets the title displayed in the console window.

category.pattern: OUPUTS OR SETS THE SYSTEM TIME . SEE ALSO #DATE AND TIME VARIABLE IN #SPECIAL VARIABLE NAMES
category.template: Ouputs or sets the system time. See also #DATE and TIME variable in #Special variable names.

category.pattern: STARTS A PROGRAM IN NEW WINDOW OR OPENS A DOCUMENT . USES AN UNCLEAR ALGORITHM TO DETERMINE WHETHER THE FIRST PASSED ARGUMENT IS A WINDOW TITLE OR A PROGRAM TO BE EXECUTED ; HYPOTHESIS : IT USES THE PRESENCE OF QUOTES AROUND THE FIRST ARGUMENT AS A HINT THAT IT IS A WINDOW TITLE
category.template: Starts a program in new window, or opens a document. Uses an unclear algorithm to determine whether the first passed argument is a window title or a program to be executed; hypothesis: it uses the presence of quotes around the first argument as a hint that it is a window title.

category.pattern: SHIFTS THE BATCH FILE ARGUMENTS ALONG BUT DOES NOT AFFECT % * . THUS IF % 1 = HELLO 1 % 2 = HELLO 2 AND % 3 = HELLO 3 THEN AFTER SHIFT % 1 = HELLO 2 AND % 2 = HELLO 3 BUT % * IS HELLO 1 HELLO 2 HELLO 3
category.template: Shifts the batch file arguments along, but does not affect%*. Thus, if %1=Hello 1, %2=Hello 2, and %3=Hello 3, then, after SHIFT, %1=Hello 2, and %2=Hello 3, but%* is "Hello 1" "Hello 2" "Hello 3".

category.pattern: SHIFTS THE BATCH FILE ARGUMENTS ALONG BUT DOES NOT AFFECT % * . THUS IF % 1 = HELLO 1 % 2 = HELLO 2 AND % 3 = HELLO 3 THEN AFTER SHIFT % 1 = HELLO 2 AND % 2 = HELLO 3 BUT % * IS HELLO 1 HELLO 2 HELLO 3
category.template: Shifts the batch file arguments along, but does not affect%*. Thus, if %1=Hello 1, %2=Hello 2, and %3=Hello 3, then, after SHIFT, %1=Hello 2, and %2=Hello 3, but%* is "Hello 1" "Hello 2" "Hello 3".

category.pattern: FURTHERMORE CAN BE USED TO ENABLE DELAYED EXPANSION LIKE THIS : SETLOCAL ENABLEDELAYEDEXPANSION . DELAYED EXPANSION CONSISTS IN THE NAMES OF VARIABLES ENCLOSED IN EXCLAMATION MARKS BEING REPLACED WITH THEIR VALUES ONLY AFTER THE EXECUTION REACHES THE LOCATION OF THEIR USE RATHER THAN AT AN EARLIER POINT
category.template: Furthermore, can be used to enable delayed expansion like this: "setlocal EnableDelayedExpansion". Delayed expansion consists in the names of variables enclosed in exclamation marks being replaced with their values only after the execution reaches the location of their use rather than at an earlier point.

category.pattern: WHEN USED IN A BATCH FILE MAKES ALL FURTHER CHANGES TO ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES LOCAL TO THE CURRENT BATCH FILE . WHEN USED OUTSIDE OF A BATCH FILE DOES NOTHING . CAN BE ENDED USING ENDLOCAL . EXITING A BATCH FILE AUTOMATICALLY CALLS END LOCAL . CAN BE USED TO CREATE SUBPROGRAMS : SEE FUNCTIONS
category.template: When used in a batch file, makes all further changes to environment variables local to the current batch file. When used outside of a batch file, does nothing. Can be ended using ENDLOCAL. Exiting a batch file automatically calls "end local". Can be used to create subprograms: see Functions.

category.pattern: OUTPUTS OR SETS ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES . WITH / P SWITCH IT ASKS THE USER FOR INPUT STORING THE RESULT IN THE VARIABLE . WITH / A SWITCH IT PERFORMS SIMPLE ARITHMETIC CALCULATIONS STORING THE RESULT IN THE VARIABLE . WITH STRING ASSIGNMENTS SPACES BEFORE AND AFTER THE EQUALITY SIGN ARE USUALLY AVOIDED SINCE THEY LEAD TO USUALLY UNINTENDED CONSEQUENCES : SET NAME = PETER ASSIGNS TO VARIABLE NAME WHILE SET NAME = PETER ASSIGNS TO VARIABLE NAME . SEE ALSO #ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES AND #CALCULATION
category.template: Outputs or sets environment variables. With /P switch, it asks the user for input, storing the result in the variable. With /A switch, it performs simple arithmetic calculations, storing the result in the variable. With string assignments, spaces before and after the equality sign are usually avoided since they lead to usually unintended consequences: "set name = Peter" assigns to variable "name ", while "set name=Peter" assigns to variable "name". See also #Environment variables and #Calculation.

category.pattern: THIS IS A SYNONYM OF RD
category.template: This is a synonym of RD.

category.pattern: DOUBLE COLON IS AN ALTERNATIVE TO REM . IT CAN CAUSE TROUBLE WHEN USED IN THE MIDDLE OF SEQUENCES IN PARENTHESES LIKE THOSE USED IN FOR LOOPS . THE DOUBLE COLON SEEMS TO BE JUST A TRICK A LABEL THAT STARTS WITH A COLON
category.template: Double colon is an alternative to REM. It can cause trouble when used in the middle of sequences in parentheses, like those used in FOR loops. The double colon seems to be just a trick, a label that starts with a colon.

category.pattern: REM IS TYPICALLY PLACED AT THE BEGINNING OF A LINE . IF PLACED BEHIND A COMMAND IT DOES NOT WORK UNLESS PRECEDED BY AN AMPERSAND AS SHOWN IN THE EXAMPLE ABOVE
category.template: REM is typically placed at the beginning of a line. If placed behind a command, it does not work, unless preceded by an ampersand, as shown in the example above.

category.pattern: USED FOR REMARKS IN BATCH FILES PREVENTING THE CONTENT OF THE REMARK FROM BEING EXECUTED
category.template: Used for remarks in batch files, preventing the content of the remark from being executed.

category.pattern: THIS IS A SYNONYM OF REN COMMAND
category.template: This is a synonym of REN command.

category.pattern: RENAMES FILES AND DIRECTORIES
category.template: Renames files and directories.

category.pattern: REMOVES DIRECTORIES . SEE ALSO ITS SYNONYM RMDIR AND ANTONYM MD . PER DEFAULT ONLY EMPTY DIRECTORIES CAN BE REMOVED . ALSO TYPE RD / ?
category.template: Removes directories. See also its synonym RMDIR and antonym MD. Per default, only empty directories can be removed. Also type "rd /?".

category.pattern: REMOVES DIRECTORIES . SEE ALSO ITS SYNONYM RMDIR AND ANTONYM MD . PER DEFAULT ONLY EMPTY DIRECTORIES CAN BE REMOVED . ALSO TYPE RD / ?
category.template: Removes directories. See also its synonym RMDIR and antonym MD. Per default, only empty directories can be removed. Also type "rd /?".

category.pattern: PUSHES THE CURRENT DIRECTORY ONTO THE DIRECTORY STACK MAKING IT AVAILABLE FOR THE POPD COMMAND TO RETRIEVE AND IF EXECUTED WITH AN ARGUMENT CHANGES TO THE DIRECTORY STATED AS THE ARGUMENT
category.template: Pushes the current directory onto the directory stack, making it available for the POPD command to retrieve, and, if executed with an argument, changes to the directory stated as the argument.

category.pattern: THE PROMPT COMMAND IS USED TO SET THE PROMPT TO MYPROMPT > . THE CD SHOWS THAT THE CURRENT DIRECTORY PATH IS C : \ . USING PROMPT WITHOUT ANY PARAMETERS SETS THE PROMPT BACK TO THE DIRECTORY PATH
category.template: The PROMPT command is used to set the prompt to "MyPrompt>". The CD shows that the current directory path is "C:\". Using PROMPT without any parameters sets the prompt back to the directory path.

category.pattern: CAN BE USED TO CHANGE OR RESET THE CMD.EXE PROMPT . IT SETS THE VALUE OF THE PROMPT ENVIRONMENT VARIABLE
category.template: Can be used to change or reset the cmd.exe prompt. It sets the value of the PROMPT environment variable.

category.pattern: CHANGES TO THE DRIVE AND DIRECTORY POPPED FROM THE DIRECTORY STACK . THE DIRECTORY STACK IS FILLED USING THE PUSHD COMMAND
category.template: Changes to the drive and directory popped from the directory stack. The directory stack is filled using the PUSHD command.

category.pattern: PROMPTS THE USER AND WAITS FOR A LINE OF INPUT TO BE ENTERED
category.template: Prompts the user and waits for a line of input to be entered.

category.pattern: OUTPUTS OR SETS THE VALUE OF THE PATH ENVIRONMENT VARIABLE . WHEN OUTPUTTING INCLUDES PATH = AT THE BEGINNING OF THE OUTPUT
category.template: Outputs or sets the value of the PATH environment variable. When outputting, includes "PATH=" at the beginning of the output.

category.pattern: MOVES FILES OR DIRECTORIES BETWEEN DIRECTORIES OR RENAMES THEM . SEE ALSO REN
category.template: Moves files or directories between directories, or renames them. See also REN.

category.pattern: MAKES A SYMBOLIC LINK OR OTHER TYPE OF LINK . AVAILABLE SINCE WINDOWS VISTA
category.template: Makes a symbolic link or other type of link. Available since Windows Vista.

category.pattern: A SYNONYM FOR MD
category.template: A synonym for MD.

category.pattern: CREATES A NEW DIRECTORY OR DIRECTORIES . HAS A SYNONYM MKDIR ; SEE ALSO ITS ANTONYM RD
category.template: Creates a new directory or directories. Has a synonym MKDIR; see also its antonym RD.

category.pattern: THE / I SWITCH MAKES THE = = AND EQU COMPARISONS IGNORE CASE
category.template: The /I switch makes the == and equ comparisons ignore case.

category.pattern: TO EACH ELEMENTARY TEST NOT CAN BE APPLIED . APPARENTLY THERE ARE NO OPERATORS LIKE AND OR ETC . TO COMBINE ELEMENTARY TESTS
category.template: To each elementary test, "not" can be applied. Apparently there are no operators like AND, OR, etc. to combine elementary tests.

category.pattern: CONDITIONALLY EXECUTES A COMMAND . DOCUMENTATION IS AVAILABLE BY ENTERING IF / ? TO CMD PROMPT
category.template: Conditionally executes a command. Documentation is available by entering IF /? to CMD prompt.

category.pattern: GOTO WITHIN THE BODY OF A FOR LOOP MAKES CMD FORGET ABOUT THE LOOP EVEN IF THE LABEL IS WITHIN THE SAME LOOP BODY
category.template: Goto within the body of a for loop makes cmd forget about the loop, even if the label is within the same loop body.

category.pattern: GOES TO A LABEL
category.template: Goes to a label.

category.pattern: OUTPUTS OR SETS THE COMMAND TO BE EXECUTED FOR A FILE TYPE . SEE ALSO ASSOC
category.template: Outputs or sets the command to be executed for a file type. See also ASSOC.

category.pattern: IN THE FOLLOWING EXAMPLES % I IS TO BE USED FROM THE COMMAND LINE WHILE % % I IS TO BE USED FROM A BATCH . THE INDEX ( E.G . % I ) MUST BE A SINGLE CHARACTER VARIABLE NAME
category.template: In the following examples, %i is to be used from the command line while%%i is to be used from a batch. The index (e.g., %i) must be a single character variable name.

category.pattern: ITERATES OVER A SERIES OF VALUES EXECUTING A COMMAND . KEYWORDS : LOOP
category.template: Iterates over a series of values, executing a command. Keywords: loop.

category.pattern: EXITS THE DOS CONSOLE OR WITH / B ONLY THE CURRENTLY RUNNING BATCH OR THE CURRENTLY EXECUTED SUBROUTINE . IF USED WITHOUT / B IN A BATCH FILE CAUSES THE DOS CONSOLE CALLING THE BATCH TO CLOSE
category.template: Exits the DOS console or, with /b, only the currently running batch or the currently executed subroutine. If used without /b in a batch file, causes the DOS console calling the batch to close.

category.pattern: A SYNONYM OF DEL
category.template: A synonym of DEL.

category.pattern: ENDS LOCAL SET OF ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES STARTED USING SETLOCAL . CAN BE USED TO CREATE SUBPROGRAMS : SEE FUNCTIONS
category.template: Ends local set of environment variables started using SETLOCAL. Can be used to create subprograms: see Functions.

category.pattern: SEE ALSO IF
category.template: See also IF.

category.pattern: OUTPUTS MESSAGES OR TURNS COMMAND ECHOING ON OR OFF
category.template: Outputs messages, or turns command echoing on or off.

category.pattern: GETTING DATE IN THE ISO FORMAT LIKE 2000 - 01 - 28 : THAT IS NOWHERE EASY AS THE DATE FORMAT DEPENDS ON COUNTRY SETTINGS
category.template: Getting date in the iso format, like "2000-01-28": That is nowhere easy, as the date format depends on country settings.

category.pattern: OUTPUTS OR SETS THE DATE . THE WAY THE DATE IS OUTPUT DEPENDS ON COUNTRY SETTINGS . DATE CAN ALSO BE OUTPUT USING ECHO % DATE %
category.template: Outputs or sets the date. The way the date is output depends on country settings. Date can also be output using "echo %DATE%".

category.pattern: OUTPUTS OR SETS THE DATE . THE WAY THE DATE IS OUTPUT DEPENDS ON COUNTRY SETTINGS . DATE CAN ALSO BE OUTPUT USING ECHO % DATE %
category.template: Outputs or sets the date. The way the date is output depends on country settings. Date can also be output using "echo %DATE%".

category.pattern: LISTS THE CONTENTS OF A DIRECTORY . OFFERS A RANGE OF OPTIONS . TYPE DIR / ? FOR MORE HELP
category.template: Lists the contents of a directory. Offers a range of options. Type "dir /?" for more help.

category.pattern: DELETES FILES . USE WITH CAUTION ESPECIALLY IN COMBINATION WITH WILDCARDS . ONLY DELETES FILES NOT DIRECTORIES FOR WHICH SEE RD . FOR MORE TYPE DEL / ?
category.template: Deletes files. Use with caution, especially in combination with wildcards. Only deletes files, not directories, for which see RD. For more, type "del /?".

category.pattern: DELETES FILES . USE WITH CAUTION ESPECIALLY IN COMBINATION WITH WILDCARDS . ONLY DELETES FILES NOT DIRECTORIES FOR WHICH SEE RD . FOR MORE TYPE DEL / ?
category.template: Deletes files. Use with caution, especially in combination with wildcards. Only deletes files, not directories, for which see RD. For more, type "del /?".

category.pattern: COPIES FILES . SEE ALSO MOVE XCOPY AND ROBOCOPY
category.template: Copies files. See also MOVE, XCOPY and ROBOCOPY.

category.pattern: SETS THE CONSOLE FOREGROUND AND BACKGROUND COLORS
category.template: Sets the console foreground and background colors.

category.pattern: CLEARS THE SCREEN
category.template: Clears the screen.

category.pattern: A SYNONYM OF CD
category.template: A synonym of CD.

category.pattern: CHANGES TO A DIFFERENT DIRECTORY OR OUTPUTS THE CURRENT DIRECTORY . HOWEVER IF A DIFFERENT DRIVE LETTER IS USED IT DOES NOT SWITCH TO THAT DIFFERENT DRIVE OR VOLUME
category.template: Changes to a different directory, or outputs the current directory. However, if a different drive letter is used, it does not switch to that different drive or volume.

category.pattern: SEE ALSO FUNCTIONS CMD AMD START
category.template: See also Functions, CMD amd START.

category.pattern: THE CALLEE INHERITS ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES OF THE CALLER AND UNLESS THE CALLEE PREVENTS THAT VIA SETLOCAL CHANGES MADE BY THE CALLEE TO ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES BECOME VISIBLE TO THE CALLER ONCE IT RESUMES EXECUTION
category.template: The callee inherits environment variables of the caller, and unless the callee prevents that via SETLOCAL, changes made by the callee to environment variables become visible to the caller once it resumes execution.

category.pattern: BEWARE THAT CALLING A BATCH PROGRAM FROM A BATCH WITHOUT USING THE CALL KEYWORD RESULTS IN THE EXECUTION NEVER RETURNING TO THE CALLER ONCE THE CALLEE FINISHES
category.template: Beware that calling a batch program from a batch without using the call keyword results in the execution never returning to the caller once the callee finishes.

category.pattern: FOR CALLING A SUBPROGRAM SEE FUNCTIONS SECTION
category.template: For calling a subprogram, see Functions section.

category.pattern: CALLS ONE BATCH PROGRAM FROM ANOTHER CALLS A SUBPROGRAM WITHIN A SINGLE BATCH PROGRAM OR AS AN UNDOCUMENTED BEHAVIOR STARTS A PROGRAM . IN PARTICULAR SUSPENDS THE EXECUTION OF THE CALLER STARTS EXECUTING THE CALLEE AND RESUMES THE EXECUTION OF THE CALLER IF AND WHEN THE CALLEE FINISHES EXECUTION
category.template: Calls one batch program from another, calls a subprogram within a single batch program, or, as an undocumented behavior, starts a program. In particular, suspends the execution of the caller, starts executing the callee, and resumes the execution of the caller if and when the callee finishes execution.

category.pattern: IN WINDOWS VERSIONS BASED ON WINDOWS NT DOES NOTHING ; KEPT FOR COMPATIBILITY WITH MS DOS
category.template: In Windows versions based on Windows NT, does nothing; kept for compatibility with MS DOS.

category.pattern: ASSOCIATES AN EXTENSION WITH A FILE TYPE ( FTYPE ) OUTPUTS EXISTING ASSOCIATIONS OR DELETES AN ASSOCIATION . SEE ALSO FTYPE
category.template: Associates an extension with a file type (FTYPE), outputs existing associations, or deletes an association. See also FTYPE.

category.pattern: THESE COMMANDS ARE ALL BUILT IN TO THE COMMAND INTERPRETER ITSELF AND CANNOT BE CHANGED . SOMETIMES THIS IS BECAUSE THEY REQUIRE ACCESS TO INTERNAL COMMAND INTERPRETER DATA STRUCTURES OR MODIFY PROPERTIES OF THE COMMAND INTERPRETER PROCESS ITSELF
category.template: These commands are all built in to the command interpreter itself, and cannot be changed. Sometimes this is because they require access to internal command interpreter data structures, or modify properties of the command interpreter process itself.

category.pattern: 5 ) IF YOU ARE ON OLD 32 - BIT VERSION OF WINDOWS ( NOT VERY LIKELY ) USE DEBUG ; SEE DEBUG
category.template: 5) If you are on old 32-bit version of Windows (not very likely), use debug; see DEBUG.

category.pattern: 4 ) INSTALL A COMMAND SUCH AS THE FEATURE-RICH OD OR HEXDUMP ; SEE UNIX COMMANDS . OD CAN DO OCTAL DUMP AS WELL
category.template: 4) Install a command such as the feature-rich od or hexdump; see Unix commands. od can do octal dump as well.

category.pattern: THERE IS NO BUILT-IN COMMAND TO GET LAST LINES OF A FILE ; NO EQUIVALENT OF TAIL COMMAND . HOWEVER A BATCH CAN BE WRITTEN TO DO THE JOB AND IS AVAILABLE FROM THE LINK BELOW . ALTERNATIVELY ONE CAN INSTALL TAIL COMMAND FOR WINDOWS OR RUN A POWERSHELL EQUIVALENT WITH NO INSTALLATION REQUIRED
category.template: There is no built-in command to get last lines of a file; no equivalent of tail command. However, a batch can be written to do the job and is available from the link below. Alternatively, one can install tail command for Windows, or run a PowerShell equivalent with no installation required.

category.pattern: THERE IS NO TOUCH COMMAND FAMILIAR FROM OTHER OPERATING SYSTEMS . THE TOUCH COMMAND WOULD MODIFY THE LAST-MODIFICATION TIMESTAMP OF A FILE WITHOUT CHANGING ITS CONTENT
category.template: There is no touch command familiar from other operating systems. The touch command would modify the last-modification timestamp of a file without changing its content.

category.pattern: AN ALTERNATIVE WAY OF RUNNING GNU COMMANDS FOR WINDOWS 10 IS WINDOWS SUBSYSTEM FOR LINUX
category.template: An alternative way of running GNU commands for Windows 10 is Windows Subsystem for Linux.

category.pattern: WINDOWS CMD.EXE COMMAND INTERPRETER CAN USE COMMANDS FROM UNIX-LIKE OPERATING SYSTEMS PROVIDED THEY ARE INSTALLED . EXAMPLE COMMANDS INCLUDE GREP SED AWK WC HEAD AND TAIL . THE COMMANDS ARE AVAILABLE FROM GNU PROJECT AND THEIR WINDOWS PORTS EXIST . YOU CAN LEARN MORE ABOUT THE COMMANDS IN GUIDE TO UNIX WIKIBOOK . BEWARE THAT BATCH PROGRAMS THAT COME TO DEPEND ON THESE COMMANDS ARE NOT GUARANTEED TO WORK ON OTHER WINDOWS MACHINES
category.template: Windows cmd.exe command interpreter can use commands from Unix-like operating systems, provided they are installed. Example commands include grep, sed, awk, wc, head and tail. The commands are available from GNU project, and their Windows ports exist. You can learn more about the commands in Guide to Unix Wikibook. Beware that batch programs that come to depend on these commands are not guaranteed to work on other Windows machines.

category.pattern: ON THE WEB PERL ONE-LINERS ARE OFTEN POSTED IN THE COMMAND-LINE CONVENTIONS OF ANOTHER OPERATING SYSTEM INCLUDING THE USE OF APOSTROPHE ( ) TO SURROUND THE ARGUMENTS INSTEAD OF WINDOWS QUOTATION MARKS . THESE NEED TO BE TWEAKED FOR WINDOWS
category.template: On the web, Perl one-liners are often posted in the command-line conventions of another operating system, including the use of apostrophe (') to surround the arguments instead of Windows quotation marks. These need to be tweaked for Windows.

category.pattern: SOME TASKS CAN BE CONVENIENTLY ACHIEVED WITH PERL ONE-LINERS . PERL IS A SCRIPTING LANGUAGE ORIGINATING IN THE ENVIRONMENT OF ANOTHER OPERATING SYSTEM . SINCE MANY WINDOWS COMPUTING ENVIRONMENTS HAVE PERL INSTALLED PERL ONE-LINERS ARE A NATURAL AND COMPACT EXTENSION OF WINDOWS BATCH SCRIPTING
category.template: Some tasks can be conveniently achieved with Perl one-liners. Perl is a scripting language originating in the environment of another operating system. Since many Windows computing environments have Perl installed, Perl one-liners are a natural and compact extension of Windows batch scripting.

category.pattern: ARRAYS CAN BE EMULATED IN THE DELAYED EXPANSION MODE USING THE COMBINATION OF % AND ! TO INDICATE VARIABLES . THERE % I % IS THE VALUE OF VARIABLE I WITH THE IMMEDIATE EXPANSION WHILE ! I ! IS THE VALUE OF VARIABLE I IN THE DELAYED EXPANSION
category.template: Arrays can be emulated in the delayed expansion mode using the combination of% and! to indicate variables. There, %i% is the value of variable i with the immediate expansion while !i! is the value of variable i in the delayed expansion.

category.pattern: SPECIAL DEVICE NAMES INCLUDE NUL CON PRN AUX COM1 . . . COM9 LPT1 . . . LPT9 ; THESE CAN BE REDIRECTED TO
category.template: Special device names include NUL, CON, PRN, AUX, COM1, ..., COM9, LPT1, ..., LPT9; these can be redirected to.

category.pattern: FORWARD SLASH ( / ) OFTEN WORKS WHEN USED INSTEAD OF ( \ ) BUT NOT ALWAYS ; IT IS NORMALLY USED TO MARK SWITCHES ( OPTIONS ) . USING FORWARD SLASH CAN LEAD TO VARIOUS OBSCURE BEHAVIORS AND IS BEST AVOIDED
category.template: Forward slash (/) often works when used instead of (\) but not always; it is normally used to mark switches (options). Using forward slash can lead to various obscure behaviors, and is best avoided.

category.pattern: FILE AND DIRECTORY PATHS FOLLOW CERTAIN CONVENTIONS . THESE INCLUDE THE POSSIBLE USE OF A DRIVE LETTER FOLLOWED BY A COLON ( : ) THE USE OF BACKSLASH ( \ ) AS THE PATH SEPARATOR AND THE DISTINCTION BETWEEN RELATIVE AND ABSOLUTE PATHS
category.template: File and directory paths follow certain conventions. These include the possible use of a drive letter followed by a colon (:), the use of backslash (\) as the path separator, and the distinction between relative and absolute paths.

category.pattern: THE AVAILABILITY OF THE ABOVE SHORTCUTS DOES NOT SEEM TO DEPEND ON RUNNING DOSKEY
category.template: The availability of the above shortcuts does not seem to depend on running DOSKEY.

category.pattern: THE ABOVE ARE ALSO KNOWN AS COMMAND PROMPT KEYBOARD SHORTCUTS
category.template: The above are also known as command prompt keyboard shortcuts.

category.pattern: FILES CAN BE FOUND USING #DIR #FOR #FINDSTR #FORFILES AND #WHERE
category.template: Files can be found using #DIR, #FOR, #FINDSTR, #FORFILES, and #WHERE.

category.pattern: LITERALS CAN BE ENTERED AS DECIMAL ( 1234 ) HEXADECIMAL ( 0XFFFF LEADING 0X ) AND OCTAL ( 0777 LEADING 0 )
