category.template: Dropout consists in randomly setting a fraction rate of input units to 0 at each update during training time, which helps prevent overfitting.

category.pattern: APPLIES DROPOUT TO THE INPUT
category.template: Applies dropout to the input.

category.pattern: FOR INSTANCE FOR A 2D INPUT WITH SHAPE ( BATCHSIZE INPUTDIM ) THE OUTPUT WOULD HAVE SHAPE ( BATCHSIZE UNITS )
category.template: For instance, for a 2D input with shape (batchSize, inputDim), the output would have shape (batchSize, units).

category.pattern: ND TENSOR WITH SHAPE : ( BATCHSIZE . . . UNITS )
category.template: nD tensor with shape: (batchSize, ..., units).

category.pattern: ND TF.TENSOR WITH SHAPE : ( BATCHSIZE . . . INPUTDIM )
category.template: nD tf.Tensor with shape: (batchSize, ..., inputDim).

category.pattern: CREATES A DENSE ( FULLY CONNECTED ) LAYER
category.template: Creates a dense (fully connected) layer.

category.pattern: APPLIES AN ACTIVATION FUNCTION TO AN OUTPUT
category.template: Applies an activation function to an output.

category.pattern: IT ALLOWS A SMALL GRADIENT WHEN THE UNIT IS NOT ACTIVE : F ( X ) = ALPHA * X FOR X < 0 . F ( X ) = X FOR X > = 0
category.template: It allows a small gradient when the unit is not active: f(x) = alpha * x for x < 0. f(x) = x for x >= 0.

category.pattern: LEAKY VERSION OF A RECTIFIED LINEAR UNIT
category.template: Leaky version of a rectified linear unit.

category.pattern: LAYERS WILL AUTOMATICALLY TAKE CARE OF CREATING AND INITIALIZING THE VARIOUS INTERNAL VARIABLES / WEIGHTS THEY NEED TO FUNCTION
category.template: Layers will automatically take care of creating and initializing the various internal variables/weights they need to function.

category.pattern: LAYERS ARE THE PRIMARY BUILDING BLOCK FOR CONSTRUCTING A MODEL . EACH LAYER WILL TYPICALLY PERFORM SOME COMPUTATION TO TRANSFORM ITS INPUT TO ITS OUTPUT
category.template: Layers are the primary building block for constructing a Model. Each layer will typically perform some computation to transform its input to its output.

category.pattern: PRINT A TEXT SUMMARY OF THE SEQUENTIAL MODEL S LAYERS
category.template: Print a text summary of the Sequential model's layers.

category.pattern: ADDS A LAYER INSTANCE ON TOP OF THE LAYER STACK
category.template: Adds a layer instance on top of the layer stack.

category.pattern: TF.SEQUENTIAL ( ) IS A FACTORY FUNCTION THAT CREATES AN INSTANCE OF TF.SEQUENTIAL
category.template: tf.sequential() is a factory function that creates an instance of tf.Sequential.

category.pattern: IF BOTH NAME AND INDEX ARE SPECIFIED INDEX TAKES PRECEDENCE
category.template: If both name and index are specified, index takes precedence.

category.pattern: EXAMPLE 4 . SEND MODEL S TOPOLOGY AND WEIGHTS TO AN HTTP SERVER . SEE THE DOCUMENTATION OF TF.IO.HTTP ( ) FOR MORE DETAILS INCLUDING SPECIFYING REQUEST PARAMETERS AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SERVER
category.template: Example 4. Send model's topology and weights to an HTTP server. See the documentation of tf.io.http() for more details including specifying request parameters and implementation of the server.

category.pattern: EXAMPLE 2 . SAVING MODEL S TOPOLOGY AND WEIGHTS TO BROWSER INDEXEDDB ; THEN LOAD IT BACK
USED ONLY IF VALIDATIONDATA IS AN ARRAY OF TF.TENSOR OBJECTS I.E . NOT A DATASET OBJECT
category.template: Used only if validationData is an array of tf.Tensor objects, i.e., not a dataset object.

category.pattern: IF VALIDATIONDATA IS A DATASET OBJECT AND THE VALIDATIONBATCHES PARAMETER IS SPECIFIED THE VALIDATION WILL USE VALIDATIONBATCHES BATCHES DRAWN FROM THE DATASET OBJECT . IF VALIDATIONBATCHES PARAMETER IS NOT SPECIFIED THE VALIDATION WILL STOP WHEN THE DATASET IS EXHAUSTED
category.template: If validationData is a dataset object, and the validationBatches parameter is specified, the validation will use validationBatches batches drawn from the dataset object. If validationBatches parameter is not specified, the validation will stop when the dataset is exhausted.

category.pattern: IF VALIDATIONDATA IS AN ARRAY OF TENSOR OBJECTS EACH TF.TENSOR WILL BE SLICED INTO BATCHES DURING VALIDATION USING THE PARAMETER VALIDATIONBATCHSIZE ( WHICH DEFAULTS TO 32 ) . THE ENTIRETY OF THE TF.TENSOR OBJECTS WILL BE USED IN THE VALIDATION
category.template: If validationData is an Array of Tensor objects, each tf.Tensor will be sliced into batches during validation, using the parameter validationBatchSize (which defaults to 32). The entirety of the tf.Tensor objects will be used in the validation.

category.pattern: TRAINS THE MODEL USING A DATASET OBJECT
category.template: Trains the model using a dataset object.

category.pattern: TRAINS THE MODEL FOR A FIXED NUMBER OF EPOCHS ( ITERATIONS ON A DATASET )

random.li: Trains the model for a fixed number of epochs (iterations on a dataset).
Trains the model for a fixed number of epochs (iterations on a dataset).

category.pattern: GENERATES OUTPUT PREDICTIONS FOR THE INPUT SAMPLES
category.template: Generates output predictions for the input samples.

category.pattern: COMPUTATION IS DONE IN BATCHES
category.template: Computation is done in batches.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE LOSS VALUE & METRICS VALUES FOR THE MODEL IN TEST MODE
category.template: Returns the loss value & metrics values for the model in test mode.

category.pattern: CONFIGURES AND PREPARES THE MODEL FOR TRAINING AND EVALUATION . COMPILING OUTFITS THE MODEL WITH AN OPTIMIZER LOSS AND / OR METRICS . CALLING FIT OR EVALUATE ON AN UN-COMPILED MODEL WILL THROW AN ERROR
category.template: Configures and prepares the model for training and evaluation. Compiling outfits the model with an optimizer, loss, and/or metrics. Calling fit or evaluate on an un-compiled model will throw an error.

category.pattern: PRINT A TEXT SUMMARY OF THE MODEL S LAYERS
category.template: Print a text summary of the model's layers.

category.pattern: EXECUTES INFERENCE FOR THE MODEL FOR GIVEN INPUT TENSORS IN ASYNC FASHION USE THIS METHOD WHEN YOUR MODEL CONTAINS CONTROL FLOW OPS
category.template: Executes inference for the model for given input tensors in async fashion, use this method when your model contains control flow ops.

category.pattern: EXAMPLE 1 : SAVE MODEL S TOPOLOGY AND WEIGHTS TO BROWSER LOCAL STORAGE ; THEN LOAD IT BACK
LOAD A GRAPH MODEL GIVEN A SYNCHRONOUS IO HANDLER WITH A LOAD METHOD
category.template: Load a graph model given a synchronous IO handler with a 'load' method.

category.pattern: THE FOLLOWING GITHUB GIST HTTPS://GIST.GITHUB.COM/DSMILKOV/1B6046FD6132D7408D5257B0976F7864 IMPLEMENTS A SERVER BASED ON FLASK THAT CAN RECEIVE THE REQUEST . UPON RECEIVING THE MODEL ARTIFACTS VIA THE REQUST THIS PARTICULAR SERVER RECONSISTUTES INSTANCES OF KERAS MODELS IN MEMORY
category.template: The following GitHub Gist https://gist.github.com/dsmilkov/1b6046fd6132d7408d5257b0976f7864 implements a server based on flask that can receive the request. Upon receiving the model artifacts via the requst, this particular server reconsistutes instances of Keras Models in memory.

category.pattern: CREATES AN IOHANDLER THAT TRIGGERS FILE DOWNLOADS FROM THE BROWSER
category.template: Creates an IOHandler that triggers file downloads from the browser.

category.pattern: EXAMPLE 4 . LOAD A MODEL FROM USER-SELECTED FILES FROM HTML FILE INPUT ELEMENTS
category.template: Example 4. Load a model from user-selected files from HTML file input elements.

category.pattern: WITH THIS FUNC YOU CAN CONVERT THE WEIGHT FILE NAME TO ANY URL
category.template: With this func you can convert the weight file name to any URL.

category.pattern: SETTING THIS TO TRUE ALLOWS PASSING A TF-HUB MODULE URL OMITTING THE STANDARD MODEL FILE NAME AND THE QUERY PARAMETERS
category.template: Setting this to true allows passing a TF-Hub module URL, omitting the standard model file name and the query parameters.

category.pattern: LOAD A GRAPH MODEL GIVEN A URL TO THE MODEL DEFINITION
category.template: Load a graph model given a URL to the model definition.

category.pattern: NOTE : INPUT IS ONLY NECESSARY WHEN USING MODEL . WHEN USING SEQUENTIAL SPECIFY INPUTSHAPE FOR THE FIRST LAYER OR USE INPUTLAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER
category.template: Note: input is only necessary when using model. When using sequential, specify inputShape for the first layer or use inputLayer as the first layer.

category.pattern: USERS SHOULD CALL THE INPUT FACTORY FUNCTION FOR CONSISTENCY WITH OTHER GENERATOR FUNCTIONS
category.template: Users should call the input factory function for consistency with other generator functions.

category.pattern: USED TO INSTANTIATE AN INPUT TO A MODEL AS A TF.SYMBOLICTENSOR
category.template: Used to instantiate an input to a model as a tf.SymbolicTensor.

category.pattern: FOR EXAMPLE THE FOLLOWING CODE SNIPPET DEFINES A MODEL CONSISTING OF TWO DENSE LAYERS WITH 10 AND 4 UNITS RESPECTIVELY
category.template: For example, the following code snippet defines a model consisting of two dense layers, with 10 and 4 units, respectively.

category.pattern: WHEN CREATING A TF.LAYERSMODEL SPECIFY ITS INPUT ( S ) AND OUTPUT ( S ) . LAYERS ARE USED TO WIRE INPUT ( S ) TO OUTPUT ( S )
category.template: When creating a tf.LayersModel, specify its input(s) and output(s). Layers are used to wire input(s) to output(s).

category.pattern: MODELS ARE A COLLECTION OF LAYERS SEE MODEL CREATION FOR DETAILS ABOUT HOW LAYERS CAN BE CONNECTED
category.template: Models are a collection of Layers, see Model Creation for details about how Layers can be connected.

category.pattern: THE GENERATED VALUES FOLLOW A UNIFORM DISTRIBUTION IN THE RANGE [ MINVAL MAXVAL ) . THE LOWER BOUND MINVAL IS INCLUDED IN THE RANGE WHILE THE UPPER BOUND MAXVAL IS EXCLUDED
category.template: The generated values follow a uniform distribution in the range [minval, maxval). The lower bound minval is included in the range, while the upper bound maxval is excluded.

category.pattern: CREATES A TF.TENSOR WITH VALUES SAMPLED FROM A UNIFORM DISTRIBUTION
category.template: Creates a tf.Tensor with values sampled from a uniform distribution.

category.pattern: CREATES A TF.TENSOR WITH VALUES SAMPLED FROM A RANDOM NUMBER GENERATOR FUNCTION DEFINED BY THE USER
category.template: Creates a tf.Tensor with values sampled from a random number generator function defined by the user.

category.pattern: EXTRACTS A SLICE FROM A TF.TENSOR STARTING AT COORDINATES BEGIN AND IS OF SIZE SIZE
category.template: Extracts a slice from a tf.Tensor starting at coordinates begin and is of size size.

category.pattern: EXCEPT TF.REVERSE1D ( WHICH DOES NOT HAVE AXIS PARAM ) ALL METHODS HAVE SAME SIGNATURE AS THIS METHOD
category.template: Except tf.reverse1d (which does not have axis param), all methods have same signature as this method.

category.pattern: GATHER SLICES FROM TENSOR X S AXIS AXIS ACCORDING TO INDICES
category.template: Gather slices from tensor x's axis axis according to indices.

category.pattern: CONCATENATES A LIST OF TF.TENSORS ALONG A GIVEN AXIS
category.template: Concatenates a list of tf.Tensors along a given axis.

category.pattern: ALSO AVAILABLE ARE STRICTER RANK-SPECIFIC METHODS WITH THE SAME SIGNATURE AS THIS METHOD THAT ASSERT THAT PADDINGS IS OF GIVEN LENGTH
category.template: Also available are stricter rank-specific methods with the same signature as this method that assert that paddings is of given length.

category.pattern: PADS A TF.TENSOR WITH A GIVEN VALUE AND PADDINGS
category.template: Pads a tf.Tensor with a given value and paddings.

category.pattern: PADS A TF.TENSOR USING MIRROR PADDING
category.template: Pads a tf.Tensor using mirror padding.

category.pattern: RETURNS A TF.TENSOR THAT HAS EXPANDED RANK BY INSERTING A DIMENSION INTO THE TENSOR S SHAPE
category.template: Returns a tf.Tensor that has expanded rank, by inserting a dimension into the tensor's shape.

category.pattern: BROADCAST AN ARRAY TO A COMPATIBLE SHAPE NUMPY-STYLE
category.template: Broadcast an array to a compatible shape NumPy-style.

category.pattern: RETURN THE SHAPE OF S0 OP S1 WITH BROADCAST
category.template: Return the shape of s0 op s1 with broadcast.

category.pattern: SETS A VALUE IN THE BUFFER AT A GIVEN LOCATION
category.template: Sets a value in the buffer at a given location.

category.pattern: A MUTABLE OBJECT SIMILAR TO TF.TENSOR THAT ALLOWS USERS TO SET VALUES AT LOCATIONS BEFORE CONVERTING TO AN IMMUTABLE TF.TENSOR
category.template: A mutable object, similar to tf.Tensor, that allows users to set values at locations before converting to an immutable tf.Tensor.

category.pattern: A MUTABLE TF.TENSOR USEFUL FOR PERSISTING STATE E.G . FOR TRAINING
category.template: A mutable tf.Tensor, useful for persisting state, e.g. for training.

category.pattern: FOR WEBGPU BACKEND THE DATA WILL BE STORED ON A BUFFER . THERE IS NO PARAMETER SO CAN NOT USE AN USER DEFINED SIZE TO CREATE THE BUFFER
category.template: For WebGPU backend, the data will be stored on a buffer. There is no parameter, so can not use an user defined size to create the buffer.

category.pattern: FOR WEBGL BACKEND THE DATA WILL BE STORED ON A DENSELY PACKED TEXTURE . THIS MEANS THAT THE TEXTURE WILL USE THE RGBA CHANNELS TO STORE VALUE
category.template: For WebGL backend, the data will be stored on a densely packed texture. This means that the texture will use the RGBA channels to store value.

category.pattern: COPY THE TENSOR S DATA TO A NEW GPU RESOURCE . COMPARING TO THE DATASYNC ( ) AND DATA ( ) THIS METHOD PREVENTS DATA FROM BEING DOWNLOADED TO CPU
category.template: Copy the tensor's data to a new GPU resource. Comparing to the dataSync() and data(), this method prevents data from being downloaded to CPU.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE TENSOR DATA AS A NESTED ARRAY . THE TRANSFER OF DATA IS DONE SYNCHRONOUSLY
category.template: Returns the tensor data as a nested array. The transfer of data is done synchronously.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE TENSOR DATA AS A NESTED ARRAY . THE TRANSFER OF DATA IS DONE ASYNCHRONOUSLY
category.template: Returns the tensor data as a nested array. The transfer of data is done asynchronously.

category.pattern: RETURNS A PROMISE OF TF.TENSORBUFFER THAT HOLDS THE UNDERLYING DATA
category.template: Returns a promise of tf.TensorBuffer that holds the underlying data.

category.pattern: A TF.TENSOR OBJECT REPRESENTS AN IMMUTABLE MULTIDIMENSIONAL ARRAY OF NUMBERS THAT HAS A SHAPE AND A DATA TYPE
category.template: A tf.Tensor object represents an immutable, multidimensional array of numbers that has a shape and a data type.

category.pattern: THE GENERATED VALUES FOLLOW A NORMAL DISTRIBUTION WITH SPECIFIED MEAN AND STANDARD DEVIATION EXCEPT THAT VALUES WHOSE MAGNITUDE IS MORE THAN 2 STANDARD DEVIATIONS FROM THE MEAN ARE DROPPED AND RE-PICKED
category.template: The generated values follow a normal distribution with specified mean and standard deviation, except that values whose magnitude is more than 2 standard deviations from the mean are dropped and re-picked.

category.pattern: CREATES A TF.TENSOR WITH VALUES SAMPLED FROM A TRUNCATED NORMAL DISTRIBUTION
category.template: Creates a tf.Tensor with values sampled from a truncated normal distribution.

category.pattern: CREATES A NEW TF.TENSOR1D FILLED WITH THE NUMBERS IN THE RANGE PROVIDED
category.template: Creates a new tf.Tensor1D filled with the numbers in the range provided.

category.pattern: CREATES A TF.TENSOR WITH ALL ELEMENTS SET TO 1
category.template: Creates a tf.Tensor with all elements set to 1.

category.pattern: THE INPUT TENSORS REAL AND IMAG MUST HAVE THE SAME SHAPE
category.template: The input tensors real and imag must have the same shape.

category.pattern: WHEN DONE CALL BUFFER.TOTENSOR ( ) TO GET AN IMMUTABLE TF.TENSOR WITH THOSE VALUES
category.template: When done, call buffer.toTensor() to get an immutable tf.Tensor with those values.

category.pattern: CREATES AN EMPTY TF.TENSORBUFFER WITH THE SPECIFIED SHAPE AND DTYPE
category.template: Creates an empty tf.TensorBuffer with the specified shape and dtype.

category.pattern: THE SAME FUNCTIONALITY CAN BE ACHIEVED WITH TF.TENSOR ( ) BUT IN GENERAL WE RECOMMEND USING TF.TENSOR6D ( ) AS IT MAKES THE CODE MORE READABLE
category.template: The same functionality can be achieved with tf.tensor(), but in general we recommend using tf.tensor6d() as it makes the code more readable.

category.pattern: CREATES RANK-6 TF.TENSOR WITH THE PROVIDED VALUES SHAPE AND DTYPE
category.template: Creates rank-6 tf.Tensor with the provided values, shape and dtype.

category.pattern: THE SAME FUNCTIONALITY CAN BE ACHIEVED WITH TF.TENSOR ( ) BUT IN GENERAL WE RECOMMEND USING TF.TENSOR5D ( ) AS IT MAKES THE CODE MORE READABLE
category.template: The same functionality can be achieved with tf.tensor(), but in general we recommend using tf.tensor5d() as it makes the code more readable.

category.pattern: CREATES RANK-5 TF.TENSOR WITH THE PROVIDED VALUES SHAPE AND DTYPE
category.template: Creates rank-5 tf.Tensor with the provided values, shape and dtype.

category.pattern: THE SAME FUNCTIONALITY CAN BE ACHIEVED WITH TF.TENSOR ( ) BUT IN GENERAL WE RECOMMEND USING TF.TENSOR4D ( ) AS IT MAKES THE CODE MORE READABLE
category.template: The same functionality can be achieved with tf.tensor(), but in general we recommend using tf.tensor4d() as it makes the code more readable.

category.pattern: CREATES RANK-4 TF.TENSOR WITH THE PROVIDED VALUES SHAPE AND DTYPE
category.template: Creates rank-4 tf.Tensor with the provided values, shape and dtype.

category.pattern: CREATES RANK-3 TF.TENSOR WITH THE PROVIDED VALUES SHAPE AND DTYPE
category.template: Creates rank-3 tf.Tensor with the provided values, shape and dtype.

category.pattern: CREATES RANK-2 TF.TENSOR WITH THE PROVIDED VALUES SHAPE AND DTYPE
category.template: Creates rank-2 tf.Tensor with the provided values, shape and dtype.

category.pattern: THE SAME FUNCTIONALITY CAN BE ACHIEVED WITH TF.TENSOR ( ) BUT IN GENERAL WE RECOMMEND USING TF.TENSOR1D ( ) AS IT MAKES THE CODE MORE READABLE
category.template: The same functionality can be achieved with tf.tensor(), but in general we recommend using tf.tensor1d() as it makes the code more readable.

category.pattern: CREATES RANK-1 TF.TENSOR WITH THE PROVIDED VALUES SHAPE AND DTYPE
category.template: Creates rank-1 tf.Tensor with the provided values, shape and dtype.

category.pattern: CREATES A TF.TENSOR WITH THE PROVIDED VALUES SHAPE AND DTYPE
category.template: Creates a tf.Tensor with the provided values, shape and dtype.

category.pattern: WE HAVE UTILITY FUNCTIONS FOR COMMON CASES LIKE SCALAR 1D 2D 3D AND 4D TENSORS AS WELL A NUMBER OF FUNCTIONS TO INITIALIZE TENSORS IN WAYS USEFUL FOR MACHINE LEARNING
category.template: We have utility functions for common cases like Scalar, 1D, 2D, 3D and 4D tensors, as well a number of functions to initialize tensors in ways useful for machine learning.

category.pattern: TENSORS ARE THE CORE DATASTRUCTURE OF TENSORFLOW.JS THEY ARE A GENERALIZATION OF VECTORS AND MATRICES TO POTENTIALLY HIGHER DIMENSIONS
category.template: Tensors are the core datastructure of TensorFlow.js They are a generalization of vectors and matrices to potentially higher dimensions.

category.pattern: TRUE IS NOT SUPPORTED YET
category.template: True is not supported yet.

category.pattern: IF SPECIFIED TRAINING WILL BE STOPPED IF THE MODEL DOESN T SHOW IMPROVEMENT OVER THE BASELINE
category.template: If specified, training will be stopped if the model doesn't show improvement over the baseline.

category.pattern: DEFAULTS TO AUTO
category.template: Defaults to 'auto'.

category.pattern: DEFAULTS TO AUTO
category.template: Defaults to 'auto'.

category.pattern: DEFAULTS TO 0
category.template: Defaults to 0.

category.pattern: DEFAULTS TO VAL_LOSS
category.template: Defaults to 'val_loss'.

category.pattern: DEFAULTS TO VAL_LOSS
category.template: Defaults to 'val_loss'.

category.pattern: EARLY STOPPING IS A TYPE OF REGULARIZATION AND PROTECTS MODEL AGAINST OVERFITTING
category.template: Early stopping is a type of regularization, and protects model against overfitting.

category.pattern: FACTORY FUNCTION FOR A CALLBACK THAT STOPS TRAINING WHEN A MONITORED QUANTITY HAS STOPPED IMPROVING
category.template: Factory function for a Callback that stops training when a monitored quantity has stopped improving.

category.pattern: SPARSE CATEGORICAL ACCURACY METRIC FUNCTION
category.template: Sparse categorical accuracy metric function.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE RECALL OF THE PREDICTIONS WITH RESPECT TO THE LABELS
category.template: Computes the recall of the predictions with respect to the labels.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE PRECISION OF THE PREDICTIONS WITH RESPECT TO THE LABELS
category.template: Computes the precision of the predictions with respect to the labels.

category.pattern: ALIASES : TF.METRICS.MSE TF.METRICS.MSE
category.template: Aliases: tf.metrics.MSE, tf.metrics.mse.

category.pattern: LOSS OR METRIC FUNCTION : MEAN SQUARED ERROR
category.template: Loss or metric function: Mean squared error.

category.pattern: ALIASES : TF.METRICS.MAPE TF.METRICS.MAPE
category.template: Aliases: tf.metrics.MAPE, tf.metrics.mape.

category.pattern: LOSS OR METRIC FUNCTION : MEAN ABSOLUTE PERCENTAGE ERROR
category.template: Loss or metric function: Mean absolute percentage error.

category.pattern: MATHEMATICALLY MEAN ABSOLUTE ERROR IS DEFINED AS : MEAN ( ABS ( YPRED - YTRUE ) ) WHEREIN THE MEAN IS APPLIED OVER FEATURE DIMENSIONS
category.template: Mathematically, mean absolute error is defined as: mean(abs(yPred - yTrue)), wherein the mean is applied over feature dimensions.

category.pattern: LOSS OR METRIC FUNCTION : MEAN ABSOLUTE ERROR
category.template: Loss or metric function: Mean absolute error.

category.pattern: MATHEMATICALLY COSINE PROXIMITY IS DEFINED AS : - SUM ( L2NORMALIZE ( YTRUE ) * L2NORMALIZE ( YPRED ) ) WHEREIN L2NORMALIZE ( ) NORMALIZES THE L2 NORM OF THE INPUT TO 1 AND * REPRESENTS ELEMENT-WISE MULTIPLICATION
category.template: Mathematically, cosine proximity is defined as: -sum(l2Normalize(yTrue) * l2Normalize(yPred)), wherein l2Normalize() normalizes the L2 norm of the input to 1 and * represents element-wise multiplication.

category.pattern: LOSS OR METRIC FUNCTION : COSINE PROXIMITY
category.template: Loss or metric function: Cosine proximity.

category.pattern: CATEGORICAL CROSSENTROPY BETWEEN AN OUTPUT TENSOR AND A TARGET TENSOR
category.template: Categorical crossentropy between an output tensor and a target tensor.

category.pattern: CATEGORICAL ACCURACY METRIC FUNCTION
category.template: Categorical accuracy metric function.

category.pattern: BINARY CROSSENTROPY METRIC FUNCTION
category.template: Binary crossentropy metric function.

category.pattern: BINARY ACCURACY METRIC FUNCTION
category.template: Binary accuracy metric function.

category.pattern: RETURNS A PROMISE THAT RESOLVES WHEN THE CANVAS HAS BEEN DRAWN TO
category.template: Returns a promise that resolves when the canvas has been drawn to.

category.pattern: WHEN THE DTYPE OF THE INPUT IS FLOAT32 WE ASSUME VALUES IN THE RANGE [ 0 - 1 ] . OTHERWISE WHEN INPUT IS INT32 WE ASSUME VALUES IN THE RANGE [ 0 - 255 ]
category.template: When the dtype of the input is 'float32', we assume values in the range [0-1]. Otherwise, when input is 'int32', we assume values in the range [0-255].

category.pattern: DRAWS A TF.TENSOR OF PIXEL VALUES TO A BYTE ARRAY OR OPTIONALLY A CANVAS
category.template: Draws a tf.Tensor of pixel values to a byte array or optionally a canvas.

category.pattern: THIS API IS THE ASYNC VERSION OF FROMPIXELS . THE API WILL FIRST CHECK | WRAP_TO_IMAGEBITMAP | FLAG AND TRY TO WRAP THE INPUT TO IMAGEBITMAP IF THE FLAG IS SET TO TRUE
category.template: This API is the async version of fromPixels. The API will first check |WRAP_TO_IMAGEBITMAP| flag, and try to wrap the input to imageBitmap if the flag is set to true.

category.pattern: CREATES A TF.TENSOR FROM AN IMAGE IN ASYNC WAY
category.template: Creates a tf.Tensor from an image in async way.

category.pattern: CREATES A TF.TENSOR FROM AN IMAGE
category.template: Creates a tf.Tensor from an image.

category.pattern: NOTE THIS DISPOSES THE CURRENT BACKEND IF ANY AS WELL AS ANY TENSORS ASSOCIATED WITH IT . A NEW BACKEND IS INITIALIZED EVEN IF IT IS OF THE SAME TYPE AS THE PREVIOUS ONE
category.template: Note this disposes the current backend, if any, as well as any tensors associated with it. A new backend is initialized, even if it is of the same type as the previous one.

category.pattern: SETS THE BACKEND ( CPU WEBGL WASM ETC ) RESPONSIBLE FOR CREATING TENSORS AND EXECUTING OPERATIONS ON THOSE TENSORS . RETURNS A PROMISE THAT RESOLVES TO A BOOLEAN IF THE BACKEND INITIALIZATION WAS SUCCESSFUL
category.template: Sets the backend (cpu, webgl, wasm, etc) responsible for creating tensors and executing operations on those tensors. Returns a promise that resolves to a boolean if the backend initialization was successful.

category.pattern: REMOVES A BACKEND AND THE REGISTERED FACTORY
category.template: Removes a backend and the registered factory.

category.pattern: REGISTERS A GLOBAL BACKEND . THE REGISTRATION SHOULD HAPPEN WHEN IMPORTING A MODULE FILE ( E.G . WHEN IMPORTING BACKEND_WEBGL.TS ) AND IS USED FOR MODULAR BUILDS ( E.G . CUSTOM TFJS BUNDLE WITH ONLY WEBGL SUPPORT )
category.template: Registers a global backend. The registration should happen when importing a module file (e.g. when importing backend_webgl.ts), and is used for modular builds (e.g. custom tfjs bundle with only webgl support).

category.pattern: RETURNS A PROMISE THAT RESOLVES WHEN THE CURRENTLY SELECTED BACKEND ( OR THE HIGHEST PRIORITY ONE ) HAS INITIALIZED . AWAIT THIS PROMISE WHEN YOU ARE USING A BACKEND THAT HAS ASYNC INITIALIZATION
category.template: Returns a promise that resolves when the currently selected backend (or the highest priority one) has initialized. Await this promise when you are using a backend that has async initialization.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE CURRENT BACKEND NAME ( CPU WEBGL ETC ) . THE BACKEND IS RESPONSIBLE FOR CREATING TENSORS AND EXECUTING OPERATIONS ON THOSE TENSORS
category.template: Returns the current backend name (cpu, webgl, etc). The backend is responsible for creating tensors and executing operations on those tensors.

category.pattern: GETS THE CURRENT BACKEND . IF NO BACKENDS HAVE BEEN INITIALIZED THIS WILL ATTEMPT TO INITIALIZE THE BEST BACKEND . WILL THROW AN ERROR IF THE HIGHEST PRIORITY BACKEND HAS ASYNC INITIALIZATION IN WHICH CASE YOU SHOULD CALL AWAIT TF.READY ( ) BEFORE RUNNING OTHER CODE
category.template: Gets the current backend. If no backends have been initialized, this will attempt to initialize the best backend. Will throw an error if the highest priority backend has async initialization, in which case, you should call 'await tf.ready()' before running other code.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE SIZE ( NUMBER OF ELEMENTS ) OF THE TENSOR GIVEN ITS SHAPE
category.template: Returns the size (number of elements) of the tensor given its shape.

category.pattern: SHUFFLES TWO ARRAYS IN-PLACE THE SAME WAY USING FISHER-YATES ALGORITHM
category.template: Shuffles two arrays in-place the same way using Fisher-Yates algorithm.

category.pattern: SHUFFLES THE ARRAY IN-PLACE USING FISHER-YATES ALGORITHM
category.template: Shuffles the array in-place using Fisher-Yates algorithm.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE CURRENT HIGH-RESOLUTION TIME IN MILLISECONDS RELATIVE TO AN ARBITRARY TIME IN THE PAST . IT WORKS ACROSS DIFFERENT PLATFORMS ( NODE.JS BROWSERS )
category.template: Returns the current high-resolution time in milliseconds relative to an arbitrary time in the past. It works across different platforms (node.js, browsers).

category.pattern: FLATTENS AN ARBITRARILY NESTED ARRAY
category.template: Flattens an arbitrarily nested array.

category.pattern: IF NOT TF.UTIL.FETCH RETURNS A PLATFORM-SPECIFIC SOLUTION
category.template: If not, tf.util.fetch returns a platform-specific solution.

category.pattern: IF FETCH IS DEFINED ON THE GLOBAL OBJECT ( WINDOW PROCESS ETC . ) TF.UTIL.FETCH RETURNS THAT FUNCTION
category.template: If fetch is defined on the global object (window, process, etc.), tf.util.fetch returns that function.

category.pattern: RETURNS A PLATFORM-SPECIFIC IMPLEMENTATION OF FETCH
category.template: Returns a platform-specific implementation of fetch.

category.pattern: ENCODES THE PROVIDED STRING INTO BYTES USING THE PROVIDED ENCODING SCHEME
category.template: Encodes the provided string into bytes using the provided encoding scheme.

category.pattern: DECODES THE PROVIDED BYTES INTO A STRING USING THE PROVIDED ENCODING SCHEME
category.template: Decodes the provided bytes into a string using the provided encoding scheme.

category.pattern: CREATES A NEW ARRAY WITH RANDOMIZED INDICIES TO A GIVEN QUANTITY
category.template: Creates a new array with randomized indicies to a given quantity.

category.pattern: ASSERTS THAT THE EXPRESSION IS TRUE . OTHERWISE THROWS AN ERROR WITH THE PROVIDED MESSAGE
category.template: Asserts that the expression is true. Otherwise throws an error with the provided message.

category.pattern: OBVIOUSLY THIS WILL SUCCEED ONLY FOR SMALL DATASETS THAT FIT IN MEMORY . USEFUL FOR TESTING AND GENERALLY SHOULD BE AVOIDED IF POSSIBLE
category.template: Obviously this will succeed only for small datasets that fit in memory. Useful for testing and generally should be avoided if possible.

category.pattern: COLLECT ALL ELEMENTS OF THIS DATASET INTO AN ARRAY
category.template: Collect all elements of this dataset into an array.

category.pattern: CREATES A DATASET WITH AT MOST COUNT INITIAL ELEMENTS FROM THIS DATASET
category.template: Creates a Dataset with at most count initial elements from this dataset.

category.pattern: PSEUDORANDOMLY SHUFFLES THE ELEMENTS OF THIS DATASET . THIS IS DONE IN A STREAMING MANNER BY SAMPLING FROM A GIVEN NUMBER OF PREFETCHED ELEMENTS
category.template: Pseudorandomly shuffles the elements of this dataset. This is done in a streaming manner, by sampling from a given number of prefetched elements.

category.pattern: CREATES A DATASET THAT SKIPS COUNT INITIAL ELEMENTS FROM THIS DATASET
category.template: Creates a Dataset that skips count initial elements from this dataset.

category.pattern: NOTE : IF THIS DATASET IS A FUNCTION OF GLOBAL STATE ( E.G . A RANDOM NUMBER GENERATOR ) THEN DIFFERENT REPETITIONS MAY PRODUCE DIFFERENT ELEMENTS
category.template: NOTE: If this dataset is a function of global state (e.g. a random number generator), then different repetitions may produce different elements.

category.pattern: REPEATS THIS DATASET COUNT TIMES
category.template: Repeats this dataset count times.

category.pattern: CREATES A DATASET THAT PREFETCHES ELEMENTS FROM THIS DATASET
category.template: Creates a Dataset that prefetches elements from this dataset.

category.pattern: MAPS THIS DATASET THROUGH AN ASYNC 1 - TO-1 TRANSFORM
category.template: Maps this dataset through an async 1-to-1 transform.

category.pattern: MAPS THIS DATASET THROUGH A 1 - TO-1 TRANSFORM
category.template: Maps this dataset through a 1-to-1 transform.

category.pattern: AFTER THE FUNCTION IS APPLIED TO A DATASET ELEMENT ANY TENSORS CONTAINED WITHIN THAT ELEMENT ARE DISPOSED
category.template: After the function is applied to a dataset element, any Tensors contained within that element are disposed.

category.pattern: APPLY A FUNCTION TO EVERY ELEMENT OF THE DATASET
category.template: Apply a function to every element of the dataset.

category.pattern: FILTERS THIS DATASET ACCORDING TO PREDICATE
category.template: Filters this dataset according to predicate.

category.pattern: CONCATENATES THIS DATASET WITH ANOTHER
category.template: Concatenates this Dataset with another.

category.pattern: IF AN ARRAY SHOULD NOT BE BATCHED AS A UNIT IT SHOULD FIRST BE CONVERTED TO AN OBJECT WITH INTEGER KEYS
category.template: If an array should not be batched as a unit, it should first be converted to an object with integer keys.

category.pattern: INCOMING PRIMITIVES ARE GROUPED INTO A 1 - D TENSOR . INCOMING TENSORS ARE GROUPED INTO A NEW TENSOR WHERE THE 0 TH AXIS IS THE BATCH DIMENSION . INCOMING ARRAYS ARE CONVERTED TO TENSOR AND THEN BATCHED . A NESTED ARRAY IS INTERPRETED AS AN N-D TENSOR SO THE BATCHED RESULT HAS N + 1 DIMENSIONS . AN ARRAY THAT CANNOT BE CONVERTED TO TENSOR PRODUCES AN ERROR
category.template: Incoming primitives are grouped into a 1-D Tensor. Incoming Tensors are grouped into a new Tensor where the 0'th axis is the batch dimension. Incoming arrays are converted to Tensor and then batched. A nested array is interpreted as an n-D Tensor, so the batched result has n+1 dimensions. An array that cannot be converted to Tensor produces an error.

category.pattern: IT IS ASSUMED THAT EACH OF THE INCOMING DATASET ELEMENTS HAS THE SAME STRUCTURE-- I.E . THE SAME SET OF KEYS AT EACH LOCATION IN AN OBJECT HIERARCHY . FOR EACH KEY THE RESULTING DATASET PROVIDES A BATCHED ELEMENT COLLECTING ALL OF THE INCOMING VALUES FOR THAT KEY
category.template: It is assumed that each of the incoming dataset elements has the same structure-- i.e. the same set of keys at each location in an object hierarchy. For each key, the resulting Dataset provides a batched element collecting all of the incoming values for that key.

category.pattern: GROUPS ELEMENTS INTO BATCHES
category.template: Groups elements into batches.

category.pattern: THE FOLLOWING CODE EXAMPLES ARE CALLING AWAIT DATASET.FOREACHASYNC ( . . . ) TO ITERATE ONCE OVER THE ENTIRE DATASET IN ORDER TO PRINT OUT THE DATA
category.template: The following code examples are calling await dataset.forEachAsync(...) to iterate once over the entire dataset in order to print out the data.

category.pattern: A DATASET IS TYPICALLY PROCESSED AS A STREAM OF UNBATCHED EXAMPLES - - I.E . ITS TRANSFORMATIONS ARE APPLIED ONE EXAMPLE AT A TIME . BATCHING PRODUCES A NEW DATASET WHERE EACH ELEMENT IS A BATCH . BATCHING SHOULD USUALLY COME LAST IN A PIPELINE BECAUSE DATA TRANSFORMATIONS ARE EASIER TO EXPRESS ON A PER-EXAMPLE BASIS THAN ON A PER-BATCH BASIS
category.template: A Dataset is typically processed as a stream of unbatched examples --i.e., its transformations are applied one example at a time. Batching produces a new Dataset where each element is a batch. Batching should usually come last in a pipeline, because data transformations are easier to express on a per-example basis than on a per-batch basis.

category.pattern: DATA LOADING AND TRANSFORMATION IS DONE IN A LAZY STREAMING FASHION . THE DATASET MAY BE ITERATED OVER MULTIPLE TIMES ; EACH ITERATION STARTS THE DATA LOADING ANEW AND RECAPITULATES THE TRANSFORMATIONS
category.template: Data loading and transformation is done in a lazy, streaming fashion. The dataset may be iterated over multiple times; each iteration starts the data loading anew and recapitulates the transformations.

category.pattern: A DATASET REPRESENTS AN ORDERED COLLECTION OF ELEMENTS TOGETHER WITH A CHAIN OF TRANSFORMATIONS TO BE PERFORMED ON THOSE ELEMENTS . EACH TRANSFORMATION IS A METHOD OF DATASET THAT RETURNS ANOTHER DATASET SO THESE MAY BE CHAINED E.G . CONST PROCESSEDDATASET = RAWDATASET.FILTER ( . . . ) . MAP ( . . . ) . BATCH ( . . . )
category.template: A Dataset represents an ordered collection of elements, together with a chain of transformations to be performed on those elements. Each transformation is a method of Dataset that returns another Dataset, so these may be chained, e.g. const processedDataset = rawDataset.filter(...).map(...).batch(...).

category.pattern: A DATA EXAMPLE MAY BE A PRIMITIVE AN ARRAY A MAP FROM STRING KEYS TO VALUES OR ANY NESTED STRUCTURE OF THESE
category.template: A 'data example' may be a primitive, an array, a map from string keys to values, or any nested structure of these.

category.pattern: REPRESENTS A POTENTIALLY LARGE LIST OF INDEPENDENT DATA ELEMENTS ( TYPICALLY SAMPLES OR EXAMPLES )
category.template: Represents a potentially large list of independent data elements (typically 'samples' or 'examples').

category.pattern: RETURNS COLUMN NAMES OF THE CSV DATASET . IF CONFIGUREDCOLUMNSONLY IS TRUE RETURN COLUMN NAMES IN COLUMNCONFIGS . IF CONFIGUREDCOLUMNSONLY IS FALSE AND COLUMNNAMES IS PROVIDED COLUMNNAMES . IF CONFIGUREDCOLUMNSONLY IS FALSE AND COLUMNNAMES IS NOT PROVIDED RETURN ALL COLUMN NAMES PARSED FROM THE CSV FILE . FOR EXAMPLE USAGE PLEASE GO TO TF.DATA.CSV ( )
category.template: Returns column names of the csv dataset. If configuredColumnsOnly is true, return column names in columnConfigs. If configuredColumnsOnly is false and columnNames is provided, columnNames. If configuredColumnsOnly is false and columnNames is not provided, return all column names parsed from the csv file. For example usage please go to tf.data.csv().

category.pattern: THE RESULTS ARE NOT BATCHED
category.template: The results are not batched.

category.pattern: THE PRODUCED TENSORCONTAINERS EACH CONTAIN ONE KEY-VALUE PAIR FOR EVERY COLUMN OF THE TABLE . WHEN A FIELD IS EMPTY IN THE INCOMING DATA THE RESULTING VALUE IS UNDEFINED OR THROW ERROR IF IT IS REQUIRED . VALUES THAT CAN BE PARSED AS NUMBERS ARE EMITTED AS TYPE NUMBER OTHER VALUES ARE PARSED AS STRING
category.template: The produced TensorContainers each contain one key-value pair for every column of the table. When a field is empty in the incoming data, the resulting value is undefined, or throw error if it is required. Values that can be parsed as numbers are emitted as type number, other values are parsed as string.

category.pattern: REPRESENTS A POTENTIALLY LARGE COLLECTION OF DELIMITED TEXT RECORDS
category.template: Represents a potentially large collection of delimited text records.

category.pattern: THE NESTED STRUCTURE OF THE DATASETS ARGUMENT DETERMINES THE STRUCTURE OF ELEMENTS IN THE RESULTING ITERATOR
category.template: The nested structure of the datasets argument determines the structure of elements in the resulting iterator.

category.pattern: THE NUMBER OF ELEMENTS IN THE RESULTING DATASET IS THE SAME AS THE SIZE OF THE SMALLEST DATASET IN DATASETS
category.template: The number of elements in the resulting dataset is the same as the size of the smallest dataset in datasets.

category.pattern: CREATE A DATASET BY ZIPPING TOGETHER AN ARRAY DICT OR NESTED STRUCTURE OF DATASETS ( AND PERHAPS ADDITIONAL CONSTANTS ) . THE UNDERLYING DATASETS MUST PROVIDE ELEMENTS IN A CONSISTENT ORDER SUCH THAT THEY CORRESPOND
category.template: Create a Dataset by zipping together an array, dict, or nested structure of Datasets (and perhaps additional constants). The underlying datasets must provide elements in a consistent order such that they correspond.

category.pattern: NOTE : THIS CODE SNIPPET ONLY WORKS WHEN THE DEVICE HAS A WEBCAM . IT WILL REQUEST PERMISSION TO OPEN THE WEBCAM WHEN RUNNING
category.template: Note: this code snippet only works when the device has a webcam. It will request permission to open the webcam when running.

category.pattern: CREATE AN ITERATOR THAT GENERATE TENSORS FROM WEBCAM VIDEO STREAM . THIS API ONLY WORKS IN BROWSER ENVIRONMENT WHEN THE DEVICE HAS WEBCAM
category.template: Create an iterator that generate Tensors from webcam video stream. This API only works in Browser environment when the device has webcam.

category.pattern: NOTE : THIS CODE SNIPPET ONLY WORKS WHEN THE DEVICE HAS A MICROPHONE . IT WILL REQUEST PERMISSION TO OPEN THE MICROPHONE WHEN RUNNING
category.template: Note: this code snippet only works when the device has a microphone. It will request permission to open the microphone when running.

category.pattern: CREATE AN ITERATOR THAT GENERATE FREQUENCY-DOMAIN SPECTROGRAM TENSORS FROM MICROPHONE AUDIO STREAM WITH BROWSER S NATIVE FFT . THIS API ONLY WORKS IN BROWSER ENVIRONMENT WHEN THE DEVICE HAS MICROPHONE
category.template: Create an iterator that generate frequency-domain spectrogram Tensors from microphone audio stream with browser's native FFT. This API only works in browser environment when the device has microphone.

category.pattern: THE RETURNED ITERATOR SHOULD HAVE . NEXT ( ) FUNCTION THAT RETURNS ELEMENT IN FORMAT OF { VALUE : TENSORCONTAINER DONE : BOOLEAN }
category.template: The returned iterator should have .next() function that returns element in format of {value: TensorContainer, done:boolean}.

category.pattern: CREATE A DATASET THAT PRODUCES EACH ELEMENT FROM PROVIDED JAVASCRIPT GENERATOR WHICH IS A FUNCTION * ( HTTPS://DEVELOPER.MOZILLA.ORG/EN-US/DOCS/WEB/JAVASCRIPT/GUIDE/ITERATORS_AND_GENERATORS#GENERATOR_FUNCTIONS), OR A FUNCTION THAT RETURNS AN ITERATOR ( HTTPS://DEVELOPER.MOZILLA.ORG/EN-US/DOCS/WEB/JAVASCRIPT/GUIDE/ITERATORS_AND_GENERATORS#GENERATOR_FUNCTIONS).
category.template: Create a Dataset that produces each element from provided JavaScript generator, which is a function* (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Iterators_and_Generators#Generator_functions), or a function that returns an iterator (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Iterators_and_Generators#Generator_functions).

category.pattern: ISLABEL WHETHER THIS COLUMN IS LABEL INSTEAD OF FEATURES . IF ISLABEL IS TRUE FOR AT LEAST ONE COLUMN THE ELEMENT IN RETURNED CSVDATASET WILL BE AN OBJECT OF { XS : FEATURES YS : LABELS } : XS IS A DICT OF FEATURES KEY / VALUE PAIRS YS IS A DICT OF LABELS KEY / VALUE PAIRS . IF NO COLUMN IS MARKED AS LABEL RETURNS A DICT OF FEATURES ONLY
category.template: isLabel Whether this column is label instead of features. If isLabel is true for at least one column, the element in returned CSVDataset will be an object of {xs: features, ys: labels}: xs is a dict of features key/value pairs, ys is a dict of labels key/value pairs. If no column is marked as label, returns a dict of features only.

category.pattern: DEFAULT DEFAULT VALUE OF THIS COLUMN
category.template: default Default value of this column.

category.pattern: DTYPE DATA TYPE OF THIS COLUMN . COULD BE INT32 FLOAT32 BOOL OR STRING
category.template: dtype Data type of this column. Could be int32, float32, bool, or string.

category.pattern: REQUIRED IF VALUE IN THIS COLUMN IS REQUIRED . IF SET TO TRUE THROW AN ERROR WHEN IT FINDS AN EMPTY VALUE
category.template: required If value in this column is required. If set to true, throw an error when it finds an empty value.

category.pattern: NOTE : IF ISLABEL IN COLUMNCONFIGS IS TRUE FOR AT LEAST ONE COLUMN THE ELEMENT IN RETURNED CSVDATASET WILL BE AN OBJECT OF { XS : FEATURES YS : LABELS } : XS IS A DICT OF FEATURES KEY / VALUE PAIRS YS IS A DICT OF LABELS KEY / VALUE PAIRS . IF NO COLUMN IS MARKED AS LABEL RETURNS A DICT OF FEATURES ONLY
category.template: Note: If isLabel in columnConfigs is true for at least one column, the element in returned CSVDataset will be an object of {xs:features, ys:labels}: xs is a dict of features key/value pairs, ys is a dict of labels key/value pairs. If no column is marked as label, returns a dict of features only.

category.pattern: CREATE A CSVDATASET BY READING AND DECODING CSV FILE ( S ) FROM PROVIDED URL OR LOCAL PATH IF IT S IN NODE ENVIRONMENT
category.template: Create a CSVDataset by reading and decoding CSV file(s) from provided URL or local path if it's in Node environment.

category.pattern: CREATE A DATASET FROM AN ARRAY OF ELEMENTS
category.template: Create a Dataset from an array of elements.

category.pattern: TENSORFLOW.JS DATA PROVIDES SIMPLE APIS TO LOAD AND PARSE DATA FROM DISK OR OVER THE WEB IN A VARIETY OF FORMATS AND TO PREPARE THAT DATA FOR USE IN MACHINE LEARNING MODELS ( E.G . VIA OPERATIONS LIKE FILTER MAP SHUFFLE AND BATCH )
category.template: TensorFlow.js Data provides simple APIs to load and parse data from disk or over the web in a variety of formats, and to prepare that data for use in machine learning models (e.g. via operations like filter, map, shuffle, and batch).

category.pattern: REGULARIZER FOR L2 REGULARIZATION
category.template: Regularizer for L2 regularization.

category.pattern: REGULARIZER FOR L1 AND L2 REGULARIZATION
category.template: Regularizer for L1 and L2 regularization.

category.pattern: REGULARIZER FOR L1 REGULARIZATION
category.template: Regularizer for L1 regularization.

category.pattern: REGULARIZERS CAN BE ATTACHED TO VARIOUS COMPONENTS OF A LAYER TO ADD A SCORING FUNCTION TO HELP DRIVE WEIGHTS OR OTHER TRAINABLE VALUES AWAY FROM EXCESSIVELY LARGE VALUES . THEY RE TYPICALLY USED TO PROMOTE A NOTION THAT A SIMPLER MODEL IS BETTER THAN A COMPLICATED MODEL ASSUMING EQUAL PERFORMANCE
category.template: Regularizers can be attached to various components of a Layer to add a 'scoring' function to help drive weights, or other trainable values, away from excessively large values. They're typically used to promote a notion that a 'simpler' model is better than a complicated model, assuming equal performance.

category.pattern: INITIALIZER THAT GENERATES TENSORS INITIALIZED TO 0
category.template: Initializer that generates tensors initialized to 0.

category.pattern: THESE VALUES ARE SIMILAR TO VALUES FROM A RANDOMNORMAL EXCEPT THAT VALUES MORE THAN TWO STANDARD DEVIATIONS FROM THE MEAN ARE DISCARDED AND RE-DRAWN . THIS IS THE RECOMMENDED INITIALIZER FOR NEURAL NETWORK WEIGHTS AND FILTERS
category.template: These values are similar to values from a RandomNormal except that values more than two standard deviations from the mean are discarded and re-drawn. This is the recommended initializer for neural network weights and filters.

category.pattern: INITIALIZER THAT GENERATES RANDOM VALUES INITIALIZED TO A TRUNCATED NORMAL . DISTRIBUTION
category.template: Initializer that generates random values initialized to a truncated normal. distribution.

category.pattern: VALUES WILL BE DISTRIBUTED UNIFORMLY BETWEEN THE CONFIGURED MINVAL AND MAXVAL
category.template: Values will be distributed uniformly between the configured minval and maxval.

category.pattern: INITIALIZER THAT GENERATES RANDOM VALUES INITIALIZED TO A UNIFORM DISTRIBUTION
category.template: Initializer that generates random values initialized to a uniform distribution.

category.pattern: INITIALIZER THAT GENERATES RANDOM VALUES INITIALIZED TO A NORMAL DISTRIBUTION
category.template: Initializer that generates random values initialized to a normal distribution.

category.pattern: INITIALIZER THAT GENERATES A RANDOM ORTHOGONAL MATRIX
category.template: Initializer that generates a random orthogonal matrix.

category.pattern: INITIALIZER THAT GENERATES TENSORS INITIALIZED TO 1
category.template: Initializer that generates tensors initialized to 1.

category.pattern: IT DRAWS SAMPLES FROM A UNIFORM DISTRIBUTION IN THE INTERVAL [ - LIMIT LIMIT ] WITH LIMIT = SQRT ( 3 / FANIN ) WHERE FANIN IS THE NUMBER OF INPUT UNITS IN THE WEIGHT TENSOR
category.template: It draws samples from a uniform distribution in the interval [-limit, limit] with limit = sqrt(3 / fanIn), where fanIn is the number of input units in the weight tensor.

category.pattern: LECUN UNIFORM INITIALIZER
category.template: LeCun uniform initializer.

category.pattern: IT DRAWS SAMPLES FROM A TRUNCATED NORMAL DISTRIBUTION CENTERED ON 0 WITH STDDEV = SQRT ( 1 / FANIN ) WHERE FANIN IS THE NUMBER OF INPUT UNITS IN THE WEIGHT TENSOR
category.template: It draws samples from a truncated normal distribution centered on 0 with stddev = sqrt(1 / fanIn) where fanIn is the number of input units in the weight tensor.

category.pattern: LECUN NORMAL INITIALIZER
category.template: LeCun normal initializer.

category.pattern: INITIALIZER THAT GENERATES THE IDENTITY MATRIX . ONLY USE FOR SQUARE 2D MATRICES
category.template: Initializer that generates the identity matrix. Only use for square 2D matrices.

category.pattern: IT DRAWS SAMPLES FROM A UNIFORM DISTRIBUTION WITHIN [ - LIMIT LIMIT ] WHERE LIMIT IS SQRT ( 6 / FAN_IN ) WHERE FANIN IS THE NUMBER OF INPUT UNITS IN THE WEIGHT TENSOR
category.template: It draws samples from a uniform distribution within [-limit, limit] where limit is sqrt(6 / fan_in) where fanIn is the number of input units in the weight tensor.

category.pattern: HE UNIFORM INITIALIZER
category.template: He uniform initializer.

category.pattern: IT DRAWS SAMPLES FROM A TRUNCATED NORMAL DISTRIBUTION CENTERED ON 0 WITH STDDEV = SQRT ( 2 / FANIN ) WHERE FANIN IS THE NUMBER OF INPUT UNITS IN THE WEIGHT TENSOR
category.template: It draws samples from a truncated normal distribution centered on 0 with stddev = sqrt(2 / fanIn) where fanIn is the number of input units in the weight tensor.

category.pattern: HE NORMAL INITIALIZER
category.template: He normal initializer.

category.pattern: REFERENCE : GLOROT & BENGIO AISTATS 2010 HTTP://JMLR.ORG/PROCEEDINGS/PAPERS/V9/GLOROT10A/GLOROT10A.PDF.
category.template: Reference: Glorot & Bengio, AISTATS 2010 http://jmlr.org/proceedings/papers/v9/glorot10a/glorot10a.pdf.

category.pattern: GLOROT NORMAL INITIALIZER ALSO CALLED XAVIER NORMAL INITIALIZER . IT DRAWS SAMPLES FROM A TRUNCATED NORMAL DISTRIBUTION CENTERED ON 0 WITH STDDEV = SQRT ( 2 / ( FAN_IN + FAN_OUT ) ) WHERE FAN_IN IS THE NUMBER OF INPUT UNITS IN THE WEIGHT TENSOR AND FAN_OUT IS THE NUMBER OF OUTPUT UNITS IN THE WEIGHT TENSOR
category.template: Glorot normal initializer, also called Xavier normal initializer. It draws samples from a truncated normal distribution centered on 0 with stddev = sqrt(2 / (fan_in + fan_out)) where fan_in is the number of input units in the weight tensor and fan_out is the number of output units in the weight tensor.

category.pattern: INITIALIZER THAT GENERATES VALUES INITIALIZED TO SOME CONSTANT
category.template: Initializer that generates values initialized to some constant.

category.pattern: INITIALIZER BASE CLASS
category.template: Initializer base class.

category.pattern: INITIALIZERS ARE USED IN LAYERS TO ESTABLISH THE STARTING THE VALUES OF WEIGHTS BIASES KERNELS ETC
category.template: Initializers are used in Layers to establish the starting the values of weights, biases, kernels, etc.

category.pattern: FOR INSTANCE IN A DENSE LAYER THE WEIGHT MATRIX HAS SHAPE [ INPUTDIM OUTPUTDIM ] SET AXIS TO 0 TO CONSTRAIN EACH WEIGHT VECTOR OF LENGTH [ INPUTDIM ] . IN A CONV2D LAYER WITH DATAFORMAT = CHANNELS_LAST THE WEIGHT TENSOR HAS SHAPE [ ROWS COLS INPUTDEPTH OUTPUTDEPTH ] SETAXISTO [ 0 1 2 ] TO CONSTRAIN THE WEIGHTS OF EACH FILTER TENSOR OF SIZE [ ROWS COLS INPUTDEPTH ]
category.template: For instance, in a Dense layer the weight matrix has shape [inputDim, outputDim], set axis to 0 to constrain each weight vector of length [inputDim,]. In a Conv2D layer with dataFormat="channels_last", the weight tensor has shape [rows, cols, inputDepth, outputDepth], setaxisto[0, 1, 2]to constrain the weights of each filter tensor of size[rows, cols, inputDepth]`.

category.pattern: FOR INSTANCE IN A DENSE LAYER THE WEIGHT MATRIX HAS SHAPE [ INPUTDIM OUTPUTDIM ] SET AXIS TO 0 TO CONSTRAIN EACH WEIGHT VECTOR OF LENGTH [ INPUTDIM ] . IN A CONV2D LAYER WITH DATAFORMAT = CHANNELS_LAST THE WEIGHT TENSOR HAS SHAPE [ ROWS COLS INPUTDEPTH OUTPUTDEPTH ] SETAXISTO [ 0 1 2 ] TO CONSTRAIN THE WEIGHTS OF EACH FILTER TENSOR OF SIZE [ ROWS COLS INPUTDEPTH ]
category.template: For instance, in a Dense layer the weight matrix has shape [inputDim, outputDim], set axis to 0 to constrain each weight vector of length [inputDim,]. In a Conv2D layer with dataFormat="channels_last", the weight tensor has shape [rows, cols, inputDepth, outputDepth], setaxisto[0, 1, 2]to constrain the weights of each filter tensor of size[rows, cols, inputDepth]`.

category.pattern: CONSTRAINS THE WEIGHTS INCIDENT TO EACH HIDDEN UNIT TO HAVE UNIT NORM
category.template: Constrains the weights incident to each hidden unit to have unit norm.

category.pattern: CONSTAINS THE WEIGHT TO BE NON-NEGATIVE
category.template: Constains the weight to be non-negative.

category.pattern: FOR INSTANCE IN A DENSE LAYER THE WEIGHT MATRIX HAS SHAPE [ INPUTDIM OUTPUTDIM ] SET AXIS TO 0 TO CONSTRAIN EACH WEIGHT VECTOR OF LENGTH [ INPUTDIM ] . IN A CONV2D LAYER WITH DATAFORMAT = CHANNELS_LAST THE WEIGHT TENSOR HAS SHAPE [ ROWS COLS INPUTDEPTH OUTPUTDEPTH ] SET AXIS TO [ 0 1 2 ] TO CONSTRAIN THE WEIGHTS OF EACH FILTER TENSOR OF SIZE [ ROWS COLS INPUTDEPTH ]
category.template: For instance, in a Dense layer the weight matrix has shape [inputDim, outputDim], set axis to 0 to constrain each weight vector of length [inputDim,]. In a Conv2D layer with dataFormat="channels_last", the weight tensor has shape [rows, cols, inputDepth, outputDepth], set axis to [0, 1, 2] to constrain the weights of each filter tensor of size [rows, cols, inputDepth].

category.pattern: CONSTRAINS THE WEIGHTS INCIDENT TO EACH HIDDEN UNIT TO HAVE A NORM LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO A DESIRED VALUE
category.template: Constrains the weights incident to each hidden unit to have a norm less than or equal to a desired value.

category.pattern: MAXNORM WEIGHT CONSTRAINT
category.template: MaxNorm weight constraint.

category.pattern: CONSTRAINTS ARE ADDED TO ATTRIBUTES OF A LAYER ( SUCH AS WEIGHTS KERNELS OR BIASES ) AT CONSTRUCTION TIME TO CLAMP OR OTHERWISE ENFORCE AN ALLOWED RANGE OF VALUES FOR DIFFERENT COMPONENTS OF THE LAYER
category.template: Constraints are added to attributes of a Layer (such as weights, kernels, or biases) at construction time to clamp, or otherwise enforce an allowed range, of values for different components of the Layer.

category.pattern: THE ENVIRONMENT OBJECT CONTAINS THE EVALUATED FEATURE VALUES AS WELL AS THE ACTIVE PLATFORM
category.template: The environment object contains the evaluated feature values as well as the active platform.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE CURRENT ENVIRONMENT ( A GLOBAL SINGLETON )
category.template: Returns the current environment (a global singleton).

category.pattern: IT RETURNS THE GLOBAL ENGINE THAT KEEPS TRACK OF ALL TENSORS AND BACKENDS
category.template: It returns the global engine that keeps track of all tensors and backends.

category.pattern: ENABLES PRODUCTION MODE WHICH DISABLES CORRECTNESS CHECKS IN FAVOR OF PERFORMANCE
category.template: Enables production mode which disables correctness checks in favor of performance.

category.pattern: SEE ALSO : TF.PROFILE ( ) TF.MEMORY ( )
category.template: See also: tf.profile(), tf.memory().

category.pattern: DEBUG MODE WILL SIGNIFICANTLY SLOW DOWN YOUR APPLICATION AS IT WILL DOWNLOAD THE RESULT OF EVERY OPERATION TO THE CPU . THIS SHOULD NOT BE USED IN PRODUCTION . DEBUG MODE DOES NOT AFFECT THE TIMING INFORMATION OF THE KERNEL EXECUTION AS WE DO NOT MEASURE DOWNLOAD TIME IN THE KERNEL EXECUTION TIME
category.template: Debug mode will significantly slow down your application as it will download the result of every operation to the CPU. This should not be used in production. Debug mode does not affect the timing information of the kernel execution as we do not measure download time in the kernel execution time.

category.pattern: ENABLES DEBUG MODE WHICH WILL LOG INFORMATION ABOUT ALL EXECUTED KERNELS : THE ELAPSED TIME OF THE KERNEL EXECUTION AS WELL AS THE RANK SHAPE AND SIZE OF THE OUTPUT TENSOR
category.template: Enables debug mode which will log information about all executed kernels: the elapsed time of the kernel execution, as well as the rank, shape, and size of the output tensor.

category.pattern: DISPOSE ALL VARIABLES KEPT IN BACKEND ENGINE
category.template: Dispose all variables kept in backend engine.

category.pattern: THE ENVIRONMENT CONTAINS EVALUATED FLAGS AS WELL AS THE REGISTERED PLATFORM . THIS IS ALWAYS USED AS A GLOBAL SINGLETON AND CAN BE RETRIEVED WITH TF.ENV ( )
category.template: The environment contains evaluated flags as well as the registered platform. This is always used as a global singleton and can be retrieved with tf.env().

category.pattern: TENSORFLOW.JS CAN RUN MATHEMATICAL OPERATIONS ON DIFFERENT BACKENDS . CURRENTLY WE SUPPORT WEBGL AND JAVASCRIPT CPU . BY DEFAULT WE CHOOSE THE BEST BACKEND AVAILABLE BUT ALLOW USERS TO CUSTOMIZE THEIR BACKEND
category.template: TensorFlow.js can run mathematical operations on different backends. Currently, we support WebGL and JavaScript CPU. By default, we choose the 'best' backend available, but allow users to customize their backend.

category.pattern: ON NODE.JS THIS USES SETIMMEDIATE INSTEAD OF REQUESTANIMATIONFRAME
category.template: On Node.js this uses setImmediate instead of requestAnimationFrame.

category.pattern: RETURNS A PROMISE THAT RESOLVE WHEN A REQUESTANIMATIONFRAME HAS COMPLETED
category.template: Returns a promise that resolve when a requestAnimationFrame has completed.

category.pattern: EXECUTES F ( ) AND RETURNS A PROMISE THAT RESOLVES WITH TIMING INFORMATION
category.template: Executes f() and returns a promise that resolves with timing information.

category.pattern: KEEPS A TF.TENSOR GENERATED INSIDE A TF.TIDY ( ) FROM BEING DISPOSED AUTOMATICALLY
category.template: Keeps a tf.Tensor generated inside a tf.tidy() from being disposed automatically.

category.pattern: DISPOSES ANY TF.TENSORS FOUND WITHIN THE PROVIDED OBJECT
category.template: Disposes any tf.Tensors found within the provided object.

category.pattern: NOTE : VARIABLES DO NOT GET CLEANED UP WHEN INSIDE A TIDY ( ) . IF YOU WANT TO DISPOSE VARIABLES PLEASE USE TF.DISPOSEVARIABLES ( ) OR CALL DISPOSE ( ) DIRECTLY ON VARIABLES
category.template: NOTE: Variables do not get cleaned up when inside a tidy(). If you want to dispose variables, please use tf.disposeVariables() or call dispose() directly on variables.

category.pattern: USING THIS METHOD HELPS AVOID MEMORY LEAKS . IN GENERAL WRAP CALLS TO OPERATIONS IN TF.TIDY ( ) FOR AUTOMATIC MEMORY CLEANUP
category.template: Using this method helps avoid memory leaks. In general, wrap calls to operations in tf.tidy() for automatic memory cleanup.

category.pattern: EXECUTES THE PROVIDED FUNCTION FN AND AFTER IT IS EXECUTED CLEANS UP ALL INTERMEDIATE TENSORS ALLOCATED BY FN EXCEPT THOSE RETURNED BY FN . FN MUST NOT RETURN A PROMISE ( ASYNC FUNCTIONS NOT ALLOWED ) . THE RETURNED RESULT CAN BE A COMPLEX OBJECT
category.template: Executes the provided function fn and after it is executed, cleans up all intermediate tensors allocated by fn except those returned by fn. fn must not return a Promise (async functions not allowed). The returned result can be a complex object.

category.pattern: UPDATES VARIABLES BY USING THE COMPUTED GRADIENTS
category.template: Updates variables by using the computed gradients.

category.pattern: EXECUTES F ( ) AND COMPUTES THE GRADIENT OF THE SCALAR OUTPUT OF F ( ) WITH RESPECT TO THE LIST OF TRAINABLE VARIABLES PROVIDED BY VARLIST . IF NO LIST IS PROVIDED IT DEFAULTS TO ALL TRAINABLE VARIABLES
category.template: Executes f() and computes the gradient of the scalar output of f() with respect to the list of trainable variables provided by varList. If no list is provided, it defaults to all trainable variables.

category.pattern: EXECUTES F ( ) AND MINIMIZES THE SCALAR OUTPUT OF F ( ) BY COMPUTING GRADIENTS OF Y WITH RESPECT TO THE LIST OF TRAINABLE VARIABLES PROVIDED BY VARLIST . IF NO LIST IS PROVIDED IT DEFAULTS TO ALL TRAINABLE VARIABLES
category.template: Executes f() and minimizes the scalar output of f() by computing gradients of y with respect to the list of trainable variables provided by varList. If no list is provided, it defaults to all trainable variables.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE SOFTMAX CROSS ENTROPY LOSS BETWEEN TWO TENSORS
category.template: Computes the softmax cross entropy loss between two tensors.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE SIGMOID CROSS ENTROPY LOSS BETWEEN TWO TENSORS
category.template: Computes the sigmoid cross entropy loss between two tensors.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE MEAN SQUARED ERROR BETWEEN TWO TENSORS
category.template: Computes the mean squared error between two tensors.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE LOG LOSS BETWEEN TWO TENSORS
category.template: Computes the log loss between two tensors.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE HUBER LOSS BETWEEN TWO TENSORS
category.template: Computes the huber loss between two tensors.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE HINGE LOSS BETWEEN TWO TENSORS
category.template: Computes the Hinge loss between two tensors.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE COSINE DISTANCE LOSS BETWEEN TWO TENSORS
category.template: Computes the cosine distance loss between two tensors.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE WEIGHTED LOSS BETWEEN TWO TENSORS
category.template: Computes the weighted loss between two tensors.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE ABSOLUTE DIFFERENCE LOSS BETWEEN TWO TENSORS
category.template: Computes the absolute difference loss between two tensors.

category.pattern: CONSTRUCTS A TF.RMSPROPOPTIMIZER THAT USES RMSPROP GRADIENT DESCENT . THIS IMPLEMENTATION USES PLAIN MOMENTUM AND IS NOT CENTERED VERSION OF RMSPROP
category.template: Constructs a tf.RMSPropOptimizer that uses RMSProp gradient descent. This implementation uses plain momentum and is not centered version of RMSProp.

category.pattern: CONSTRUCTS A TF.MOMENTUMOPTIMIZER THAT USES MOMENTUM GRADIENT DESCENT
category.template: Constructs a tf.MomentumOptimizer that uses momentum gradient descent.

category.pattern: CONSTRUCTS A TF.SGDOPTIMIZER THAT USES STOCHASTIC GRADIENT DESCENT
category.template: Constructs a tf.SGDOptimizer that uses stochastic gradient descent.

category.pattern: COMPUTES AND RETURNS THE GRADIENT OF F ( X ) WITH RESPECT TO THE LIST OF TRAINABLE VARIABLES PROVIDED BY VARLIST . IF NO LIST IS PROVIDED IT DEFAULTS TO ALL TRAINABLE VARIABLES
category.template: Computes and returns the gradient of f(x) with respect to the list of trainable variables provided by varList. If no list is provided, it defaults to all trainable variables.

category.pattern: LIKE TF.GRADS ( ) BUT RETURNS ALSO THE VALUE OF F ( ) . USEFUL WHEN F ( ) RETURNS A METRIC YOU WANT TO SHOW
category.template: Like tf.grads(), but returns also the value of f(). Useful when f() returns a metric you want to show.

category.pattern: LIKE TF.GRAD ( ) BUT ALSO RETURNS THE VALUE OF F ( ) . USEFUL WHEN F ( ) RETURNS A METRIC YOU WANT TO SHOW
category.template: Like tf.grad(), but also returns the value of f(). Useful when f() returns a metric you want to show.

category.pattern: THE SAVE FUNCTION PASSSED TO F SHOULD BE USED FOR SAVING TENSORS NEEDED IN THE GRADIENT . AND THE SAVED PASSED TO THE GRADFUNC IS A NAMEDTENSORMAP WHICH CONTAINS THOSE SAVED TENSOR
category.template: The save function passsed to f should be used for saving tensors needed in the gradient. And the saved passed to the gradFunc is a NamedTensorMap, which contains those saved tensor.

category.pattern: TAKES A FUNCTION F ( . . . INPUTS SAVE ) = > { VALUE : TENSOR GRADFUNC : ( DY SAVED ) = > TENSOR [ ] } AND RETURNS ANOTHER FUNCTION G ( . . . INPUTS ) WHICH TAKES THE SAME INPUTS AS F . WHEN CALLED G RETURNS F ( ) . VALUE . IN BACKWARD MODE CUSTOM GRADIENTS WITH RESPECT TO EACH INPUT OF F ARE COMPUTED USING F ( ) . GRADFUNC
category.template: Takes a function f(...inputs, save) => {value: Tensor, gradFunc: (dy, saved) => Tensor[]} and returns another function g(...inputs) which takes the same inputs as f. When called, g returns f().value. In backward mode, custom gradients with respect to each input of f are computed using f().gradFunc.

category.pattern: OVERRIDES THE GRADIENT COMPUTATION OF A FUNCTION F
category.template: Overrides the gradient computation of a function f.

category.pattern: IF DY IS PASSED WHEN CALLING G ( ) THE GRADIENT OF F ( X1 . . . ) . MUL ( DY ) . SUM ( ) WITH RESPECT TO EACH INPUT IS COMPUTED INSTEAD . THE PROVIDED F MUST TAKE ONE OR MORE TENSORS AND RETURN A SINGLE TENSOR Y . IF F ( ) TAKES A SINGLE INPUT WE RECOMMEND USING TF.GRAD ( ) INSTEAD
category.template: If dy is passed when calling g(), the gradient of f(x1,...).mul(dy).sum() with respect to each input is computed instead. The provided f must take one or more tensors and return a single tensor y. If f() takes a single input, we recommend using tf.grad() instead.

category.pattern: PROVIDED F ( X1 X2 . . . ) RETURNS ANOTHER FUNCTION G ( [ X1 X2 . . . ] DY ? ) WHICH GIVES AN ARRAY OF GRADIENTS OF F ( ) WITH RESPECT TO EACH INPUT [ X1 X2 . . . ]
category.template: Provided f(x1, x2,...), returns another function g([x1, x2,...], dy?), which gives an array of gradients of f() with respect to each input [x1,x2,...].

category.pattern: IF DY IS PROVIDED THE GRADIENT OF F ( X ) . MUL ( DY ) . SUM ( ) WITH RESPECT TO X IS COMPUTED INSTEAD . F ( X ) MUST TAKE A SINGLE TENSOR X AND RETURN A SINGLE TENSOR Y . IF F ( ) TAKES MULTIPLE INPUTS USE TF.GRADS ( ) INSTEAD
category.template: If dy is provided, the gradient of f(x).mul(dy).sum() with respect to x is computed instead. f(x) must take a single tensor x and return a single tensor y. If f() takes multiple inputs, use tf.grads() instead.

category.pattern: PROVIDED F ( X ) RETURNS ANOTHER FUNCTION G ( X DY ? ) WHICH GIVES THE GRADIENT OF F ( X ) WITH RESPECT TO X
category.template: Provided f(x), returns another function g(x, dy?), which gives the gradient of f(x) with respect to x.

category.pattern: FOR THOSE FAMILIAR WITH TENSORFLOW THE API WE EXPOSE EXACTLY MIRRORS THE TENSORFLOW EAGER API
category.template: For those familiar with TensorFlow, the API we expose exactly mirrors the TensorFlow Eager API.

category.pattern: WE ALSO PROVIDE AN API TO DO PERFORM TRAINING AND COMPUTE GRADIENTS . WE COMPUTE GRADIENTS EAGERLY USERS PROVIDE A FUNCTION THAT IS A COMBINATION OF OPERATIONS AND WE AUTOMATICALLY DIFFERENTIATE THAT FUNCTION S OUTPUT WITH RESPECT TO ITS INPUTS
category.template: We also provide an API to do perform training, and compute gradients. We compute gradients eagerly, users provide a function that is a combination of operations and we automatically differentiate that function's output with respect to its inputs.

category.pattern: THE HASH FUNCTION IS DETERMINISTIC ON THE CONTENT OF THE STRING WITHIN THE PROCESS AND WILL NEVER CHANGE . HOWEVER IT IS NOT SUITABLE FOR CRYPTOGRAPHY . THIS FUNCTION MAY BE USED WHEN CPU TIME IS SCARCE AND INPUTS ARE TRUSTED OR UNIMPORTANT . THERE IS A RISK OF ADVERSARIES CONSTRUCTING INPUTS THAT ALL HASH TO THE SAME BUCKET
category.template: The hash function is deterministic on the content of the string within the process and will never change. However, it is not suitable for cryptography. This function may be used when CPU time is scarce and inputs are trusted or unimportant. There is a risk of adversaries constructing inputs that all hash to the same bucket.

category.pattern: CONVERTS EACH STRING IN THE INPUT TENSOR TO ITS HASH MOD BY A NUMBER OF BUCKETS
category.template: Converts each string in the input Tensor to its hash mod by a number of buckets.

category.pattern: DELIMITER CAN BE EMPTY OR A STRING OF SPLIT CHARACTERS . IF DELIMITER IS AN EMPTY STRING EACH ELEMENT OF INPUT IS SPLIT INTO INDIVIDUAL CHARACTER STRINGS . OTHERWISE EVERY CHARACTER OF DELIMITER IS A POTENTIAL SPLIT POINT
category.template: delimiter can be empty, or a string of split characters. If delimiter is an empty string, each element of input is split into individual character strings. Otherwise every character of delimiter is a potential split point.

category.pattern: LET N BE THE SIZE OF SOURCE ( TYPICALLY N WILL BE THE BATCH SIZE ) . SPLIT EACH ELEMENT OF INPUT BASED ON DELIMITER AND RETURN A SPARSETENSOR CONTAINING THE SPLITTED TOKENS . EMPTY TOKENS ARE IGNORED IF SKIPEMPTY IS SET TO TRUE
category.template: Let N be the size of source (typically N will be the batch size). Split each element of input based on delimiter and return a SparseTensor containing the splitted tokens. Empty tokens are ignored if skipEmpty is set to True.

category.pattern: SPLIT ELEMENTS OF INPUT BASED ON DELIMITER INTO A SPARSETENSOR .
category.template: Split elements of input based on delimiter into a SparseTensor .

category.pattern: THIS OP ACCEPTS A RAGGED TENSOR WITH 1 RAGGED DIMENSION CONTAINING ONLY STRINGS AND OUTPUTS A RAGGED TENSOR WITH 1 RAGGED DIMENSION CONTAINING NGRAMS OF THAT STRING JOINED ALONG THE INNERMOST AXIS
category.template: This op accepts a ragged tensor with 1 ragged dimension containing only strings and outputs a ragged tensor with 1 ragged dimension containing ngrams of that string, joined along the innermost axis.

category.pattern: CREATES NGRAMS FROM RAGGED STRING DATA
category.template: Creates ngrams from ragged string data.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE SUM ALONG SPARSE SEGMENTS OF A TENSOR
category.template: Computes the sum along sparse segments of a tensor.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE MEAN ALONG SPARSE SEGMENTS OF A TENSOR
category.template: Computes the mean along sparse segments of a tensor.

category.pattern: THIS OP ALSO RETURNS AN INDICATOR VECTOR SHAPED [ DENSE_SHAPE [ 0 ] ] SUCH THAT EMPTYROWINDICATOR [ I ] = TRUE IFF ROW I WAS AN EMPTY ROW
category.template: This op also returns an indicator vector shaped [dense_shape[0]] such that emptyRowIndicator[i] = True iff row i was an empty row.

category.pattern: THE OUTPUT SPARSETENSOR WILL BE IN ROW-MAJOR ORDER AND WILL HAVE THE SAME SHAPE AS THE INPUT
category.template: The output SparseTensor will be in row-major order and will have the same shape as the input.

category.pattern: THE INPUT SPARSETENSOR IS REPRESENTED VIA THE MAP OF INPUTS { INDICES VALUES DENSESHAPE } . THE OUTPUT SPARSETENSOR HAS THE SAME DENSESHAPE BUT WITH INDICES OUTPUTINDICES AND VALUES OUTPUTVALUES . THIS OP INSERTS A SINGLE ENTRY FOR EVERY ROW THAT DOESN T HAVE ANY VALUES . THE INDEX IS CREATED AS [ ROW 0 . . . 0 ] AND THE INSERTED VALUE IS DEFAULTVALUE
category.template: The input SparseTensor is represented via the map of inputs {indices, values, denseShape}. The output SparseTensor has the same denseShape but with indices outputIndices and values outputValues. This op inserts a single entry for every row that doesn't have any values. The index is created as [row, 0, ..., 0] and the inserted value is defaultValue.

category.pattern: COMPUTE QR DECOMPOSITION OF M-BY-N MATRIX USING HOUSEHOLDER TRANSFORMATION
category.template: Compute QR decomposition of m-by-n matrix using Householder transformation.

category.pattern: COPY A TENSOR SETTING EVERYTHING OUTSIDE A CENTRAL BAND IN EACH INNERMOST MATRIX TO ZERO
category.template: Copy a tensor setting everything outside a central band in each innermost matrix to zero.

category.pattern: GENERATE A HANN WINDOW
category.template: Generate a Hann window.

category.pattern: GENERATE A HAMMING WINDOW
category.template: Generate a hamming window.

category.pattern: EXPANDS INPUT INTO FRAMES OF FRAMELENGTH . SLIDES A WINDOW SIZE WITH FRAMESTEP
category.template: Expands input into frames of frameLength. Slides a window size with frameStep.

category.pattern: NOTE THAT THIS FUNCTION IS COMPLETELY STATELESS AND DOES NOT KEEP TRACK OF STEP COUNT . THE STEP COUNT NEEDS TO BE MAINTAINED BY THE CALLER AND PASSED IN AS STEP
category.template: Note that this function is completely stateless and does not keep track of step count. The step count needs to be maintained by the caller and passed in as step.

category.pattern: COMPUTE THE MOVING AVERAGE OF A VARIABLE
category.template: Compute the moving average of a variable.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE SUM ALONG SEGMENTS OF A TF.TENSOR
category.template: Computes the sum along segments of a tf.Tensor.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE 1 - DIMENSIONAL DISCRETE FOURIER TRANSFORM OVER THE INNER-MOST DIMENSION OF THE REAL INPUT
category.template: Computes the 1-dimensional discrete Fourier transform over the inner-most dimension of the real input.

category.pattern: REAL VALUE INPUT FAST FOURIER TRANSFORM
category.template: Real value input fast Fourier transform.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE 1 - DIMENSIONAL INVERSED DISCRETE FOURIER TRANSFORM OVER THE INNER-MOST DIMENSION OF THE REAL INPUT
category.template: Computes the 1-dimensional inversed discrete Fourier transform over the inner-most dimension of the real input.

category.pattern: INVERSED REAL VALUE INPUT FAST FOURIER TRANSFORM
category.template: Inversed real value input fast Fourier transform.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE INVERSE 1 - DIMENSIONAL DISCRETE FOURIER TRANSFORM OVER THE INNER-MOST DIMENSION OF INPUT
category.template: Computes the inverse 1-dimensional discrete Fourier transform over the inner-most dimension of input.

category.pattern: INVERSE FAST FOURIER TRANSFORM
category.template: Inverse fast Fourier transform.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE 1 - DIMENSIONAL DISCRETE FOURIER TRANSFORM OVER THE INNER-MOST DIMENSION OF INPUT
category.template: Computes the 1-dimensional discrete Fourier transform over the inner-most dimension of input.

category.pattern: FAST FOURIER TRANSFORM
category.template: Fast Fourier transform.

category.pattern: EXTRACTS A STRIDED SLICE OF A TENSOR
category.template: Extracts a strided slice of a tensor.

category.pattern: CREATES A NEW TENSOR BY APPLYING SPARSE UPDATES TO INDIVIDUAL VALUES OR SLICES WITHIN A ZERO TENSOR OF THE GIVEN SHAPE TENSOR ACCORDING TO INDICES . THIS OPERATOR IS THE INVERSE OF THE TF.GATHERND ( ) OPERATOR WHICH EXTRACTS VALUES OR SLICES FROM A GIVEN TENSOR
category.template: Creates a new tensor by applying sparse updates to individual values or slices within a zero tensor of the given shape tensor according to indices. This operator is the inverse of the tf.gatherND() operator which extracts values or slices from a given tensor.

category.pattern: GIVEN N ONE-DIMENSIONAL COORDINATE ARRAYS * ARGS RETURNS A LIST OUTPUTS OF N-D COORDINATE ARRAYS FOR EVALUATING EXPRESSIONS ON AN N-D GRID
category.template: Given N one-dimensional coordinate arrays *args, returns a list outputs of N-D coordinate arrays for evaluating expressions on an N-D grid.

category.pattern: BROADCASTS PARAMETERS FOR EVALUATION ON AN N-D GRID
category.template: Broadcasts parameters for evaluation on an N-D grid.

category.pattern: NOTE THAT ON CPU IF AN OUT OF BOUND INDEX IS FOUND AN ERROR IS RETURNED . ON GPU IF AN OUT OF BOUND INDEX IS FOUND A 0 IS STORED IN THE CORRESPONDING OUTPUT VALUE
category.template: Note that on CPU, if an out of bound index is found, an error is returned. On GPU, if an out of bound index is found, a 0 is stored in the corresponding output value.

category.pattern: WHEREAS IN TF.GATHER ( ) INDICES DEFINES SLICES INTO THE FIRST DIMENSION OF INPUT IN TF.GATHERND ( ) INDICES DEFINES SLICES INTO THE FIRST N DIMENSIONS OF INPUT WHERE N = INDICES.SHAPE [ -1 ]
category.template: Whereas in tf.gather(), indices defines slices into the first dimension of input, in tf.gatherND(), indices defines slices into the first N dimensions of input, where N = indices.shape[-1].

category.pattern: GATHER SLICES FROM INPUT TENSOR INTO A TENSOR WITH SHAPE SPECIFIED BY INDICES
category.template: Gather slices from input tensor into a Tensor with shape specified by indices.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE CUMULATIVE SUM OF A TF.TENSOR ALONG AXIS
category.template: Computes the cumulative sum of a tf.Tensor along axis.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE CUMULATIVE PRODUCT OF A TF.TENSOR ALONG AXIS
category.template: Computes the cumulative product of a tf.Tensor along axis.

category.pattern: NOTE : THIS OPERATION ASSUMES THAT UPPERBOUND IS SORTED ALONG THE INNERMOST AXIS MAYBE USING SORT ( . . . AXIS = -1 ) . IF THE SEQUENCE IS NOT SORTED NO ERROR IS RAISED AND THE CONTENT OF THE RETURNED TENSOR IS NOT WELL DEFINED
category.template: Note: This operation assumes that 'upperBound' is sorted along the innermost axis, maybe using 'sort(..., axis=-1)'. If the sequence is not sorted no error is raised and the content of the returned tensor is not well defined.

category.pattern: THE INDEX RETURNED CORRESPONDS TO THE FIRST EDGE GREATER THAN THE VALUE
category.template: The index returned corresponds to the first edge greater than the value.

category.pattern: IT RETURNS A TENSOR VALUES CONTAINING ALL OF THE UNIQUE ELEMENTS ALONG THE AXIS OF THE GIVEN TENSOR X IN THE SAME ORDER THAT THEY OCCUR ALONG THE AXIS IN X ; X DOES NOT NEED TO BE SORTED . IT ALSO RETURNS A TENSOR INDICES THE SAME SIZE AS THE NUMBER OF THE ELEMENTS IN X ALONG THE AXIS DIMENSION . IT CONTAINS THE INDEX IN THE UNIQUE OUTPUT VALUES
category.template: It returns a tensor values containing all of the unique elements along the axis of the given tensor x in the same order that they occur along the axis in x; x does not need to be sorted. It also returns a tensor indices the same size as the number of the elements in x along the axis dimension. It contains the index in the unique output values.

category.pattern: FINDS UNIQUE ELEMENTS ALONG AN AXIS OF A TENSOR
category.template: Finds unique elements along an axis of a tensor.

category.pattern: IF TWO ELEMENTS ARE EQUAL THE LOWER-INDEX ELEMENT APPEARS FIRST
category.template: If two elements are equal, the lower-index element appears first.

category.pattern: IF THE INPUT IS A VECTOR ( RANK = 1 ) FINDS THE K LARGEST ENTRIES IN THE VECTOR AND OUTPUTS THEIR VALUES AND INDICES AS VECTORS . THUS VALUES [ J ] IS THE J-TH LARGEST ENTRY IN INPUT AND ITS INDEX IS INDICES [ J ] . FOR HIGHER RANK INPUTS COMPUTES THE TOP K ENTRIES ALONG THE LAST DIMENSION
category.template: If the input is a vector (rank=1), finds the k largest entries in the vector and outputs their values and indices as vectors. Thus values[j] is the j-th largest entry in input, and its index is indices[j]. For higher rank inputs, computes the top k entries along the last dimension.

category.pattern: FINDS THE VALUES AND INDICES OF THE K LARGEST ENTRIES ALONG THE LAST DIMENSION
category.template: Finds the values and indices of the k largest entries along the last dimension.

category.pattern: NOTE : THIS OPERATION ASSUMES THAT SORTEDSEQUENCE IS SORTED ALONG THE INNERMOST AXIS MAYBE USING SORT ( . . . AXIS = -1 ) . IF THE SEQUENCE IS NOT SORTED NO ERROR IS RAISED AND THE CONTENT OF THE RETURNED TENSOR IS NOT WELL DEFINED
category.template: Note: This operation assumes that 'sortedSequence' is sorted along the innermost axis, maybe using 'sort(..., axis=-1)'. If the sequence is not sorted no error is raised and the content of the returned tensor is not well defined.

category.pattern: THE SIDE ARGUMENT CONTROLS WHICH INDEX IS RETURNED IF A VALUE LANDS EXACTLY ON AN EDGE
category.template: The side argument controls which index is returned if a value lands exactly on an edge.

category.pattern: NOTE : THIS OPERATION ASSUMES THAT LOWERBOUND IS SORTED ALONG THE INNERMOST AXIS MAYBE USING SORT ( . . . AXIS = -1 ) . IF THE SEQUENCE IS NOT SORTED NO ERROR IS RAISED AND THE CONTENT OF THE RETURNED TENSOR IS NOT WELL DEFINED
category.template: Note: This operation assumes that 'lowerBound' is sorted along the innermost axis, maybe using 'sort(..., axis=-1)'. If the sequence is not sorted no error is raised and the content of the returned tensor is not well defined.

category.pattern: THE AXIS IS NOT SETTABLE FOR THIS OPERATION . IT ALWAYS OPERATES ON THE INNERMOST DIMENSION ( AXIS = -1 ) . THE OPERATION WILL ACCEPT ANY NUMBER OF OUTER DIMENSIONS
category.template: The axis is not settable for this operation. It always operates on the innermost dimension (axis=-1). The operation will accept any number of outer dimensions.

category.pattern: THE INDEX RETURNED CORRESPONDS TO THE FIRST EDGE GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO THE VALUE
category.template: The index returned corresponds to the first edge greater than or equal to the value.

category.pattern: THE TYPICAL USE CASE FOR THIS OPERATION IS BINNING BUCKETING OR DISCRETIZING . THE VALUES ARE ASSIGNED TO BUCKET-INDICES BASED ON THE EDGES LISTED IN SORTEDSEQUENCE . THIS OPERATION RETURNS THE BUCKET-INDEX FOR EACH VALUE
