category.template: The typical use case for this operation is "binning", "bucketing", or "discretizing". The values are assigned to bucket-indices based on the edges listed in 'sortedSequence'. This operation returns the bucket-index for each value.

category.pattern: THIS IS NOT A METHOD FOR CHECKING CONTAINMENT ( LIKE JAVASCRIPT IN )
category.template: This is not a method for checking containment (like javascript in).

category.pattern: SEARCHES FOR WHERE A VALUE WOULD GO IN A SORTED SEQUENCE
category.template: Searches for where a value would go in a sorted sequence.

category.pattern: RETURNS WHETHER THE TARGETS ARE IN THE TOP K PREDICTIONS
category.template: Returns whether the targets are in the top K predictions.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE CONFUSION MATRIX FROM TRUE LABELS AND PREDICTED LABELS
category.template: Computes the confusion matrix from true labels and predicted labels.

category.pattern: THIS IS ANALOGOUS TO CALLING THE PYTHON TF.WHERE ( COND ) WITHOUT AN X OR Y
category.template: This is analogous to calling the python tf.where(cond) without an x or y.

category.pattern: THE COORDINATES ARE RETURNED IN A 2 - D TENSOR WHERE THE FIRST DIMENSION ( ROWS ) REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF TRUE ELEMENTS AND THE SECOND DIMENSION ( COLUMNS ) REPRESENTS THE COORDINATES OF THE TRUE ELEMENTS . KEEP IN MIND THE SHAPE OF THE OUTPUT TENSOR CAN VARY DEPENDING ON HOW MANY TRUE VALUES THERE ARE IN INPUT . INDICES ARE OUTPUT IN ROW-MAJOR ORDER . THE RESULTING TENSOR HAS THE SHAPE [ NUMTRUEELEMS CONDITION.RANK ]
category.template: The coordinates are returned in a 2-D tensor where the first dimension (rows) represents the number of true elements, and the second dimension (columns) represents the coordinates of the true elements. Keep in mind, the shape of the output tensor can vary depending on how many true values there are in input. Indices are output in row-major order. The resulting tensor has the shape [numTrueElems, condition.rank].

category.pattern: RETURNS THE COORDINATES OF TRUE ELEMENTS OF CONDITION
category.template: Returns the coordinates of true elements of condition.

category.pattern: IF THE CONDITION IS TRUE SELECT FROM A OTHERWISE SELECT FROM B
category.template: If the condition is true, select from a, otherwise select from b.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE ELEMENTS EITHER A OR B DEPENDING ON THE CONDITION
category.template: Returns the elements, either a or b depending on the condition.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE TRUTH VALUE OF ( A ! = B ) ELEMENT-WISE . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Returns the truth value of (a != b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE TRUTH VALUE OF A XOR B ELEMENT-WISE . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Returns the truth value of a XOR b element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE TRUTH VALUE OF A OR B ELEMENT-WISE . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Returns the truth value of a OR b element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE TRUTH VALUE OF NOT X ELEMENT-WISE
category.template: Returns the truth value of NOT x element-wise.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE TRUTH VALUE OF A AND B ELEMENT-WISE . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Returns the truth value of a AND b element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE TRUTH VALUE OF ( A < = B ) ELEMENT-WISE . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Returns the truth value of (a <= b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE TRUTH VALUE OF ( A < B ) ELEMENT-WISE . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Returns the truth value of (a < b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE TRUTH VALUE OF ( A > = B ) ELEMENT-WISE . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Returns the truth value of (a >= b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE TRUTH VALUE OF ( A > B ) ELEMENT-WISE . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Returns the truth value of (a > b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE TRUTH VALUE OF ( A = = B ) ELEMENT-WISE . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Returns the truth value of (a == b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: DERIVED FROM TF.CONTRIB.RN.MULTIRNNCELL
category.template: Derived from tf.contrib.rn.MultiRNNCell.

category.pattern: RETURNS [ CELLSTATE CELLOUTPUT ]
category.template: Returns [cellState, cellOutput].

category.pattern: EACH CELL OUTPUT IS USED AS INPUT TO THE NEXT CELL
category.template: Each cell output is used as input to the next cell.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE NEXT STATES AND OUTPUTS OF A STACK OF LSTMCELLS
category.template: Computes the next states and outputs of a stack of LSTMCells.

category.pattern: DERIVED FROM TF.CONTRIB.RNN.BASICLSTMCELL
category.template: Derived from tf.contrib.rnn.BasicLSTMCell.

category.pattern: RETURNS [ NEWC NEWH ]
category.template: Returns [newC, newH].

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE NEXT STATE AND OUTPUT OF A BASICLSTMCELL
category.template: Computes the next state and output of a BasicLSTMCell.

category.pattern: APPLIES THE GIVEN TRANSFORM ( S ) TO THE IMAGE ( S )
category.template: Applies the given transform(s) to the image(s).

category.pattern: ROTATES THE INPUT IMAGE TENSOR COUNTER-CLOCKWISE WITH AN OPTIONAL OFFSET CENTER OF ROTATION . CURRENTLY AVAILABLE IN THE CPU WEBGL AND WASM BACKENDS
category.template: Rotates the input image tensor counter-clockwise with an optional offset center of rotation. Currently available in the CPU, WebGL, and WASM backends.

category.pattern: NEARESTNEIGHBOR RESIZE A BATCH OF 3D IMAGES TO A NEW SHAPE
category.template: NearestNeighbor resize a batch of 3D images to a new shape.

category.pattern: BILINEAR RESIZE A SINGLE 3D IMAGE OR A BATCH OF 3D IMAGES TO A NEW SHAPE
category.template: Bilinear resize a single 3D image or a batch of 3D images to a new shape.

category.pattern: ASYNCHRONOUSLY PERFORMS NON MAXIMUM SUPPRESSION OF BOUNDING BOXES BASED ON IOU ( INTERSECTION OVER UNION )
category.template: Asynchronously performs non maximum suppression of bounding boxes based on iou (intersection over union).

category.pattern: THIS OP ALSO SUPPORTS A SOFT-NMS MODE ( C.F . BODLA ET AL HTTPS://ARXIV.ORG/ABS/1704.04503) WHERE BOXES REDUCE THE SCORE OF OTHER OVERLAPPING BOXES THEREFORE FAVORING DIFFERENT REGIONS OF THE IMAGE WITH HIGH SCORES . TO ENABLE THIS SOFT-NMS MODE SET THE SOFTNMSSIGMA PARAMETER TO BE LARGER THAN 0
category.template: This op also supports a Soft-NMS mode (c.f. Bodla et al, https://arxiv.org/abs/1704.04503) where boxes reduce the score of other overlapping boxes, therefore favoring different regions of the image with high scores. To enable this Soft-NMS mode, set the softNmsSigma parameter to be larger than 0.

category.pattern: ASYNCHRONOUSLY PERFORMS NON MAXIMUM SUPPRESSION OF BOUNDING BOXES BASED ON IOU ( INTERSECTION OVER UNION ) WITH AN OPTION TO PAD RESULTS
category.template: Asynchronously performs non maximum suppression of bounding boxes based on iou (intersection over union), with an option to pad results.

category.pattern: PERFORMS NON MAXIMUM SUPPRESSION OF BOUNDING BOXES BASED ON IOU ( INTERSECTION OVER UNION )
category.template: Performs non maximum suppression of bounding boxes based on iou (intersection over union).

category.pattern: CONVERTS IMAGES FROM GRAYSCALE TO RGB FORMAT
category.template: Converts images from grayscale to RGB format.

category.pattern: FLIPS THE IMAGE LEFT TO RIGHT . CURRENTLY AVAILABLE IN THE CPU WEBGL AND WASM BACKENDS
category.template: Flips the image left to right. Currently available in the CPU, WebGL, and WASM backends.

category.pattern: EXTRACTS CROPS FROM THE INPUT IMAGE TENSOR AND RESIZES THEM USING BILINEAR SAMPLING OR NEAREST NEIGHBOR SAMPLING ( POSSIBLY WITH ASPECT RATIO CHANGE ) TO A COMMON OUTPUT SIZE SPECIFIED BY CROPSIZE
category.template: Extracts crops from the input image tensor and resizes them using bilinear sampling or nearest neighbor sampling (possibly with aspect ratio change) to a common output size specified by cropSize.

category.pattern: IF INDICES ARE REPEATED THE FINAL VALUE IS SUMMED OVER ALL VALUES FOR THOSE INDICES
category.template: If indices are repeated the final value is summed over all values for those indices.

category.pattern: / / IF SPARSEINDICES IS AN N BY D MATRIX THEN FOR EACH I IN [ 0 N ) DENSE [ SPARSEINDICES [ I ] [ 0 ] . . . SPARSEINDICES [ I ] [ D-1 ] ] = SPARSEVALUES [ I ] ALL OTHER VALUES IN DENSE ARE SET TO DEFAULTVALUE . IF SPARSEVALUES IS A SCALAR ALL SPARSE INDICES ARE SET TO THIS SINGLE VALUE
category.template: // If sparseIndices is an n by d matrix, then for each i in [0, n) dense[sparseIndices[i][0], ..., sparseIndices[i][d-1]] = sparseValues[i] All other values in dense are set to defaultValue. If sparseValues is a scalar, all sparse indices are set to this single value.

category.pattern: CONVERTS A SPARSE REPRESENTATION INTO A DENSE TENSOR
category.template: Converts a sparse representation into a dense tensor.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE SOFTMAX NORMALIZED VECTOR GIVEN THE LOGITS
category.template: Computes the softmax normalized vector given the logits.

category.pattern: CALCULATES THE MEAN AND VARIANCE OF X . THE MEAN AND VARIANCE ARE CALCULATED BY AGGREGATING THE CONTENTS OF X ACROSS AXES . IF X IS 1 - D AND AXES = [ 0 ] THIS IS JUST THE MEAN AND VARIANCE OF A VECTOR
category.template: Calculates the mean and variance of x. The mean and variance are calculated by aggregating the contents of x across axes. If x is 1-D and axes = [0] this is just the mean and variance of a vector.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE LOG SOFTMAX
category.template: Computes the log softmax.

category.pattern: NORMALIZES THE ACTIVATION OF A LOCAL NEIGHBORHOOD ACROSS OR WITHIN CHANNELS
category.template: Normalizes the activation of a local neighborhood across or within channels.

category.pattern: AS DESCRIBED IN HTTP://ARXIV.ORG/ABS/1502.03167.
category.template: As described in http://arxiv.org/abs/1502.03167.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE SUM OF ELEMENTS ACROSS DIMENSIONS OF A TF.TENSOR
category.template: Computes the sum of elements across dimensions of a tf.Tensor.

category.pattern: REDUCES THE INPUT ALONG THE DIMENSIONS GIVEN IN AXES . UNLESS KEEPDIMS IS TRUE THE RANK OF THE TF.TENSOR IS REDUCED BY 1 FOR EACH ENTRY IN AXES . IF KEEPDIMS IS TRUE THE REDUCED DIMENSIONS ARE RETAINED WITH LENGTH 1 . IF AXES HAS NO ENTRIES ALL DIMENSIONS ARE REDUCED AND A TF.TENSOR WITH A SINGLE ELEMENT IS RETURNED
category.template: Reduces the input along the dimensions given in axes. Unless keepDims is true, the rank of the tf.Tensor is reduced by 1 for each entry in axes. If keepDims is true, the reduced dimensions are retained with length 1. If axes has no entries, all dimensions are reduced, and a tf.Tensor with a single element is returned.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE PRODUCT OF ELEMENTS ACROSS DIMENSIONS OF A TF.TENSOR
category.template: Computes the product of elements across dimensions of a tf.Tensor.

category.pattern: REDUCES THE INPUT ALONG THE DIMENSIONS GIVEN IN AXES . UNLESS KEEPDIMS IS TRUE THE RANK OF THE ARRAY IS REDUCED BY 1 FOR EACH ENTRY IN AXES . IF KEEPDIMS IS TRUE THE REDUCED DIMENSIONS ARE RETAINED WITH LENGTH 1 . IF AXES HAS NO ENTRIES ALL DIMENSIONS ARE REDUCED AND AN ARRAY WITH A SINGLE ELEMENT IS RETURNED
category.template: Reduces the input along the dimensions given in axes. Unless keepDims is true, the rank of the array is reduced by 1 for each entry in axes. If keepDims is true, the reduced dimensions are retained with length 1. If axes has no entries, all dimensions are reduced, and an array with a single element is returned.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE MINIMUM VALUE FROM THE INPUT
category.template: Computes the minimum value from the input.

category.pattern: REDUCES X ALONG THE DIMENSIONS GIVEN IN AXIS . UNLESS KEEPDIMS IS TRUE THE RANK OF THE TF.TENSOR IS REDUCED BY 1 FOR EACH ENTRY IN AXIS . IF KEEPDIMS IS TRUE THE REDUCED DIMENSIONS ARE RETAINED WITH LENGTH 1 . IF AXIS HAS NO ENTRIES ALL DIMENSIONS ARE REDUCED AND A TF.TENSOR WITH A SINGLE ELEMENT IS RETURNED
category.template: Reduces x along the dimensions given in axis. Unless keepDims is true, the rank of the tf.Tensor is reduced by 1 for each entry in axis. If keepDims is true, the reduced dimensions are retained with length 1. If axis has no entries, all dimensions are reduced, and a tf.Tensor with a single element is returned.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE MEAN OF ELEMENTS ACROSS DIMENSIONS OF A TF.TENSOR
category.template: Computes the mean of elements across dimensions of a tf.Tensor.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE MAXIMUM OF ELEMENTS ACROSS DIMENSIONS OF A TF.TENSOR
category.template: Computes the maximum of elements across dimensions of a tf.Tensor.

category.pattern: REDUCES THE INPUT ALONG THE DIMENSIONS GIVEN IN AXIS . UNLESS KEEPDIMS IS TRUE THE RANK OF THE ARRAY IS REDUCED BY 1 FOR EACH ENTRY IN AXIS . IF KEEPDIMS IS TRUE THE REDUCED DIMENSIONS ARE RETAINED WITH LENGTH 1 . IF AXIS HAS NO ENTRIES ALL DIMENSIONS ARE REDUCED AND AN ARRAY WITH A SINGLE ELEMENT IS RETURNED
category.template: Reduces the input along the dimensions given in axis. Unless keepDims is true, the rank of the array is reduced by 1 for each entry in axis. If keepDims is true, the reduced dimensions are retained with length 1. If axis has no entries, all dimensions are reduced, and an array with a single element is returned.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE LOG ( SUM ( EXP ( ELEMENTS ACROSS THE REDUCTION DIMENSIONS ) )
category.template: Computes the log(sum(exp(elements across the reduction dimensions)).

category.pattern: VALUES IN X OUTSIDE OF THE RANGE [ 0 SIZE ) ARE IGNORED
category.template: Values in x outside of the range [0, size) are ignored.

category.pattern: IF WEIGHTS ARE EMPTY THEN INDEX I STORES THE NUMBER OF TIMES THE VALUE I IS COUNTED IN X . IF WEIGHTS ARE NON-EMPTY THEN INDEX I STORES THE SUM OF THE VALUE IN WEIGHTS AT EACH INDEX WHERE THE CORRESPONDING VALUE IN X IS I
category.template: If weights are empty, then index i stores the number of times the value i is counted in x. If weights are non-empty, then index i stores the sum of the value in weights at each index where the corresponding value in x is i.

category.pattern: OUTPUTS A VECTOR WITH LENGTH SIZE AND THE SAME DTYPE AS WEIGHTS
category.template: Outputs a vector with length size and the same dtype as weights.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE INDICES OF THE MINIMUM VALUES ALONG AN AXIS
category.template: Returns the indices of the minimum values along an axis.

category.pattern: THE RESULT HAS THE SAME SHAPE AS INPUT WITH THE DIMENSION ALONG AXIS REMOVED
category.template: The result has the same shape as input with the dimension along axis removed.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE INDICES OF THE MAXIMUM VALUES ALONG AN AXIS
category.template: Returns the indices of the maximum values along an axis.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE LOGICAL OR OF ELEMENTS ACROSS DIMENSIONS OF A TF.TENSOR
category.template: Computes the logical or of elements across dimensions of a tf.Tensor.

category.pattern: REDUCES THE INPUT ALONG THE DIMENSIONS GIVEN IN AXES . UNLESS KEEPDIMS IS TRUE THE RANK OF THE TF.TENSOR IS REDUCED BY 1 FOR EACH ENTRY IN AXES . IF KEEPDIMS IS TRUE THE REDUCED DIMENSIONS ARE RETAINED WITH LENGTH 1 . IF AXES HAS NO ENTRIES ALL DIMENSIONS ARE REDUCED AND AN TF.TENSOR WITH A SINGLE ELEMENT IS RETURNED
category.template: Reduces the input along the dimensions given in axes. Unless keepDims is true, the rank of the tf.Tensor is reduced by 1 for each entry in axes. If keepDims is true, the reduced dimensions are retained with length 1. If axes has no entries, all dimensions are reduced, and an tf.Tensor with a single element is returned.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE LOGICAL AND OF ELEMENTS ACROSS DIMENSIONS OF A TF.TENSOR
category.template: Computes the logical and of elements across dimensions of a tf.Tensor.

category.pattern: SEE HTTPS://WWW.TENSORFLOW.ORG/API_DOCS/PYTHON/TF/NN/SEPARABLE_CONV2D FOR MORE DETAILS
category.template: See https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/nn/separable_conv2d for more details.

category.pattern: PERFORMS A DEPTHWISE CONVOLUTION THAT ACTS SEPARATELY ON CHANNELS FOLLOWED BY A POINTWISE CONVOLUTION THAT MIXES CHANNELS . NOTE THAT THIS IS SEPARABILITY BETWEEN DIMENSIONS [ 1 2 ] AND 3 NOT SPATIAL SEPARABILITY BETWEEN DIMENSIONS 1 AND 2
category.template: Performs a depthwise convolution that acts separately on channels followed by a pointwise convolution that mixes channels. Note that this is separability between dimensions [1, 2] and 3, not spatial separability between dimensions 1 and 2.

category.pattern: 2 - D CONVOLUTION WITH SEPARABLE FILTERS
category.template: 2-D convolution with separable filters.

category.pattern: THE INDICES RETURNED ARE ALWAYS IN [ 0 HEIGHT ) X [ 0 WIDTH ) BEFORE FLATTENING
category.template: The indices returned are always in [0, height) x [0, width) before flattening.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE 2D MAX POOLING OF AN IMAGE WITH ARGMAX INDEX . THE INDICES IN ARGMAX ARE FLATTENED SO THAT A MAXIMUM VALUE AT POSITION [ B Y X C ] BECOMES FLATTENED INDEX : ( Y * WIDTH + X ) * CHANNELS + C IF INCLUDE_BATCH_IN_INDEX IS FALSE ; ( ( B * HEIGHT + Y ) * WIDTH + X ) * CHANNELS + C IF INCLUDE_BATCH_IN_INDEX IS TRUE
category.template: Computes the 2D max pooling of an image with Argmax index. The indices in argmax are flattened, so that a maximum value at position [b, y, x, c] becomes flattened index: (y * width + x) * channels + c if include_batch_in_index is False; ((b * height + y) * width + x) * channels +c if include_batch_in_index is True.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE 3D MAX POOLING
category.template: Computes the 3D max pooling.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE GRAYSCALE DILATION OVER THE INPUT X
category.template: Computes the grayscale dilation over the input x.

category.pattern: SEE HTTPS://WWW.TENSORFLOW.ORG/API_DOCS/PYTHON/TF/NN/DEPTHWISE_CONV2D FOR MORE DETAILS
category.template: See https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/nn/depthwise_conv2d for more details.

category.pattern: GIVEN A 4D INPUT ARRAY AND A FILTER ARRAY OF SHAPE [ FILTERHEIGHT FILTERWIDTH INCHANNELS CHANNELMULTIPLIER ] CONTAINING INCHANNELS CONVOLUTIONAL FILTERS OF DEPTH 1 THIS OP APPLIES A DIFFERENT FILTER TO EACH INPUT CHANNEL ( EXPANDING FROM 1 CHANNEL TO CHANNELMULTIPLIER CHANNELS FOR EACH ) THEN CONCATENATES THE RESULTS TOGETHER . THE OUTPUT HAS INCHANNELS * CHANNELMULTIPLIER CHANNELS
category.template: Given a 4D input array and a filter array of shape [filterHeight, filterWidth, inChannels, channelMultiplier] containing inChannels convolutional filters of depth 1, this op applies a different filter to each input channel (expanding from 1 channel to channelMultiplier channels for each), then concatenates the results together. The output has inChannels * channelMultiplier channels.

category.pattern: DEPTHWISE 2D CONVOLUTION
category.template: Depthwise 2D convolution.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE TRANSPOSED 3D CONVOLUTION OF A VOLUME ALSO KNOWN AS A DECONVOLUTION
category.template: Computes the transposed 3D convolution of a volume, also known as a deconvolution.

category.pattern: COMPUTES A 3D CONVOLUTION OVER THE INPUT X
category.template: Computes a 3D convolution over the input x.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE TRANSPOSED 2D CONVOLUTION OF AN IMAGE ALSO KNOWN AS A DECONVOLUTION
category.template: Computes the transposed 2D convolution of an image, also known as a deconvolution.

category.pattern: COMPUTES A 2D CONVOLUTION OVER THE INPUT X
category.template: Computes a 2D convolution over the input x.

category.pattern: COMPUTES A 1D CONVOLUTION OVER THE INPUT X
category.template: Computes a 1D convolution over the input x.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE 3D AVERAGE POOLING
category.template: Computes the 3D average pooling.

category.pattern: THE RETURNED TF.TENSOR S DIMENSION I WILL CORRESPOND TO THE INPUT DIMENSION PERM [ I ] . IF PERM IS NOT GIVEN IT IS SET TO [ N-1 . . . 0 ] WHERE N IS THE RANK OF THE INPUT TF.TENSOR . HENCE BY DEFAULT THIS OPERATION PERFORMS A REGULAR MATRIX TRANSPOSE ON 2 - D INPUT TF.TENSORS
category.template: The returned tf.Tensor's dimension i will correspond to the input dimension perm[i]. If perm is not given, it is set to [n-1...0], where n is the rank of the input tf.Tensor. Hence by default, this operation performs a regular matrix transpose on 2-D input tf.Tensors.

category.pattern: TRANSPOSES THE TF.TENSOR . PERMUTES THE DIMENSIONS ACCORDING TO PERM
category.template: Transposes the tf.Tensor. Permutes the dimensions according to perm.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE OUTER PRODUCT OF TWO VECTORS V1 AND V2
category.template: Computes the outer product of two vectors, v1 and v2.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE NORM OF SCALAR VECTORS AND MATRICES . THIS FUNCTION CAN COMPUTE SEVERAL DIFFERENT VECTOR NORMS ( THE 1 - NORM THE EUCLIDEAN OR 2 - NORM THE INF-NORM AND IN GENERAL THE P-NORM FOR P > 0 ) AND MATRIX NORMS ( FROBENIUS 1 - NORM AND INF-NORM )
category.template: Computes the norm of scalar, vectors, and matrices. This function can compute several different vector norms (the 1-norm, the Euclidean or 2-norm, the inf-norm, and in general the p-norm for p > 0) and matrix norms (Frobenius, 1-norm, and inf-norm).

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE DOT PRODUCT OF TWO MATRICES A * B . THESE MUST BE MATRICES
category.template: Computes the dot product of two matrices, A * B. These must be matrices.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE EUCLIDEAN NORM OF SCALAR VECTORS AND MATRICES
category.template: Computes the euclidean norm of scalar, vectors, and matrices.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE DOT PRODUCT OF TWO MATRICES AND / OR VECTORS T1 AND T2
category.template: Computes the dot product of two matrices and/or vectors, t1 and t2.

category.pattern: RETURNS AN ELEMENT-WISE INDICATION OF THE SIGN OF A NUMBER
category.template: Returns an element-wise indication of the sign of a number.

category.pattern: COMPUTES SCALED EXPONENTIAL LINEAR ELEMENT-WISE
category.template: Computes scaled exponential linear element-wise.

category.pattern: COMPUTES ROUND OF INPUT TF.TENSOR ELEMENT-WISE : ROUND ( X ) . IT IMPLEMENTS BANKER S ROUNDING
category.template: Computes round of input tf.Tensor element-wise: round(x). It implements banker's rounding.

category.pattern: COMPUTES RECTIFIED LINEAR 6 ELEMENT-WISE : MIN ( MAX ( X 0 ) 6 )
category.template: Computes rectified linear 6 element-wise: min(max(x, 0), 6).

category.pattern: COMPUTES RECTIFIED LINEAR ELEMENT-WISE : MAX ( X 0 )
category.template: Computes rectified linear element-wise: max(x, 0).

category.pattern: COMPUTES LEAKY RECTIFIED LINEAR ELEMENT-WISE WITH PARAMETRIC ALPHAS
category.template: Computes leaky rectified linear element-wise with parametric alphas.

category.pattern: COMPUTES -1 * X ELEMENT-WISE
category.template: Computes -1 * x element-wise.

category.pattern: COMPUTES LOG SIGMOID OF THE INPUT TF.TENSOR ELEMENT-WISE : LOGSIGMOID ( X ) . FOR NUMERICAL STABILITY WE USE - TF.SOFTPLUS ( - X )
category.template: Computes log sigmoid of the input tf.Tensor element-wise: logSigmoid(x). For numerical stability, we use -tf.softplus(-x).

category.pattern: COMPUTES LEAKY RECTIFIED LINEAR ELEMENT-WISE
category.template: Computes leaky rectified linear element-wise.

category.pattern: RRETURNS WHICH ELEMENTS OF X ARE NAN
category.template: RReturns which elements of x are NaN.

category.pattern: RETURNS WHICH ELEMENTS OF X ARE INFINITY OR - INFINITY
category.template: Returns which elements of x are Infinity or -Infinity.

category.pattern: RETURNS WHICH ELEMENTS OF X ARE FINITE
category.template: Returns which elements of x are finite.

category.pattern: COMPUTES FLOOR OF INPUT TF.TENSOR ELEMENT-WISE : FLOOR ( X )
category.template: Computes floor of input tf.Tensor element-wise: floor(x).

category.pattern: COMPUTES EXPONENTIAL LINEAR ELEMENT-WISE : X > 0 ? X : ( E ^ X ) - 1
category.template: Computes exponential linear element-wise: x > 0 ? x : (e ^ x) - 1.

category.pattern: COMPUTES ARCTANGENT OF TF.TENSORS A / B ELEMENT-WISE : ATAN2 ( A B ) . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Computes arctangent of tf.Tensors a / b element-wise: atan2(a, b). Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: RETURNS ( A - B ) * ( A - B ) ELEMENT-WISE . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Returns (a - b) * (a - b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: WE ALSO EXPOSE POWSTRICT WHICH HAS THE SAME SIGNATURE AS THIS OP AND ASSERTS THAT BASE AND EXP ARE THE SAME SHAPE ( DOES NOT BROADCAST )
category.template: We also expose powStrict which has the same signature as this op and asserts that base and exp are the same shape (does not broadcast).

category.pattern: GIVEN A TF.TENSOR X AND A TF.TENSOR Y THIS OPERATION COMPUTES X ^ Y FOR CORRESPONDING ELEMENTS IN X AND Y . THE RESULT S DTYPE WILL BE THE UPCASTED TYPE OF THE BASE AND EXP DTYPES
category.template: Given a tf.Tensor x and a tf.Tensor y, this operation computes x^y for corresponding elements in x and y. The result's dtype will be the upcasted type of the base and exp dtypes.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE POWER OF ONE TF.TENSOR TO ANOTHER . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Computes the power of one tf.Tensor to another. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: WE ALSO EXPOSE TF.MODSTRICT WHICH HAS THE SAME SIGNATURE AS THIS OP AND ASSERTS THAT A AND B ARE THE SAME SHAPE ( DOES NOT BROADCAST )
category.template: We also expose tf.modStrict which has the same signature as this op and asserts that a and b are the same shape (does not broadcast).

category.pattern: RETURNS THE MOD OF A AND B ELEMENT-WISE . FLOOR ( X / Y ) * Y + MOD ( X Y ) = X SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Returns the mod of a and b element-wise. floor(x / y) * y + mod(x, y) = x Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: WE ALSO EXPOSE MINIMUMSTRICT WHICH HAS THE SAME SIGNATURE AS THIS OP AND ASSERTS THAT A AND B ARE THE SAME SHAPE ( DOES NOT BROADCAST )
category.template: We also expose minimumStrict which has the same signature as this op and asserts that a and b are the same shape (does not broadcast).

category.pattern: RETURNS THE MIN OF A AND B ( A < B ? A : B ) ELEMENT-WISE . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Returns the min of a and b (a < b ? a : b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: WE ALSO EXPOSE TF.MAXIMUMSTRICT WHICH HAS THE SAME SIGNATURE AS THIS OP AND ASSERTS THAT A AND B ARE THE SAME SHAPE ( DOES NOT BROADCAST )
category.template: We also expose tf.maximumStrict which has the same signature as this op and asserts that a and b are the same shape (does not broadcast).

category.pattern: RETURNS THE MAX OF A AND B ( A > B ? A : B ) ELEMENT-WISE . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Returns the max of a and b (a > b ? a : b) element-wise. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: DIVIDES TWO TF.TENSORS ELEMENT-WISE A / B . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING . THE RESULT IS ROUNDED WITH FLOOR FUNCTION
category.template: Divides two tf.Tensors element-wise, A / B. Supports broadcasting. The result is rounded with floor function.

category.pattern: DIVIDES TWO TF.TENSORS ELEMENT-WISE A / B . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING . RETURN 0 IF DENOMINATOR IS 0
category.template: Divides two tf.Tensors element-wise, A / B. Supports broadcasting. Return 0 if denominator is 0.

category.pattern: ADDS A LIST OF TF.TENSORS ELEMENT-WISE EACH WITH THE SAME SHAPE AND DTYPE
category.template: Adds a list of tf.Tensors element-wise, each with the same shape and dtype.

category.pattern: DIVIDES TWO TF.TENSORS ELEMENT-WISE A / B . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Divides two tf.Tensors element-wise, A / B. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: WE ALSO EXPOSE TF.MULSTRICT WHICH HAS THE SAME SIGNATURE AS THIS OP AND ASSERTS THAT A AND B ARE THE SAME SHAPE ( DOES NOT BROADCAST )
category.template: We also expose tf.mulStrict which has the same signature as this op and asserts that a and b are the same shape (does not broadcast).

category.pattern: MULTIPLIES TWO TF.TENSORS ELEMENT-WISE A * B . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Multiplies two tf.Tensors element-wise, A * B. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: SUBTRACTS TWO TF.TENSORS ELEMENT-WISE A - B . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Subtracts two tf.Tensors element-wise, A - B. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: ADDS TWO TF.TENSORS ELEMENT-WISE A + B . SUPPORTS BROADCASTING
category.template: Adds two tf.Tensors element-wise, A + B. Supports broadcasting.

category.pattern: TO PERFORM MATHEMATICAL COMPUTATION ON TENSORS WE USE OPERATIONS . TENSORS ARE IMMUTABLE SO ALL OPERATIONS ALWAYS RETURN NEW TENSORS AND NEVER MODIFY INPUT TENSORS
category.template: To perform mathematical computation on Tensors, we use operations. Tensors are immutable, so all operations always return new Tensors and never modify input Tensors.

category.pattern: IF ANY DOWNSTREAM LAYER DOES NOT SUPPORT MASKING YET RECEIVES SUCH AN INPUT MASK AN EXCEPTION WILL BE RAISED
category.template: If any downstream layer does not support masking yet receives such an input mask, an exception will be raised.

category.pattern: IF ALL FEATURES FOR A GIVEN SAMPLE TIMESTEP ARE EQUAL TO MASK_VALUE THEN THE SAMPLE TIMESTEP WILL BE MASKED ( SKIPPED ) IN ALL DOWNSTREAM LAYERS ( AS LONG AS THEY SUPPORT MASKING )
category.template: If all features for a given sample timestep are equal to mask_value, then the sample timestep will be masked (skipped) in all downstream layers (as long as they support masking).

category.pattern: MASKS A SEQUENCE BY USING A MASK VALUE TO SKIP TIMESTEPS
category.template: Masks a sequence by using a mask value to skip timesteps.

category.pattern: THIS IS USEFUL TO MITIGATE OVERFITTING ( YOU COULD SEE IT AS A FORM OF RANDOM DATA AUGMENTATION ) . GAUSSIAN NOISE ( GS ) IS A NATURAL CHOICE AS CORRUPTION PROCESS FOR REAL VALUED INPUTS
category.template: This is useful to mitigate overfitting (you could see it as a form of random data augmentation). Gaussian Noise (GS) is a natural choice as corruption process for real valued inputs.

category.pattern: APPLY ADDITIVE ZERO-CENTERED GAUSSIAN NOISE
category.template: Apply additive zero-centered Gaussian noise.

category.pattern: APPLY MULTIPLICATIVE 1 - CENTERED GAUSSIAN NOISE
category.template: Apply multiplicative 1-centered Gaussian noise.

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : ARBITRARY . USE THE KEYWORD ARGUMENT INPUTSHAPE ( TUPLE OF INTEGERS DOES NOT INCLUDE THE SAMPLES AXIS ) WHEN USING THIS LAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL
category.template: Input shape: Arbitrary. Use the keyword argument inputShape (tuple of integers, does not include the samples axis) when using this layer as the first layer in a model.

category.pattern: ALPHA DROPOUT IS A DROPOUT THAT KEEPS MEAN AND VARIANCE OF INPUTS TO THEIR ORIGINAL VALUES IN ORDER TO ENSURE THE SELF-NORMALIZING PROPERTY EVEN AFTER THIS DROPOUT . ALPHA DROPOUT FITS WELL TO SCALED EXPONENTIAL LINEAR UNITS BY RANDOMLY SETTING ACTIVATIONS TO THE NEGATIVE SATURATION VALUE
category.template: Alpha Dropout is a Dropout that keeps mean and variance of inputs to their original values, in order to ensure the self-normalizing property even after this dropout. Alpha Dropout fits well to Scaled Exponential Linear Units by randomly setting activations to the negative saturation value.

category.pattern: AS IT IS A REGULARIZATION LAYER IT IS ONLY ACTIVE AT TRAINING TIME
category.template: As it is a regularization layer, it is only active at training time.

category.pattern: APPLIES ALPHA DROPOUT TO THE INPUT
category.template: Applies Alpha Dropout to the input.

category.pattern: THE ORDERING OF THE DIMENSIONS IN THE INPUTS . CHANNELSLAST CORRESPONDS TO INPUTS WITH SHAPE [ BATCH HEIGHT WIDTH CHANNELS ] WHILE CHANNELSFIRST CORRESPONDS TO INPUTS WITH SHAPE [ BATCH CHANNELS HEIGHT WIDTH ]
category.template: The ordering of the dimensions in the inputs. channelsLast corresponds to inputs with shape [batch, height, width, channels] while channelsFirst corresponds to inputs with shape [batch, channels, height, width].

category.pattern: THIS LAYER CAN ADD ROWS AND COLUMNS OF ZEROS AT THE TOP BOTTOM LEFT AND RIGHT SIDE OF AN IMAGE TENSOR
category.template: This layer can add rows and columns of zeros at the top, bottom, left and right side of an image tensor.

category.pattern: ZERO-PADDING LAYER FOR 2D INPUT ( E.G . IMAGE )
category.template: Zero-padding layer for 2D input (e.g., image).

category.pattern: INPUTLAYER IS GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY FOR TF.SEQUENTIALMODELS BY SPECIFYING THEINPUTSHAPEORBATCHINPUTSHAPE FOR THE FIRST LAYER . IT SHOULD NOT BE SPECIFIED EXPLICITLY . HOWEVER IT CAN BE USEFUL SOMETIMES E.G . WHEN CONSTRUCTING A SEQUENTIAL MODEL FROM A SUBSET OF ANOTHER SEQUENTIAL MODEL S LAYERS . LIKE THE CODE SNIPPET BELOW SHOWS
category.template: InputLayer is generated automatically for tf.Sequentialmodels by specifying theinputshapeorbatchInputShape` for the first layer. It should not be specified explicitly. However, it can be useful sometimes, e.g., when constructing a sequential model from a subset of another sequential model's layers. Like the code snippet below shows.

category.pattern: AN INPUT LAYER IS AN ENTRY POINT INTO A TF.LAYERSMODEL
category.template: An input layer is an entry point into a tf.LayersModel.

category.pattern: AN RNNCELL LAYER
category.template: An RNNCell layer.

category.pattern: AFTER A LAYER IS DISPOSED IT CANNOT BE USED IN CALLS SUCH AS APPLY ( ) GETWEIGHTS ( ) OR SETWEIGHTS ( ) ANYMORE
category.template: After a Layer is disposed, it cannot be used in calls such as apply(), getWeights() or setWeights() anymore.

category.pattern: NOTE : IF THE REFERENCE COUNT IS GREATER THAN 0 AFTER THE DECREMENT THE WEIGHTS OF THE LAYER WILL NOT BE DISPOSED
category.template: Note: If the reference count is greater than 0 after the decrement, the weights of the Layer will not be disposed.

category.pattern: IF THE REFERENCE COUNT OF A LAYER BECOMES 0 ALL THE WEIGHTS WILL BE DISPOSED AND THE UNDERLYING MEMORY ( E.G . THE TEXTURES ALLOCATED IN WEBGL ) WILL BE FREED
category.template: If the reference count of a Layer becomes 0, all the weights will be disposed and the underlying memory (e.g., the textures allocated in WebGL) will be freed.

category.pattern: A LAYER IS REFERENCE-COUNTED . ITS REFERENCE COUNT IS INCREMENTED BY 1 THE FIRST ITEM ITS APPLY ( ) METHOD IS CALLED AND WHEN IT BECOMES A PART OF A NEW NODE ( THROUGH CALLING THE APPLY ( ) ) METHOD ON A TF.SYMBOLICTENSOR )
category.template: A Layer is reference-counted. Its reference count is incremented by 1 the first item its apply() method is called and when it becomes a part of a new Node (through calling the apply()) method on a tf.SymbolicTensor).

category.pattern: THIS METHOD DECREASE THE REFERENCE COUNT OF THE LAYER OBJECT BY 1
category.template: This method decrease the reference count of the Layer object by 1.

category.pattern: ATTEMPT TO DISPOSE LAYER S WEIGHTS
category.template: Attempt to dispose layer's weights.

category.pattern: THE CONFIG OF A LAYER DOES NOT INCLUDE CONNECTIVITY INFORMATION NOR THE LAYER CLASS NAME . THESE ARE HANDLED BY CONTAINER ( ONE LAYER OF ABSTRACTION ABOVE )
category.template: The config of a layer does not include connectivity information, nor the layer class name. These are handled by 'Container' (one layer of abstraction above).

category.pattern: A LAYER CONFIG IS A TS DICTIONARY ( SERIALIZABLE ) CONTAINING THE CONFIGURATION OF A LAYER . THE SAME LAYER CAN BE REINSTANTIATED LATER ( WITHOUT ITS TRAINED WEIGHTS ) FROM THIS CONFIGURATION
category.template: A layer config is a TS dictionary (serializable) containing the configuration of a layer. The same layer can be reinstantiated later (without its trained weights) from this configuration.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE CONFIG OF THE LAYER
category.template: Returns the config of the layer.

category.pattern: ASSUMES THAT THE LAYER WILL BE BUILT TO MATCH THAT INPUT SHAPE PROVIDED
category.template: Assumes that the layer will be built to match that input shape provided.

category.pattern: COMPUTES THE OUTPUT SHAPE OF THE LAYER
category.template: Computes the output shape of the layer.

category.pattern: THE LOSS MAY POTENTIONALLY BE CONDITIONAL ON SOME INPUTS TENSORS FOR INSTANCE ACTIVITY LOSSES ARE CONDITIONAL ON THE LAYER S INPUTS
category.template: The loss may potentionally be conditional on some inputs tensors, for instance activity losses are conditional on the layer's inputs.

category.pattern: ADD LOSSES TO THE LAYER
category.template: Add losses to the layer.

category.pattern: ADDS A WEIGHT VARIABLE TO THE LAYER
category.template: Adds a weight variable to the layer.

category.pattern: SETS THE WEIGHTS OF THE LAYER FROM TENSORS
category.template: Sets the weights of the layer, from Tensors.

category.pattern: RETURNS THE CURRENT VALUES OF THE WEIGHTS OF THE LAYER
category.template: Returns the current values of the weights of the layer.

category.pattern: CALLED WHEN APPLY ( ) IS CALLED TO CONSTRUCT THE WEIGHTS
category.template: Called when apply() is called to construct the weights.

category.pattern: MUST BE IMPLEMENTED ON ALL LAYERS THAT HAVE WEIGHTS
category.template: Must be implemented on all layers that have weights.

category.pattern: CREATES THE LAYER WEIGHTS
category.template: Creates the layer weights.

category.pattern: COUNTS THE TOTAL NUMBER OF NUMBERS ( E.G . FLOAT32 INT32 ) IN THE WEIGHTS
category.template: Counts the total number of numbers (e.g., float32, int32) in the weights.

category.pattern: WHEN CALLED WITH TF.SYMBOLICTENSOR ( S ) THIS WILL PREPARE THE LAYER FOR FUTURE EXECUTION . THIS ENTAILS INTERNAL BOOK-KEEPING ON SHAPES OF EXPECTED TENSORS WIRING LAYERS TOGETHER AND INITIALIZING WEIGHTS
category.template: When called with tf.SymbolicTensor(s), this will prepare the layer for future execution. This entails internal book-keeping on shapes of expected Tensors, wiring layers together, and initializing weights.

category.pattern: BUILDS OR EXECUTES A LAYER S LOGIC
category.template: Builds or executes a `Layer's logic.

category.pattern: LAYERS ARE CONSTRUCTED BY USING THE FUNCTIONS UNDER THE TF.LAYERS NAMESPACE
category.template: Layers are constructed by using the functions under the tf.layers namespace.

category.pattern: A LAYER IS A GROUPING OF OPERATIONS AND WEIGHTS THAT CAN BE COMPOSED TO CREATE A TF.LAYERSMODEL
category.template: A layer is a grouping of operations and weights that can be composed to create a tf.LayersModel.

category.pattern: TIMEDISTRIBUTED CAN BE USED WITH ARBITRARY LAYERS NOT JUST DENSE FOR INSTANCE A CONV2D LAYER
category.template: TimeDistributed can be used with arbitrary layers, not just Dense, for instance a Conv2D layer.

category.pattern: THE OUTPUT WILL THEN HAVE SHAPE [ 32 10 32 ]
category.template: The output will then have shape [32, 10, 32].

category.pattern: CONSIDER A BATCH OF 32 SAMPLES WHERE EACH SAMPLE IS A SEQUENCE OF 10 VECTORS OF 16 DIMENSIONS . THE BATCH INPUT SHAPE OF THE LAYER IS THEN [ 32 10 16 ] AND THE INPUTSHAPE NOT INCLUDING THE SAMPLE DIMENSION IS [ 10 16 ]
category.template: Consider a batch of 32 samples, where each sample is a sequence of 10 vectors of 16 dimensions. The batch input shape of the layer is then [32, 10, 16], and the inputShape, not including the sample dimension, is [10, 16].

category.pattern: THE INPUT SHOULD BE AT LEAST 3D AND THE DIMENSION OF THE INDEX 1 WILL BE CONSIDERED TO BE THE TEMPORAL DIMENSION
category.template: The input should be at least 3D, and the dimension of the index 1 will be considered to be the temporal dimension.

category.pattern: THIS WRAPPER APPLIES A LAYER TO EVERY TEMPORAL SLICE OF AN INPUT
category.template: This wrapper applies a layer to every temporal slice of an input.

category.pattern: IF UNDEFINED ( I.E . NOT PROVIDED ) DEFAULTS TO CONCAT
category.template: If undefined (i.e., not provided), defaults to 'concat'.

category.pattern: IF UNDEFINED ( I.E . NOT PROVIDED ) DEFAULTS TO CONCAT
category.template: If undefined (i.e., not provided), defaults to 'concat'.

category.pattern: USED TO IMPLEMENT EFFICIENT STACKED RNNS
category.template: Used to implement efficient stacked RNNs.

category.pattern: WRAPPER ALLOWING A STACK OF RNN CELLS TO BEHAVE AS A SINGLE CELL
category.template: Wrapper allowing a stack of RNN cells to behave as a single cell.

category.pattern: TO CREATE AN RNN CONSISTING OF ONLY ONE SIMPLERNNCELL USE THE TF.LAYERS.SIMPLERNN ( )
category.template: To create an RNN consisting of only one SimpleRNNCell, use the tf.layers.simpleRNN().

category.pattern: CELL CLASS FOR SIMPLERNN
category.template: Cell class for SimpleRNN.

category.pattern: FULLY-CONNECTED RNN WHERE THE OUTPUT IS TO BE FED BACK TO INPUT
category.template: Fully-connected RNN where the output is to be fed back to input.

category.pattern: NOTE ON PASSING EXTERNAL CONSTANTS TO RNNS YOU CAN PASS EXTERNAL CONSTANTS TO THE CELL USING THE CONSTANTS KEYWORD ARGUMENT OF RNN.CALL METHOD . THIS REQUIRES THAT THE CELL.CALL METHOD ACCEPTS THE SAME KEYWORD ARGUMENT CONSTANTS . SUCH CONSTANTS CAN BE USED TO CONDITON THE CELL TRANSFORMATION ON ADDITIONAL STATIC INPUTS ( NOT CHANGING OVER TIME ) A.K.A AN ATTENTION MECHANISM
category.template: Note on passing external constants to RNNs You can pass "external" constants to the cell using the constants keyword argument of RNN.call method. This requires that the cell.call method accepts the same keyword argument constants. Such constants can be used to conditon the cell transformation on additional static inputs (not changing over time), a.k.a an attention mechanism.

category.pattern: YOU CAN SPECIFY THE INITIAL STATE OF RNN LAYERS NUMERICALLY BY CALLING RESETSTATES WITH THE KEYWORD ARGUMENT STATES . THE VALUE OF STATES SHOULD BE A NUMPY ARRAY OR LIST OF NUMPY ARRAYS REPRESENTING THE INITIAL STATE OF THE RNN LAYER
category.template: You can specify the initial state of RNN layers numerically by calling resetStates with the keyword argument states. The value of states should be a numpy array or list of numpy arrays representing the initial state of the RNN layer.

category.pattern: NOTE ON SPECIFYING THE INITIAL STATE OF RNNS YOU CAN SPECIFY THE INITIAL STATE OF RNN LAYERS SYMBOLICALLY BY CALLING THEM WITH THE OPTION INITIALSTATE . THE VALUE OF INITIALSTATE SHOULD BE A TENSOR OR LIST OF TENSORS REPRESENTING THE INITIAL STATE OF THE RNN LAYER
category.template: Note on specifying the initial state of RNNs You can specify the initial state of RNN layers symbolically by calling them with the option initialState. The value of initialState should be a tensor or list of tensors representing the initial state of the RNN layer.

category.pattern: TO RESET THE STATES OF YOUR MODEL CALL . RESETSTATES ( ) ON EITHER A SPECIFIC LAYER OR ON YOUR ENTIRE MODEL
category.template: To reset the states of your model, call .resetStates() on either a specific layer, or on your entire model.

category.pattern: TO ENABLE STATEFULNESS : - SPECIFY STATEFUL : TRUE IN THE LAYER CONSTRUCTOR . - SPECIFY A FIXED BATCH SIZE FOR YOUR MODEL BY PASSING IF SEQUENTIAL MODEL : BATCHINPUTSHAPE = [ . . . ] TO THE FIRST LAYER IN YOUR MODEL . ELSE FOR FUNCTIONAL MODEL WITH 1 OR MORE INPUT LAYERS : BATCHSHAPE = [ . . . ] TO ALL THE FIRST LAYERS IN YOUR MODEL . THIS IS THE EXPECTED SHAPE OF YOUR INPUTS INCLUDING THE BATCH SIZE . IT SHOULD BE A TUPLE OF INTEGERS E.G . ( 32 10 100 ) . - SPECIFY SHUFFLE = FALSE WHEN CALLING FIT ( )
category.template: To enable statefulness: - specify stateful: true in the layer constructor. - specify a fixed batch size for your model, by passing if sequential model: batchInputShape=[...] to the first layer in your model. else for functional model with 1 or more Input layers: batchShape=[...] to all the first layers in your model. This is the expected shape of your inputs including the batch size. It should be a tuple of integers, e.g. (32, 10, 100). - specify shuffle=False when calling fit().

category.pattern: NOTES ON USING STATEFULNESS IN RNNS : YOU CAN SET RNN LAYERS TO BE STATEFUL WHICH MEANS THAT THE STATES COMPUTED FOR THE SAMPLES IN ONE BATCH WILL BE REUSED AS INITIAL STATES FOR THE SAMPLES IN THE NEXT BATCH . THIS ASSUMES A ONE-TO-ONE MAPPING BETWEEN SAMPLES IN DIFFERENT SUCCESSIVE BATCHES
category.template: Notes on using statefulness in RNNs: You can set RNN layers to be 'stateful', which means that the states computed for the samples in one batch will be reused as initial states for the samples in the next batch. This assumes a one-to-one mapping between samples in different successive batches.

category.pattern: MASKING : THIS LAYER SUPPORTS MASKING FOR INPUT DATA WITH A VARIABLE NUMBER OF TIMESTEPS . TO INTRODUCE MASKS TO YOUR DATA USE AN EMBEDDING LAYER WITH THE MASK_ZERO PARAMETER SET TO TRUE
category.template: Masking: This layer supports masking for input data with a variable number of timesteps. To introduce masks to your data, use an embedding layer with the mask_zero parameter set to True.

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : 3D TENSOR WITH SHAPE [ BATCHSIZE TIMESTEPS INPUTDIM ]
category.template: Input shape: 3D tensor with shape [batchSize, timeSteps, inputDim].

category.pattern: BASE CLASS FOR RECURRENT LAYERS
category.template: Base class for recurrent layers.

category.pattern: TO CREATE AN RNN CONSISTING OF ONLY ONE LSTMCELL USE THE TF.LAYERS.LSTM ( )
category.template: To create an RNN consisting of only one LSTMCell, use the tf.layers.lstm().

category.pattern: CELL CLASS FOR LSTM
category.template: Cell class for LSTM.

category.pattern: LONG-SHORT TERM MEMORY LAYER - HOCHREITER 1997
category.template: Long-Short Term Memory layer - Hochreiter 1997.

category.pattern: TO CREATE AN RNN CONSISTING OF ONLY ONE GRUCELL USE THE TF.LAYERS.GRU ( )
category.template: To create an RNN consisting of only one GRUCell, use the tf.layers.gru().

category.pattern: CELL CLASS FOR GRU
category.template: Cell class for GRU.

category.pattern: GATED RECURRENT UNIT - CHO ET AL . 2014
category.template: Gated Recurrent Unit - Cho et al. 2014.

category.pattern: NOTE : FOR SUPERIOR PERFORMANCE TENSORFLOW.JS ALWAYS USES IMPLEMENTATION 2 REGARDLESS OF THE ACTUAL VALUE OF THIS CONFIGURATION FIELD
category.template: Note: For superior performance, TensorFlow.js always uses implementation 2, regardless of the actual value of this configuration field.

category.pattern: MODE 2 WILL BATCH THEM INTO FEWER LARGER OPERATIONS . THESE MODES WILL HAVE DIFFERENT PERFORMANCE PROFILES ON DIFFERENT HARDWARE AND FOR DIFFERENT APPLICATIONS
category.template: Mode 2 will batch them into fewer, larger operations. These modes will have different performance profiles on different hardware and for different applications.

category.pattern: MODE 1 WILL STRUCTURE ITS OPERATIONS AS A LARGER NUMBER OF SMALLER DOT PRODUCTS AND ADDITIONS
category.template: Mode 1 will structure its operations as a larger number of smaller dot products and additions.

category.pattern: CELL CLASS FOR CONVLSTM2D
category.template: Cell class for ConvLSTM2D.

category.pattern: TO RESET THE STATE OF YOUR MODEL CALL RESETSTATES ( ) ON EITHER THE SPECIFIC LAYER OR ON THE ENTIRE MODEL
category.template: To reset the state of your model, call resetStates() on either the specific layer or on the entire model.

category.pattern: YOU CAN SET RNN LAYERS TO BE STATEFUL WHICH MEANS THAT THE STATES COMPUTED FOR THE SAMPLES IN ONE BATCH WILL BE REUSED AS INITIAL STATES FOR THE SAMPLES IN THE NEXT BATCH . THIS ASSUMES A ONE-TO-ONE MAPPING BETWEEN SAMPLES IN DIFFERENT SUCCESSIVE BATCHES
category.template: You can set RNN layers to be "stateful", which means that the states computed for the samples in one batch will be reused as initial states for the samples in the next batch. This assumes a one-to-one mapping between samples in different successive batches.

category.pattern: NOTE : FOR SUPERIOR PERFORMANCE TENSORFLOW.JS ALWAYS USES IMPLEMENTATION 2 REGARDLESS OF THE ACTUAL VALUE OF THIS CONFIG FIELD
category.template: Note: For superior performance, TensorFlow.js always uses implementation 2, regardless of the actual value of this config field.

category.pattern: IF NULL NO ACTIVATION IS APPLIED
category.template: If null, no activation is applied.

category.pattern: DEFAULTS TO HARD SIGMOID ( HARDSIGMOID )
category.template: Defaults to hard sigmoid (hardSigmoid).

category.pattern: IF YOU PASS NULL NO ACTIVATION WILL BE APPLIED
category.template: If you pass null, no activation will be applied.

category.pattern: CONVOLUTIONAL LSTM LAYER - XINGJIAN SHI 2015
category.template: Convolutional LSTM layer - Xingjian Shi 2015.

category.pattern: MAX POOLING OPERATION FOR 3D DATA
category.template: Max pooling operation for 3D data.

category.pattern: MAX POOLING OPERATION FOR SPATIAL DATA
category.template: Max pooling operation for spatial data.

category.pattern: MAX POOLING OPERATION FOR TEMPORAL DATA
category.template: Max pooling operation for temporal data.

category.pattern: GLOBAL MAX POOLING OPERATION FOR SPATIAL DATA
category.template: Global max pooling operation for spatial data.

category.pattern: GLOBAL MAX POOLING OPERATION FOR TEMPORAL DATA
category.template: Global max pooling operation for temporal data.

category.pattern: THE ORDERING OF THE DIMENSIONS IN THE INPUTS . CHANNEL_LAST CORRESPONDS TO INPUTS WITH SHAPE [ BATCH HEIGHT WIDTH CHANNELS [ WHILE CHANNEL_FIRST CORRESPONDS TO INPUTS WITH SHAPE [ BATCH CHANNELS HEIGHT WIDTH ]
category.template: The ordering of the dimensions in the inputs. CHANNEL_LAST corresponds to inputs with shape [batch, height, width, channels[ while CHANNEL_FIRST corresponds to inputs with shape [batch, channels, height, width].

category.pattern: OUTPUT SHAPE : 2D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCHSIZE CHANNELS ]
category.template: Output shape: 2D tensor with shape: [batchSize, channels].

category.pattern: GLOBAL AVERAGE POOLING OPERATION FOR SPATIAL DATA
category.template: Global average pooling operation for spatial data.

category.pattern: OUTPUT SHAPE : 2D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCHSIZE FEATURES ]
category.template: Output Shape:2D tensor with shape: [batchSize, features].

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : 3D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCHSIZE STEPS FEATURES ]
category.template: Input Shape: 3D tensor with shape: [batchSize, steps, features].

category.pattern: GLOBAL AVERAGE POOLING OPERATION FOR TEMPORAL DATA
category.template: Global average pooling operation for temporal data.

category.pattern: FOR EXAMPLE [ 2 2 2 ] WILL HALVE THE INPUT IN THREE DIMENSIONS . IF ONLY ONE INTEGER IS SPECIFIED THE SAME WINDOW LENGTH WILL BE USED FOR ALL DIMENSIONS
category.template: For example, [2, 2, 2] will halve the input in three dimensions. If only one integer is specified, the same window length will be used for all dimensions.

category.pattern: AVERAGE POOLING OPERATION FOR 3D DATA
category.template: Average pooling operation for 3D data.

category.pattern: FOR EXAMPLE [ 2 2 ] WILL HALVE THE INPUT IN BOTH SPATIAL DIMENSION . IF ONLY ONE INTEGER IS SPECIFIED THE SAME WINDOW LENGTH WILL BE USED FOR BOTH DIMENSIONS
category.template: For example, [2, 2] will halve the input in both spatial dimension. If only one integer is specified, the same window length will be used for both dimensions.

category.pattern: TF.AVGPOOL2D IS AN ALIAS
category.template: tf.avgPool2d is an alias.

category.pattern: IF NULL DEFAULTS TO POOLSIZE
category.template: If null, defaults to poolSize.

category.pattern: TF.AVGPOOL1D IS AN ALIAS
category.template: tf.avgPool1d is an alias.

category.pattern: AVERAGE POOLING OPERATION FOR SPATIAL DATA
category.template: Average pooling operation for spatial data.

category.pattern: OUTPUT SHAPE : SAME AS INPUT
category.template: Output shape: Same as input.

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : ARBITRARY . USE THE ARGUMENT INPUTSHAPE WHEN USING THIS LAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL
category.template: Input shape: Arbitrary. Use the argument inputShape when using this layer as the first layer in a model.

category.pattern: NORMALIZES THE ACTIVATIONS OF THE PREVIOUS LAYER FOR EACH GIVEN EXAMPLE IN A BATCH INDEPENDENTLY INSTEAD OF ACROSS A BATCH LIKE IN BATCHNORMALIZATION . IN OTHER WORDS THIS LAYER APPLIES A TRANSFORMATION THAT MAINTANIS THE MEAN ACTIVATION WITHIN EACH EXAMPLE CLOSE TO0 AND ACTIVATION VARIANCE CLOSE TO 1
category.template: Normalizes the activations of the previous layer for each given example in a batch independently, instead of across a batch like in batchNormalization. In other words, this layer applies a transformation that maintanis the mean activation within each example close to0 and activation variance close to 1.

category.pattern: LAYER-NORMALIZATION LAYER ( BA ET AL . 2016 )
category.template: Layer-normalization layer (Ba et al., 2016).

category.pattern: FOR INSTANCE AFTER A CONV2D LAYER WITH DATA_FORMAT = CHANNELS_FIRST SET AXIS = 1 IN BATCHNORMALIZATION
category.template: For instance, after a Conv2D layer with data_format="channels_first", set axis=1 in batchNormalization.

category.pattern: OUTPUT SHAPE : SAME SHAPE AS INPUT
category.template: Output shape: Same shape as input.

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : ARBITRARY . USE THE KEYWORD ARGUMENT INPUTSHAPE ( ARRAY OF INTEGERS DOES NOT INCLUDE THE SAMPLE AXIS ) WHEN CALLING THE CONSTRUCTOR OF THIS CLASS IF THIS LAYER IS USED AS A FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL
category.template: Input shape: Arbitrary. Use the keyword argument inputShape (Array of integers, does not include the sample axis) when calling the constructor of this class, if this layer is used as a first layer in a model.

category.pattern: NORMALIZE THE ACTIVATIONS OF THE PREVIOUS LAYER AT EACH BATCH I.E . APPLIES A TRANSFORMATION THAT MAINTAINS THE MEAN ACTIVATION CLOSE TO 0 AND THE ACTIVATION STANDARD DEVIATION CLOSE TO 1
category.template: Normalize the activations of the previous layer at each batch, i.e. applies a transformation that maintains the mean activation close to 0 and the activation standard deviation close to 1.

category.pattern: BATCH NORMALIZATION LAYER ( IOFFE AND SZEGEDY 2014 )
category.template: Batch normalization layer (Ioffe and Szegedy, 2014).

category.pattern: LAYER THAT MULTIPLIES ( ELEMENT-WISE ) AN ARRAY OF INPUTS
category.template: Layer that multiplies (element-wise) an Array of inputs.

category.pattern: LAYER THAT COMPUTES THE ELEMENT-WISE MINIMUM OF AN ARRAY OF INPUTS
category.template: Layer that computes the element-wise minimum of an Array of inputs.

category.pattern: LAYER THAT COMPUTES THE ELEMENT-WISE MAXIMUM AN ARRAY OF INPUTS
category.template: Layer that computes the element-wise maximum an Array of inputs.

category.pattern: IF SET TO TRUE THE OUTPUT OF THE DOT PRODUCT ISTHE COSINE PROXIMITY BETWEEN THE TWO SAMPLES
category.template: If set to true, the output of the dot product isthe cosine proximity between the two samples.

category.pattern: INTEGER OR AN ARRAY OF INTEGERS
category.template: Integer or an Array of integers.

category.pattern: E.G . IF APPLIED TO A LIST OF TWO TENSORS A AND B BOTH OF SHAPE [ BATCHSIZE N ] THE OUTPUT WILL BE A TENSOR OF SHAPE [ BATCHSIZE 1 ] WHERE EACH ENTRY AT INDEX [ I 0 ] WILL BE THE DOT PRODUCT BETWEEN A [ I : ] AND B [ I : ]
category.template: E.g., if applied to a list of two tensors a and b both of shape [batchSize, n], the output will be a tensor of shape [batchSize, 1], where each entry at index [i, 0] will be the dot product between a[i, :] and b[i, :].

category.pattern: LAYER THAT COMPUTES A DOT PRODUCT BETWEEN SAMPLES IN TWO TENSORS
category.template: Layer that computes a dot product between samples in two tensors.

category.pattern: LAYER THAT CONCATENATES AN ARRAY OF INPUTS
category.template: Layer that concatenates an Array of inputs.

category.pattern: LAYER THAT PERFORMS ELEMENT-WISE AVERAGING ON AN ARRAY OF INPUTS
category.template: Layer that performs element-wise averaging on an Array of inputs.

category.pattern: LAYER THAT PERFORMS ELEMENT-WISE ADDITION ON AN ARRAY OF INPUTS
category.template: Layer that performs element-wise addition on an Array of inputs.

category.pattern: DEFAULTS TO CHANNELSLAST
category.template: Defaults to "channelsLast".

category.pattern: DEFAULTS TO CHANNELSLAST
category.template: Defaults to "channelsLast".

category.pattern: CHANNELSFIRST CORRESPONDS TO INPUTS WITH SHAPE [ BATCH CHANNELS . . . ]
category.template: "channelsFirst" corresponds to inputs with shape [batch, channels, ...].

category.pattern: DEFAULTS TO [ 2 2 ]
category.template: Defaults to [2, 2].

category.pattern: REPEATS THE ROWS AND COLUMNS OF THE DATA BY SIZE [ 0 ] AND SIZE [ 1 ] RESPECTIVELY
category.template: Repeats the rows and columns of the data by size[0] and size[1] respectively.

category.pattern: UPSAMPLING LAYER FOR 2D INPUTS
category.template: Upsampling layer for 2D inputs.

category.pattern: OUTPUT SHAPE : 4D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCH FILTERS NEWROWS NEWCOLS ] IF DATA_FORMAT = CHANNELSFIRST OR 4D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCH NEWROWS NEWCOLS FILTERS ] IF DATA_FORMAT = CHANNELSLAST . ROWS AND COLS VALUES MIGHT HAVE CHANGED DUE TO PADDING
category.template: Output shape: 4D tensor with shape: [batch, filters, newRows, newCols] if data_format='channelsFirst' or 4D tensor with shape: [batch, newRows, newCols, filters] if data_format='channelsLast'. rows and cols values might have changed due to padding.

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : 4D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCH CHANNELS ROWS COLS ] IF DATA_FORMAT = CHANNELSFIRST OR 4D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCH ROWS COLS CHANNELS ] IF DATA_FORMAT = CHANNELSLAST
category.template: Input shape: 4D tensor with shape: [batch, channels, rows, cols] if data_format='channelsFirst' or 4D tensor with shape: [batch, rows, cols, channels] if data_format='channelsLast'.

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : 4D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCH CHANNELS ROWS COLS ] IF DATA_FORMAT = CHANNELSFIRST OR 4D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCH ROWS COLS CHANNELS ] IF DATA_FORMAT = CHANNELSLAST
category.template: Input shape: 4D tensor with shape: [batch, channels, rows, cols] if data_format='channelsFirst' or 4D tensor with shape: [batch, rows, cols, channels] if data_format='channelsLast'.

category.pattern: INTUITIVELY SEPARABLE CONVOLUTIONS CAN BE UNDERSTOOD AS A WAY TO FACTORIZE A CONVOLUTION KERNEL INTO TWO SMALLER KERNELS OR AS AN EXTREME VERSION OF AN INCEPTION BLOCK
category.template: Intuitively, separable convolutions can be understood as a way to factorize a convolution kernel into two smaller kernels, or as an extreme version of an Inception block.

category.pattern: SEPARABLE CONVOLUTION CONSISTS OF FIRST PERFORMING A DEPTHWISE SPATIAL CONVOLUTION ( WHICH ACTS ON EACH INPUT CHANNEL SEPARATELY ) FOLLOWED BY A POINTWISE CONVOLUTION WHICH MIXES TOGETHER THE RESULTING OUTPUT CHANNELS . THE DEPTHMULTIPLIER ARGUMENT CONTROLS HOW MANY OUTPUT CHANNELS ARE GENERATED PER INPUT CHANNEL IN THE DEPTHWISE STEP
category.template: Separable convolution consists of first performing a depthwise spatial convolution (which acts on each input channel separately) followed by a pointwise convolution which mixes together the resulting output channels. The depthMultiplier argument controls how many output channels are generated per input channel in the depthwise step.

category.pattern: DEPTHWISE SEPARABLE CONVOLUTIONS CONSISTS IN PERFORMING JUST THE FIRST STEP IN A DEPTHWISE SPATIAL CONVOLUTION ( WHICH ACTS ON EACH INPUT CHANNEL SEPARATELY ) . THE DEPTHMULTPLIER ARGUMENT CONTROLS HOW MANY OUTPUT CHANNELS ARE GENERATED PER INPUT CHANNEL IN THE DEPTHWISE STEP
category.template: Depthwise Separable convolutions consists in performing just the first step in a depthwise spatial convolution (which acts on each input channel separately). The depthMultplier argument controls how many output channels are generated per input channel in the depthwise step.

category.pattern: DEPTHWISE SEPARABLE 2D CONVOLUTION
category.template: Depthwise separable 2D convolution.

category.pattern: THIS LAYER CAN CROP AN INPUT AT THE TOP BOTTOM LEFT AND RIGHT SIDE OF AN IMAGE TENSOR
category.template: This layer can crop an input at the top, bottom, left and right side of an image tensor.

category.pattern: CROPPING LAYER FOR 2D INPUT ( E.G . IMAGE )
category.template: Cropping layer for 2D input (e.g., image).

category.pattern: WHEN USING THIS LAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL PROVIDE THE KEYWORD ARGUMENT INPUTSHAPE ( ARRAY OF INTEGERS DOES NOT INCLUDE THE SAMPLE AXIS ) E.G . INPUTSHAPE = [ 128 128 128 1 ] FOR 128X128X128 GRAYSCALE VOLUMES IN DATAFORMAT = CHANNELSLAST
category.template: When using this layer as the first layer in a model, provide the keyword argument inputShape (Array of integers, does not include the sample axis), e.g. inputShape=[128, 128, 128, 1] for 128x128x128 grayscale volumes in dataFormat='channelsLast'.

category.pattern: WHEN USING THIS LAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL PROVIDE THE KEYWORD ARGUMENT INPUTSHAPE ( ARRAY OF INTEGERS DOES NOT INCLUDE THE SAMPLE AXIS ) E.G . INPUTSHAPE = [ 128 128 128 1 ] FOR 128X128X128 GRAYSCALE VOLUMES IN DATAFORMAT = CHANNELSLAST
category.template: When using this layer as the first layer in a model, provide the keyword argument inputShape (Array of integers, does not include the sample axis), e.g. inputShape=[128, 128, 128, 1] for 128x128x128 grayscale volumes in dataFormat='channelsLast'.

category.pattern: 3D CONVOLUTION LAYER ( E.G . SPATIAL CONVOLUTION OVER VOLUMES )
category.template: 3D convolution layer (e.g. spatial convolution over volumes).

category.pattern: OUTPUT SHAPE : 4D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCH FILTERS NEWROWS NEWCOLS ] IF DATAFORMAT IS CHANNELSFIRST . OR 4D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCH NEWROWS NEWCOLS FILTERS ] IF DATAFORMAT IS CHANNELSLAST
category.template: Output shape: 4D tensor with shape: [batch, filters, newRows, newCols] if dataFormat is 'channelsFirst'. or 4D tensor with shape: [batch, newRows, newCols, filters] if dataFormat is 'channelsLast'.

category.pattern: OUTPUT SHAPE : 4D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCH FILTERS NEWROWS NEWCOLS ] IF DATAFORMAT IS CHANNELSFIRST . OR 4D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCH NEWROWS NEWCOLS FILTERS ] IF DATAFORMAT IS CHANNELSLAST
category.template: Output shape: 4D tensor with shape: [batch, filters, newRows, newCols] if dataFormat is 'channelsFirst'. or 4D tensor with shape: [batch, newRows, newCols, filters] if dataFormat is 'channelsLast'.

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : 4D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCH CHANNELS ROWS COLS ] IF DATAFORMAT IS CHANNELSFIRST . OR 4D TENSOR WITH SHAPE [ BATCH ROWS COLS CHANNELS ] IF DATAFORMAT IS CHANNELSLAST
category.template: Input shape: 4D tensor with shape: [batch, channels, rows, cols] if dataFormat is 'channelsFirst'. or 4D tensor with shape [batch, rows, cols, channels] if dataFormat is 'channelsLast.

category.pattern: WHEN USING THIS LAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL PROVIDE THE CONFIGURATION INPUTSHAPE ( ARRAY OF INTEGERS DOES NOT INCLUDE THE SAMPLE AXIS ) E.G . INPUTSHAPE : [ 128 128 3 ] FOR 128X128 RGB PICTURES IN DATAFORMAT : CHANNELSLAST
category.template: When using this layer as the first layer in a model, provide the configuration inputShape (Array of integers, does not include the sample axis), e.g., inputShape: [128, 128, 3] for 128x128 RGB pictures in dataFormat: 'channelsLast'.

category.pattern: WHEN USING THIS LAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL PROVIDE THE CONFIGURATION INPUTSHAPE ( ARRAY OF INTEGERS DOES NOT INCLUDE THE SAMPLE AXIS ) E.G . INPUTSHAPE : [ 128 128 3 ] FOR 128X128 RGB PICTURES IN DATAFORMAT : CHANNELSLAST
category.template: When using this layer as the first layer in a model, provide the configuration inputShape (Array of integers, does not include the sample axis), e.g., inputShape: [128, 128, 3] for 128x128 RGB pictures in dataFormat: 'channelsLast'.

category.pattern: THE NEED FOR TRANSPOSED CONVOLUTIONS GENERALLY ARISES FROM THE DESIRE TO USE A TRANSFORMATION GOING IN THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION OF A NORMAL CONVOLUTION I.E . FROM SOMETHING THAT HAS THE SHAPE OF THE OUTPUT OF SOME CONVOLUTION TO SOMETHING THAT HAS THE SHAPE OF ITS INPUT WHILE MAINTAINING A CONNECTIVITY PATTERN THAT IS COMPATIBLE WITH SAID CONVOLUTION
category.template: The need for transposed convolutions generally arises from the desire to use a transformation going in the opposite direction of a normal convolution, i.e., from something that has the shape of the output of some convolution to something that has the shape of its input while maintaining a connectivity pattern that is compatible with said convolution.

category.pattern: TRANSPOSED CONVOLUTIONAL LAYER ( SOMETIMES CALLED DECONVOLUTION )
category.template: Transposed convolutional layer (sometimes called Deconvolution).

category.pattern: WHEN USING THIS LAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL PROVIDE THE KEYWORD ARGUMENT INPUTSHAPE ( ARRAY OF INTEGERS DOES NOT INCLUDE THE SAMPLE AXIS ) E.G . INPUTSHAPE = [ 128 128 3 ] FOR 128X128 RGB PICTURES IN DATAFORMAT = CHANNELSLAST
category.template: When using this layer as the first layer in a model, provide the keyword argument inputShape (Array of integers, does not include the sample axis), e.g. inputShape=[128, 128, 3] for 128x128 RGB pictures in dataFormat='channelsLast'.

category.pattern: WHEN USING THIS LAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL PROVIDE THE KEYWORD ARGUMENT INPUTSHAPE ( ARRAY OF INTEGERS DOES NOT INCLUDE THE SAMPLE AXIS ) E.G . INPUTSHAPE = [ 128 128 3 ] FOR 128X128 RGB PICTURES IN DATAFORMAT = CHANNELSLAST
category.template: When using this layer as the first layer in a model, provide the keyword argument inputShape (Array of integers, does not include the sample axis), e.g. inputShape=[128, 128, 3] for 128x128 RGB pictures in dataFormat='channelsLast'.

category.pattern: IF USEBIAS IS TRUE A BIAS VECTOR IS CREATED AND ADDED TO THE OUTPUTS
category.template: If useBias is True, a bias vector is created and added to the outputs.

category.pattern: THIS LAYER CREATES A CONVOLUTION KERNEL THAT IS CONVOLVED WITH THE LAYER INPUT TO PRODUCE A TENSOR OF OUTPUTS
category.template: This layer creates a convolution kernel that is convolved with the layer input to produce a tensor of outputs.

category.pattern: 2D CONVOLUTION LAYER ( E.G . SPATIAL CONVOLUTION OVER IMAGES )
category.template: 2D convolution layer (e.g. spatial convolution over images).

category.pattern: IF YOU DON T SPECIFY THE ACTIVATION NONE IS APPLIED
category.template: If you don't specify the activation, none is applied.

category.pattern: CURRENTLY SPECIFYING ANY DILATIONRATE VALUE ! = 1 IS INCOMPATIBLE WITH SPECIFYING ANY STRIDES VALUE ! = 1
category.template: Currently, specifying any dilationRate value != 1 is incompatible with specifying any strides value != 1.

category.pattern: DEFAULTS TO CHANNELS_LAST
category.template: Defaults to channels_last.

category.pattern: CHANNELS_FIRST CORRESPONDS TO INPUTS WITH SHAPE ( BATCH CHANNELS . . . )
category.template: channels_first corresponds to inputs with shape (batch, channels, ...).

category.pattern: SPECIFYING ANY STRIDE VALUE ! = 1 IS INCOMPATIBLE WITH SPECIFYING ANY DILATIONRATE VALUE ! = 1
category.template: Specifying any stride value != 1 is incompatible with specifying any dilationRate value != 1.

category.pattern: WHEN USING THIS LAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL PROVIDE AN INPUTSHAPE ARGUMENT ARRAY OR NULL
category.template: When using this layer as the first layer in a model, provide an inputShape argument Array or null.

category.pattern: IF ACTIVATION IS NOT NULL IT IS APPLIED TO THE OUTPUTS AS WELL
category.template: If activation is not null, it is applied to the outputs as well.

category.pattern: IF USE_BIAS IS TRUE A BIAS VECTOR IS CREATED AND ADDED TO THE OUTPUTS
category.template: If use_bias is True, a bias vector is created and added to the outputs.

category.pattern: THIS LAYER CREATES A CONVOLUTION KERNEL THAT IS CONVOLVED WITH THE LAYER INPUT OVER A SINGLE SPATIAL ( OR TEMPORAL ) DIMENSION TO PRODUCE A TENSOR OF OUTPUTS
category.template: This layer creates a convolution kernel that is convolved with the layer input over a single spatial (or temporal) dimension to produce a tensor of outputs.

category.pattern: 1D CONVOLUTION LAYER ( E.G . TEMPORAL CONVOLUTION )
category.template: 1D convolution layer (e.g., temporal convolution).

category.pattern: OUTPUT SHAPE : * SAME AS THE INPUT SHAPE
category.template: Output shape:* Same as the input shape.

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : * 3D TENSOR WITH SHAPE ( SAMPLES TIMESTEPS CHANNELS )
category.template: Input shape:* 3D tensor with shape (samples, timesteps, channels).

category.pattern: ARGUMENTS : * RATE : A FLOATING-POINT NUMBER > = 0 AND < = 1 . FRACTION OF THE INPUT ELEMENTS TO DROP
category.template: Arguments:* rate: A floating-point number >=0 and <=1. Fraction of the input elements to drop.

category.pattern: IF ADJACENT FRAMES ( TIMESTEPS ) ARE STRONGLY CORRELATED ( AS IS NORMALLY THE CASE IN EARLY CONVOLUTION LAYERS ) REGULAR DROPOUT WILL NOT REGULARIZE THE ACTIVATION AND WILL OTHERWISE JUST RESULT IN MERELY AN EFFECTIVE LEARNING RATE DECREASE . IN THIS CASE SPATIALDROPOUT1D WILL HELP PROMOTE INDEPENDENCE AMONG FEATURE MAPS AND SHOULD BE USED INSTEAD
category.template: If adjacent frames (timesteps) are strongly correlated (as is normally the case in early convolution layers), regular dropout will not regularize the activation and will otherwise just result in merely an effective learning rate decrease. In this case, spatialDropout1d will help promote independence among feature maps and should be used instead.

category.pattern: THIS LAYER TYPE PERFORMS THE SAME FUNCTION AS THE DROPOUT LAYER BUT IT DROPS ENTIRE 1D FEATURE MAPS INSTEAD OF INDIVIDUAL ELEMENTS . FOR EXAMPLE IF AN INPUT EXAMPLE CONSISTS OF 3 TIMESTEPS AND THE FEATURE MAP FOR EACH TIMESTEP HAS A SIZE OF 4 A SPATIALDROPOUT1D LAYER MAY ZERO OUT THE FEATURE MAPS OF THE 1ST TIMESTEPS AND 2ND TIMESTEPS COMPLETELY WHILE SPARING ALL FEATURE ELEMENTS OF THE 3RD TIMESTEP
category.template: This Layer type performs the same function as the Dropout layer, but it drops entire 1D feature maps instead of individual elements. For example, if an input example consists of 3 timesteps and the feature map for each timestep has a size of 4, a spatialDropout1d layer may zero out the feature maps of the 1st timesteps and 2nd timesteps completely while sparing all feature elements of the 3rd timestep.

category.pattern: SPATIAL 1D VERSION OF DROPOUT
category.template: Spatial 1D version of Dropout.

category.pattern: OUTPUT SHAPE : [ BATCHSIZE TARGETSHAPE [ 0 ] TARGETSHAPE [ 1 ] . . . TARGETSHAPE [ TARGETSHAPE.LENGTH - 1 ] ]
category.template: Output shape: [batchSize, targetShape[0], targetShape[1], ..., targetShape[targetShape.length - 1]].

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : ARBITRARY ALTHOUGH ALL DIMENSIONS IN THE INPUT SHAPE MUST BE FIXED . USE THE CONFIGURATION INPUTSHAPE WHEN USING THIS LAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL
category.template: Input shape: Arbitrary, although all dimensions in the input shape must be fixed. Use the configuration inputShape when using this layer as the first layer in a model.

category.pattern: RESHAPES AN INPUT TO A CERTAIN SHAPE
category.template: Reshapes an input to a certain shape.

category.pattern: REPEATS THE INPUT N TIMES IN A NEW DIMENSION
category.template: Repeats the input n times in a new dimension.

category.pattern: OUTPUT SHAPE : SAME RANK AS THE INPUT SHAPE BUT WITH THE DIMENSIONS RE-ORDERED ( I.E . PERMUTED ) ACCORDING TO THE DIMS CONFIGURATION OF THIS LAYER
category.template: Output shape: Same rank as the input shape, but with the dimensions re-ordered (i.e., permuted) according to the dims configuration of this layer.

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : ARBITRARY . USE THE CONFIGURATION FIELD INPUTSHAPE WHEN USING THIS LAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL
category.template: Input shape: Arbitrary. Use the configuration field inputShape when using this layer as the first layer in a model.

category.pattern: USEFUL FOR E.G . CONNECTING RNNS AND CONVNETS TOGETHER
category.template: Useful for, e.g., connecting RNNs and convnets together.

category.pattern: PERMUTES THE DIMENSIONS OF THE INPUT ACCORDING TO A GIVEN PATTERN
category.template: Permutes the dimensions of the input according to a given pattern.

category.pattern: A FLATTEN LAYER FLATTENS EACH BATCH IN ITS INPUTS TO 1D ( MAKING THE OUTPUT 2D )
category.template: A Flatten layer flattens each batch in its inputs to 1D (making the output 2D).

category.pattern: FLATTENS THE INPUT . DOES NOT AFFECT THE BATCH SIZE
category.template: Flattens the input. Does not affect the batch size.

category.pattern: THIS ARGUMENT IS REQUIRED IF YOU ARE GOING TO CONNECT FLATTEN THEN DENSE LAYERS UPSTREAM ( WITHOUT IT THE SHAPE OF THE DENSE OUTPUTS CANNOT BE COMPUTED )
category.template: This argument is required if you are going to connect flatten then dense layers upstream (without it, the shape of the dense outputs cannot be computed).

category.pattern: IF THIS IS TRUE THEN ALL SUBSEQUENT LAYERS IN THE MODEL NEED TO SUPPORT MASKING OR AN EXCEPTION WILL BE RAISED . IF MASKZERO IS SET TO TRUE AS A CONSEQUENCE INDEX 0 CANNOT BE USED IN THE VOCABULARY ( INPUTDIM SHOULD EQUAL SIZE OF VOCABULARY + 1 )
category.template: If this is True then all subsequent layers in the model need to support masking or an exception will be raised. If maskZero is set to True, as a consequence, index 0 cannot be used in the vocabulary (inputDim should equal size of vocabulary + 1).

category.pattern: OUTPUT SHAPE : * 3D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCHSIZE SEQUENCELENGTH OUTPUTDIM ]
category.template: Output shape:* 3D tensor with shape: [batchSize, sequenceLength, outputDim].

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : * 2D TENSOR WITH SHAPE : [ BATCHSIZE SEQUENCELENGTH ]
category.template: Input shape:* 2D tensor with shape: [batchSize, sequenceLength].

category.pattern: FOR INSTANCE IF YOUR INPUTS HAVE SHAPE ( BATCHSIZE TIMESTEPS FEATURES ) AND YOU WANT THE DROPOUT MASK TO BE THE SAME FOR ALL TIMESTEPS YOU CAN USE NOISE_SHAPE = ( BATCH_SIZE 1 FEATURES )
category.template: For instance, if your inputs have shape (batchSize, timesteps, features) and you want the dropout mask to be the same for all timesteps, you can use noise_shape=(batch_size, 1, features).

category.pattern: DROPOUT CONSISTS IN RANDOMLY SETTING A FRACTION RATE OF INPUT UNITS TO 0 AT EACH UPDATE DURING TRAINING TIME WHICH HELPS PREVENT OVERFITTING
category.template: Dropout consists in randomly setting a fraction rate of input units to 0 at each update during training time, which helps prevent overfitting.

category.pattern: APPLIES DROPOUT TO THE INPUT
category.template: Applies dropout to the input.

category.pattern: IF UNSPECIFIED NO ACTIVATION IS APPLIED
category.template: If unspecified, no activation is applied.

category.pattern: NOTE : IF THE INPUT TO THE LAYER HAS A RANK GREATER THAN 2 THEN IT IS FLATTENED PRIOR TO THE INITIAL DOT PRODUCT WITH THE KERNEL
category.template: Note: if the input to the layer has a rank greater than 2, then it is flattened prior to the initial dot product with the kernel.

category.pattern: FOR INSTANCE FOR A 2D INPUT WITH SHAPE ( BATCHSIZE INPUTDIM ) THE OUTPUT WOULD HAVE SHAPE ( BATCHSIZE UNITS )
category.template: For instance, for a 2D input with shape (batchSize, inputDim), the output would have shape (batchSize, units).

category.pattern: ND TENSOR WITH SHAPE : ( BATCHSIZE . . . UNITS )
category.template: nD tensor with shape: (batchSize, ..., units).

category.pattern: THE MOST COMMON SITUATION WOULD BE A 2D INPUT WITH SHAPE ( BATCHSIZE INPUTDIM )
category.template: The most common situation would be a 2D input with shape (batchSize, inputDim).

category.pattern: ND TF.TENSOR WITH SHAPE : ( BATCHSIZE . . . INPUTDIM )
category.template: nD tf.Tensor with shape: (batchSize, ..., inputDim).

category.pattern: BIAS IS A BIAS VECTOR CREATED BY THE LAYER ( ONLY APPLICABLE IF USEBIAS IS TRUE )
category.template: bias is a bias vector created by the layer (only applicable if useBias is true).

category.pattern: KERNEL IS A WEIGHTS MATRIX CREATED BY THE LAYER
category.template: kernel is a weights matrix created by the layer.

category.pattern: ACTIVATION IS THE ELEMENT-WISE ACTIVATION FUNCTION PASSED AS THE ACTIVATION ARGUMENT
category.template: activation is the element-wise activation function passed as the activation argument.

category.pattern: CREATES A DENSE ( FULLY CONNECTED ) LAYER
category.template: Creates a dense (fully connected) layer.

category.pattern: APPLIES AN ACTIVATION FUNCTION TO AN OUTPUT
category.template: Applies an activation function to an output.

category.pattern: IT FOLLOWS : F ( X ) = X FOR X > THETA F ( X ) = 0 OTHERWISE
category.template: It follows: f(x) = x for x > theta, f(x) = 0 otherwise.

category.pattern: THRESHOLDED RECTIFIED LINEAR UNIT
category.template: Thresholded Rectified Linear Unit.

category.pattern: SOFTMAX ACTIVATION LAYER
category.template: Softmax activation layer.

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : ARBITRARY . USE THE CONFIG FIELD INPUTSHAPE ( ARRAY OF INTEGERS DOES NOT INCLUDE THE SAMPLE AXIS ) WHEN USING THIS LAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL
category.template: Input shape: Arbitrary. Use the config field inputShape (Array of integers, does not include the sample axis) when using this layer as the first layer in a model.

category.pattern: RECTIFIED LINEAR UNIT ACTIVATION FUNCTION
category.template: Rectified Linear Unit activation function.

category.pattern: IT FOLLOWS F ( X ) = ALPHA * X FOR X < 0 . F ( X ) = X FOR X > = 0 . WHEREIN ALPHA IS A TRAINABLE WEIGHT
category.template: It follows f(x) = alpha * x for x < 0. f(x) = x for x >= 0. wherein alpha is a trainable weight.

category.pattern: PARAMETERIZED VERSION OF A LEAKY RECTIFIED LINEAR UNIT
category.template: Parameterized version of a leaky rectified linear unit.

category.pattern: IT ALLOWS A SMALL GRADIENT WHEN THE UNIT IS NOT ACTIVE : F ( X ) = ALPHA * X FOR X < 0 . F ( X ) = X FOR X > = 0
category.template: It allows a small gradient when the unit is not active: f(x) = alpha * x for x < 0. f(x) = x for x >= 0.

category.pattern: LEAKY VERSION OF A RECTIFIED LINEAR UNIT
category.template: Leaky version of a rectified linear unit.

category.pattern: OUTPUT SHAPE : SAME SHAPE AS THE INPUT
category.template: Output shape: Same shape as the input.

category.pattern: INPUT SHAPE : ARBITRARY . USE THE CONFIGURATION INPUTSHAPE WHEN USING THIS LAYER AS THE FIRST LAYER IN A MODEL
category.template: Input shape: Arbitrary. Use the configuration inputShape when using this layer as the first layer in a model.

category.pattern: IT FOLLOWS : F ( X ) = ALPHA * ( EXP ( X ) - 1 . ) FOR X < 0 F ( X ) = X FOR X > = 0
category.template: It follows: f(x) = alpha * (exp(x) - 1.) for x < 0, f(x) = x for x >= 0.

category.pattern: EXPONETIAL LINEAR UNIT ( ELU )
category.template: Exponetial Linear Unit (ELU).

category.pattern: LAYERS WILL AUTOMATICALLY TAKE CARE OF CREATING AND INITIALIZING THE VARIOUS INTERNAL VARIABLES / WEIGHTS THEY NEED TO FUNCTION
category.template: Layers will automatically take care of creating and initializing the various internal variables/weights they need to function.

category.pattern: LAYERS ARE THE PRIMARY BUILDING BLOCK FOR CONSTRUCTING A MODEL . EACH LAYER WILL TYPICALLY PERFORM SOME COMPUTATION TO TRANSFORM ITS INPUT TO ITS OUTPUT
category.template: Layers are the primary building block for constructing a Model. Each layer will typically perform some computation to transform its input to its output.

category.pattern: THE INPUTS AND ATTRS OF THE NODE OBJECT IS BASED ON THE TENSORFLOW OP REGISTRY
